title: Marketing Administrative Assistant (Remote)
description:
Who is this role for?



You MUST speak fluent English with clear pronunciation.

You will be speaking to American retirees and pre-retirees in the Southeast United States, so the less strong the accent (clear American-style English), the better.

Experience working as a VA is not required, but it is a plus. If you have experience making outbound calls, appointment confirmations, or updating CRMs, please mention what you did and how long you did it.



What does this job include?



- Outbound confirmation calls for workshop registrations: Call people who already registered for an upcoming educational workshop, confirm you are speaking with the correct person, and confirm whether they are still planning to attend.

- Update CRM based on call result: Mark the registration as confirmed or canceled (and add simple notes if needed).

- New registration data entry: When a new registration comes in, input the information into our CRM (name, guest name, address, phone,
, lead source, and any other fields submitted on the landing page).

- Lead vetting (simple checklist): Confirm the registrant is not currently a life insurance agent (licensed for life insurance) and is not currently a financial advisor.



Company Introduction Video:





All applicants must
 us their resume and a 1-minute video explaining specifically what you learned from the company introduction video above and why you would be a good fit for this role.



We are looking for a VA who can work approximately 30-40 hours per week, with availability during normal U.S. business hours. Hours may vary slightly from week to week depending on workshop volume, but this role requires consistent daily availability. Please do not apply if you currently have another job or cannot commit to being reliably available during the week. 



All applicants send information to:

title: Bookkeeper – Real Estate & Senior Living
description:
How to Apply

Please submit: 



Job Description – Bookkeeper (Real Estate & Senior Living Focus)

Job Title: Bookkeeper – Real Estate & Senior Living

Location: Remote

Hours: Full-time; 40 hours with at least 6 hours each day overlapping with Eastern Timezone

Compensation: Starting pay: $10/hour (hourly contractor role)

Pay model: Moves to a weekly salary after a successful 90-day review

Quarterly merit-based bonuses: Up to the equivalent of 1 week’s pay per quarter if key performance indicators (on-time task completion, accuracy, team attitude, and participation) are met

13th month bonus included (standard for full-time overseas hires)



About Us

At Thrive Bookkeeping LLC, our mission is to deliver specialized bookkeeping for real estate investors, property managers, and senior living businesses. Using proven systems and a diagnostic-first approach, we bring clarity and confidence to messy books so clients can focus on growth.

We live by our values:

Excellence – Accuracy, proactive communication, and thorough preparation.





Discipline – Consistency, accountability, and respecting boundaries (no weekend work unless approved).





Alignment – Clear SOPs and shared goals across clients and team.





Ambition – Supporting client growth while building freedom and profitability.





Impact – Helping businesses thrive by giving them clarity and confidence in their numbers.





We’re not just balancing books—we’re empowering clients with the clarity to expand properties, open new facilities, and scale sustainably.



Responsibilities

As a bookkeeper with Thrive Bookkeeping, you will be responsible for:

Managing day-to-day bookkeeping for real estate investors, property managers, and senior living facilities.





Reconciling bank and credit card accounts.





Handling accounts payable/receivable, payroll support, and sales tax filings as assigned.





Building and maintaining a clean chart of accounts.





Producing accurate monthly financial reports and ensuring they are delivered on schedule.





Supporting client onboarding with account connections in QBO, Keeper, and related systems.





Collaborating with the account manager and team through Slack, Asana, and Notion.





Ensuring compliance with deadlines and bookkeeping best practices.





Participating in cleanups and diagnostics when needed.







Qualifications

We’re looking for someone with:

At least three years of U.S.-based professional bookkeeping experience.





Two years working with real estate, property management, or service-based businesses (preferred).





Proficiency in QuickBooks Online, Keeper, Asana, Slack, and Google Workspace.





Strong knowledge of GAAP and best bookkeeping practices.





Preferred: QBO ProAdvisor certification.





Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.





Strong communication and client-facing ability.





Traits we value: proactive, solutions-oriented, team player, systems thinker.







Work Style & Culture Fit

Comfortable working independently while collaborating closely with an account manager.





Able to manage multiple clients, entities, and deadlines.





Values accuracy, clarity, and proactive communication.





Aligns with our belief: financial empowerment comes from giving clients clarity, not confusion.



Why Work With Us

Flexible remote work.





Growth opportunities with a firm scaling toward a sellable business model.





Quarterly KPI-based bonuses (profitability, timeliness, accuracy).





Chance to help entrepreneurs, investors, and senior living leaders grow wealth and operate confidently.



Our Policy on AI Tools

We recognize that AI and translation tools are widely used by virtual assistants and remote professionals. We believe in being clear about what is acceptable and what is not for this role and interview process:

? Allowed & Encouraged

Using AI for drafting, brainstorming, or improving written communication 
s, SOPs, checklists, documentation).





Using AI to check grammar, spelling, or tone for clarity.





Using AI to speed up repetitive tasks or improve efficiency.





Using captions or transcription tools as a support to follow along in meetings.

?? Limited / Not a Fit

Relying on translation tools for all real-time communication in English. This role requires strong listening comprehension and verbal English without constant translation.





Submitting AI-generated work without editing or adding your own input (we want your human judgment + expertise).





Hiding the use of AI when asked about your process.

???? What to Expect in Hiring

We will analyze written and verbal responses for AI-only content.





Interviews will assess live comprehension (your ability to follow spoken English in real time).





We don’t mind if you use supportive tools during the process — but we need to know you can communicate clearly and independently when the role requires it.



How to Apply

Please submit:

title: No Code Website Builder
description:
About the Role



We are hiring a Website Quality Analyst to review, audit, and validate websites and digital content produced through our internal systems. This role focuses on ensuring that what we create meets clear quality, accuracy, and consistency standards before it is delivered to customers.



This is a remote-only role.



What You’ll Do

• Review and audit websites and web pages created through internal tools

• Validate layout, structure, copy, and basic SEO fundamentals against defined standards

• Make direct edits and corrections when required

• Ensure consistency and clarity across pages within a site

• Perform quality control checks on associated digital content, including social media outputs, to ensure accuracy, formatting, and brand alignment

• Identify recurring issues and edge cases and surface them to improve internal processes

• Follow structured review frameworks while applying judgment in non-standard scenarios



Required Skills and Experience

• Strong attention to detail and high quality standards

• Experience reviewing or editing website content or digital assets

• Confidence making content and structural changes, not just providing feedback

• Strong written English skills and ability to spot errors and unclear messaging

• Working knowledge of basic SEO concepts (headings, metadata, page intent)

• Ability to work through checklists, guidelines, and QA workflows reliably



Nice to Have

• Experience working with CMS platforms or website builders

• Background in quality assurance, content review, or editorial roles

• Experience reviewing digital or social content from a quality control or compliance perspective

• Familiarity with small business websites



Working Hours and Location

• Remote role based in the Philippines

• Core working hours aligned with EST

• First two weeks of training may require availability during PST hours

title: Vendor Management Agent
description:
The Vendor Management Agent acts as the primary operational link between our global suppliers and internal stakeholders. This role is responsible for maintaining the health of our supply chain by managing technical workflows in OrderDesk, overseeing shipping logistics via EasyPost, and proactively resolving vendor-related friction to ensure a seamless customer journey.

Key Responsibilities

Systems Management: Administer day-to-day order flows within OrderDesk, including rule configuration, split-testing order routing, and troubleshooting synchronization errors.

Logistics Coordination: Utilize EasyPost to monitor shipping labels, track carrier performance, and resolve "dead" tracking numbers or transit delays before they impact the customer.

Sample & Quality Control: Coordinate the intake and review of product samples from vendors; provide detailed feedback loops to ensure production matches approved specifications.

Capacity Planning: Maintain a regular cadence with vendors to assess production capacity and "holiday readiness," ensuring our sales forecasts align with their current labor and material availability.

Root Cause Liaison: Conduct "post-mortem" reviews on bulk errors or recurring quality issues, working directly with vendor floor managers to implement permanent corrective actions.

SKU & Metadata Management: Ensure all vendor-specific SKUs, cost prices, and shipping weights are accurately mapped and updated across all platforms to prevent margin erosion.

Required Qualifications

Experience: 1+ years in e-commerce operations, vendor relations, or logistics coordination.

Technical Stack: * Advanced Proficiency: OrderDesk (Rule builder, inventory syncing) and EasyPost (Label generation, API tracking).

CRM/Support: Salesforce, Zendesk, or HubSpot.

Analytical Mindset: Ability to interpret shipping data and fulfillment logs to identify vendor bottlenecks.

Preferred Skills

Experience in the Print-on-Demand (POD) or drop-shipping industry.

Understanding of API-based order workflows and how data moves between storefronts and production facilities.

title: CRO & E-Commerce Optimization Manager
description:
We are a fast-growing e-commerce brand focused on delivering high-quality products and exceptional customer experiences. We’re looking for an experienced CRO & E-Commerce Optimization Manager to own and improve the performance of our online store.



This is a high-impact role focused on optimizing the customer journey, increasing conversion rates, and driving measurable improvements across the entire e-commerce funnel. You’ll work hands-on within Shopify, using data and experimentation to continuously enhance site performance.



This role is ideal for a data-driven professional with strong expertise in e-commerce analytics, customer behavior, and conversion optimization methodologies.



Responsibilities

• Maintain, update, and QA product pages, landing pages, navigation, bundles, and onsite merchandising to ensure accuracy and brand consistency.

• Improve onsite content quality through SEO best practices, including metadata optimization, internal linking, and CMS organization.

• Adapt and refine landing pages for paid media campaigns with a strong focus on page speed, mobile experience, and accurate tracking.

• Maintain weekly tracking sheets and clearly report on core funnel metrics and performance trends.

• Verify analytics implementation, pixel setup, UTMs, and key integrations across launches and site updates.



Requirements

• 3–4 years of experience in Shopify site management and e-commerce CRO optimization.

• Experience in the health & wellness or consumer goods industry.

• Deep experience with Shopify theme editing, CMS management, metafields, templates, and subscription funnel UX.

• Hands-on experience running A/B tests using common experimentation platforms.

• Strong proficiency in GA4 and e-commerce funnel performance analysis.

• Solid understanding of SEO fundamentals including metadata, schema, alt tags, and internal linking.

• Advanced proficiency in Google Sheets or Excel for tracking and reporting.

• Ability to lightly edit HTML and CSS, with familiarity in Liquid.

• Strong working knowledge of Shopify and related tools for onsite updates, optimization, and QA.

• Experience with CRO and analytics tools such as testing platforms, behavior analytics, and tracking systems.

• Familiarity with lifecycle tools including
/SMS platforms and onsite forms.

• Experience working with UTMs, pixel tracking, and session replay tools.

• Proficiency in Google Workspace, Asana, and Slack.

title: Senior Graphic Designer with Modern Skill with AI Prompting Master Skils and proven experience with Amazon
description:
ABOUT US



Since 2013, Prodigy Media has built more than brands — we've created an Amazon-native empire. With 12 years of proven success and 28+ product lines under our belt, we don't play small. Our mission? Launch culturally resonant, design-led, emotionally sticky products that dominate Amazon and beyond.



Now, we're leveling up — and we want a design assassin who’s mastered AI workflows, commands Midjourney like a wizard, and turns prompts into visual gold.



WHO WE WANT



This is not your average graphic design role. We're looking for a hybrid Creative Director / Prompt Engineer / Graphic Design savant who can:



Think like a marketer. Design like an artist. Prompt like an AI god.



You’ll own the visual storytelling for our brands, using both traditional tools and bleeding-edge AI systems to pump out Amazon-optimized assets that convert.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



Craft Ultra-High-Converting Amazon Ads – static, lifestyle, 
-tier, and scroll-stopping. Own A+ Content Design – full module execution with story arcs that build obsession. Design Labels & Packaging – pixel-perfect, regulatory-ready, and unforgettable on the shelf. Prompt, Edit & Produce AI-Generated Visuals – using tools like Midjourney, DALL•E, Runway, Spline, Veo3, Sora, and others. Run 3D Product Renders – via Blender, KeyShot, or AI-powered 3D tools. Develop Scroll-Hook Videos – using After Effects, Premiere, Runway AI, etc.



Systematize Brand Visuals Across 30+ Products – while keeping it all aligned, emotional, and conversion-focused.



WHO YOU ARE



5+ years in design, at least 2+ years in Amazon/e-commerce brand creative

Fluent in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Blender, After Effects

Pro-level Midjourney / AI prompt engineer – this is non-negotiable

Obsessed with Amazon visual psychology, packaging psychology, and design that sells

Able to juggle 10 brands and still hit deadlines

Operate with a Creative Director mindset — not just execution, but strategy

Bonus: Experience creating creative systems, art direction templates, or leading a team



MUST-HAVES

Portfolio with Amazon ads, A+ pages, labels, 3D renders, videos, and AI-gen examples

Real-world use of AI tools integrated into your workflow

Available Mon-Fri 5:00am–2:00pm PST

title: Secretary/Outbound Sales
description:
Sales Secretary/Outbound sales

POSITION SUMMARY

The Sales Representative for Rocky Mountain Outdoor Living is responsible for following up on leads who engage in our products and convert them into customers. Duties will include reaching out to current and potential clients, cold leads, qualifying, and setting appointments. 



ABOUT THE COMPANY

Our mission is to transform the lives of our employees and customers through building and maintaining dreams. Regardless of the size and complexity, we offer the best service possible when it comes to lawn maintenance, landscaping design, property renovations, pools, brick and stone construction, and masonry and concrete. We challenge ourselves to be great and the best version of ourselves through individual personal, professional, and financial goals and the impact we have in the landscaping space. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are aligned, disciplined, results oriented, inspirational, impactful, and accountable. 

OBJECTIVES

Maximize sales opportunities by scheduling appointments with senior sales staff and hosting virtual presentations initially until you can do it by yourself.

Manage pipeline of qualified prospects using company CRM and perform daily review of leads and lead sources.

Answer all miner clients questions 

Sell and or reactivate clients over the phone. 

Handle inbound calls and schedule 

Scan client messages and calls to update where clients are at to properly update their pipeline.

Meet daily KPI's and monthly/quarterly Sales Targets.

Be a contributing member of the Sales Team in revenue, culture, and brand image.

Communicate the company’s value propositions to all clients.

Follow up with clients 

Attend and participate in internal meetings and complete required trainings 

Perform other related duties as assigned by management

100 outbound calls a day 



COMPETENCIES

Ability to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner; gather and analyze information skillfully; develop alternative solutions; work well in group problem-solving situations

Ability to adapt to changes in the work environment; manage competing demands; change approach or method to best fit the situation; able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events

Willingness to make decisions; exhibits sound and accurate judgment; supports and explains reasoning for decisions

Demonstrate persistence and overcome obstacles; measure self against standard of excellence.

Organization Skill to ensure all duties are performed in timely manner 

Communication skills 

Prioritize and plan work activities; use time efficiently; set goals and objectives; organize or schedule other people and their tasks.



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Associates degree in Horticulture preferred

2 years experience as designer

2  years experience working in the construction industry preferred 



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer









COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, Lawn Brothers Landscaping recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.

title: Finance / Bookkeeping Virtual Assistant
description:
The Finance Virtual Assistant will handle day-to-day financial and accounting tasks, helping ensure accurate records, timely invoicing, smooth payroll coordination, and clear job cost tracking. This role works closely with company leadership, project managers, and external accountants.



ABOUT THE COMPANY

Our mission is to transform the lives of our employees and customers through building and maintaining dreams. Regardless of the size and complexity, we offer the best service possible when it comes to lawn maintenance, landscaping design, property renovations, pools, brick and stone construction, and masonry and concrete. We challenge ourselves to be great and the best version of ourselves through individual personal, professional, and financial goals and the impact we have in the landscaping space. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are aligned, disciplined, results oriented, inspirational, impactful, and accountable.



Key Responsibilities



Finance virtual assistants manage a range of duties, including bookkeeping, invoicing, and reconciliations. Common tasks involve processing accounts payable and receivable, tracking expenses, preparing financial reports, and handling client communications like
s and calls. They also support budgeting, data entry, research on industry trends, and month-end closes while ensuring compliance with basic financial standards.



-Bookkeeping & Accounting

-Record and categorize financial transactions

-Maintain accurate general ledger entries

-Reconcile bank and credit card statements

-Track expenses, equipment, and operating costs

-Accounts Payable

-Process vendor and subcontractor invoices

-Schedule and track payments

-Maintain vendor records and W-9 documentation

-Accounts Receivable & Invoicing

-Prepare and send customer invoices (progress billing, retainage, final invoices)

-Track outstanding invoices and follow up on collections

-Maintain AR aging reports

-Payroll & Labor Cost Tracking

-Collect and verify employee and crew timesheets

-Assist with payroll processing

-Track labor costs by job or project

-Support certified payroll or prevailing wage reporting (if required)

-Job Costing & Reporting

-Track costs by project (labor, materials, equipment, subcontractors)

-Assist with job cost vs. estimate reports

-Prepare weekly and monthly financial reports (P&L, cash flow, job cost reports)

-Compliance & Organization

-Maintain organized digital financial records

-Support sales tax tracking

-Prepare documentation for CPA or tax professionals



Required Qualifications

2+ years experience in bookkeeping, accounting, or finance support

Experience supporting U.S.-based businesses



Strong knowledge of:

-Accounts Payable & Accounts Receivable

-Job costing (construction or landscaping preferred)

-Proficiency in QuickBooks Online or Desktop

-Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills

-High attention to detail and accuracy

-Reliable internet and secure remote workspace



Work Schedule & Compensation:

-Remote position

-U.S. business hours 

-Competitive pay based on experience

-Long-term opportunity for the right candidate





COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, Lawn Brothers Landscaping recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.

title: Personal Assistant / Customer Support & Data Admin (SaaS Platform)
description:
Remote (Philippines) | UK Working Hours (GMT/BST)

Full-Time | Long-Term Role



About The Role



We are hiring a reliable, detail-oriented Personal Assistant to support our growing SaaS platform, TyreOps.



This role combines:



Database and product administration



Live chat support



Customer phone support



Lead capture and booking



General administrative tasks



You will work directly with the founder (Joe) and follow clear guidance and structured processes.



Initially, you will use documented reply guides and scripts. Over time, you will handle more queries independently.



Accuracy, reliability, and process-following are essential.



Working Hours



Must work UK business hours (GMT/BST)



Daily working overlap with Joe required



Stable internet connection required



Quiet working environment required



Please apply only if you can consistently work UK hours long-term.



Responsibilities

1) Tyre Database Administration (Accuracy-Focused)



You will:



Cross-check tyre listings



Add missing tyres to the internal system



Update existing records (EAN numbers, specifications, attributes)



Research and verify product data online



Use AI tools (ChatGPT or similar) to speed up research where helpful



Flag unclear or conflicting information (never guess)



This role requires strong attention to detail and a careful working style.



2) Live Chat Support (Existing and Prospective Customers)



You will:



Reply to live chat using provided guidance



Handle common queries independently



Escalate complex questions with clear context



Maintain and improve the internal Reply Bank



Reuse approved responses for recurring questions



Strong written English is essential.



3) Phone Calls – Existing Customers



You will:



Answer inbound support calls



Record issues clearly and accurately



Respond using guidance where appropriate



Log unresolved issues correctly



Schedule callbacks with clear summaries and urgency levels



Structured note-taking is critical.



4) Phone Calls – Prospective Customers (Lead Capture and Booking)



You will:



Answer inbound enquiries professionally



Follow a qualification script



Capture complete lead information



Create or update leads in Pipedrive CRM



Book demo meetings or schedule callbacks



Information to capture:



Name



Company






Telephone



Website



Current system or process (job system, inspections, invoicing)



Invoicing software (QuickBooks, Sage, Xero, etc.)



What they are looking for in TyreOps



Next step (demo booking or callback)



You must be confident on the phone and comfortable asking structured questions.



5) General Administration (Ad Hoc)



Tasks may include:



Updating documents



Scheduling



Follow-ups



Organising notes



Basic research



Tools used in this role:



TyreOps internal system



Pipedrive CRM



Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Calendar)



Live chat platform



AI tools such as ChatGPT



Working Style Expectations



Escalation rule:

Only answer if guidance covers it and you are confident. If unsure, log and escalate clearly.



Documentation mindset:

Build reusable notes and improve documentation over time so the role becomes more efficient.



Requirements:



Strong written and spoken English



Professional phone confidence



Quiet workspace



Reliable headset



Stable internet connection



High attention to detail



Consistent process-following



Nice to Have



VA or SaaS customer support experience



CRM experience (Pipedrive preferred)



Experience working UK hours



Experience supporting UK or European customers



How to Apply



Please include all of the following:



Short introduction and relevant experience



Confirmation you can work UK hours (GMT/BST)



Your availability (days and times)



Your internet speed (screenshot preferred)



Your headset setup



Short written sample:



Reply to: “Do you integrate with QuickBooks?”



Optional but helpful:



Short voice recording (30–60 seconds introduction)



Applications missing these details will not be considered.



Trial Task (Shortlisted Applicants)



Shortlisted candidates will complete:



A small tyre data enrichment task



Several mock live chat replies



A structured call summary



This is a long-term opportunity for someone dependable and detail-focused.



If you are structured, reliable, and confident on calls, we encourage you to apply.

title: BDR- Outbound Cold Caller (Real Estate) – Part-Time | Fully Remote
description:
About Us



Smart Setter is a trailblazing real estate technology company based in Canada, known for its innovative solutions and fast-paced environment. We specialize in revolutionizing outbound recruiting calls for real estate brokers across North America.



With over 4 million successful conversations with real estate professionals, we are the trusted partner for brokers seeking top-tier agents for their offices.



Position Details



Role Type: Part-Time (Fully Remote)



Schedule: 8:00 AM – 1:00 PM EST



Compensation: $500/month + performance-based commission



Role Overview



As an Outbound Cold Caller, you will be responsible for building a strong pipeline of qualified leads for real estate brokerages across North America. You will conduct high-volume outbound calls, engage real estate professionals using a structured script, and coordinate appointments to ensure successful follow-through.



This role requires making approximately 150–200 calls per day and consistently achieving weekly performance targets.



Key Responsibilities



Conduct outbound calls using our auto-dialer system



Follow a pre-written script to engage potential realtors



Build and maintain a strong pipeline of qualified leads



Set and confirm appointments between brokers and agents



Meet weekly targets of 10–15 booked appointments



Track performance and maintain required KPIs



Qualifications



Fluent in English with strong verbal communication skills



Proven experience in cold calling, telemarketing, or sales



Confident handling objections and rejection



Highly organized with strong time management skills



Self-motivated and results-driven

Please ensure you meet the following technical specifications before applying:



PC or Mac with audio capabilities



Quality headset



Strong, reliable internet connection (hardwired required)



Quiet, professional work environment



Intel i5 CPU (or AMD equivalent) 2.0GHz Quad Core or better



Minimum 8GB RAM



At least 20GB free disk space



Windows 10 or Mac OS 10.12 and above



Application Instructions

Your updated resume



A cover letter



A 60–90 second audio recording via 

 answering:

Your key achievements and core skills



Your salary expectation

We look forward to hearing from motivated professionals ready to grow with Smart Setter

title: Full-Time Accountant/Bookkeeper
description:
Full-Time Accountant/Bookkeeper

US-Based Interior Design & Property Management Company

Location: Remote (Philippines-based preferred)

Schedule: Full-Time, Eastern Time hours (8AM - 5PM EST)

Compensation: $800 - $1,500 USD/month (based on experience and qualifications)



About the Company

We are a growing US-based company operating in both interior design and property management sectors. We work with residential and commercial clients across the United States, managing design projects, client relationships, and property operations. As we continue to scale, we need a skilled accountant/bookkeeper to maintain our financial accuracy and support our business operations.



The Role

We're seeking an experienced Accountant/Bookkeeper to manage the financial operations of our business. This is a critical role that requires someone detail-oriented, experienced with US accounting practices, and capable of managing multiple projects and accounts simultaneously.



You'll be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, managing invoicing and payments, tracking project budgets, and ensuring our books are clean and compliant. You'll work closely with our US-based CPA who will ultimately create the financial statements. This role will primarily support our design business operations but may also assist with property management accounting as needed.



Key Responsibilities



Accounts Receivable (AR):

Generate and send client invoices accurately and on time

Track outstanding invoices and follow up on overdue payments

Process and record incoming payments

Reconcile client accounts and resolve payment discrepancies

Maintain organized records of all receivables



Accounts Payable (AP):

Process vendor invoices and expense reports

Schedule and execute timely vendor payments

Reconcile vendor statements and resolve billing issues

Track and categorize all business expenses

Maintain vendor records and payment history



QuickBooks Management:

Maintain accurate and up-to-date QuickBooks records

Perform monthly bank and credit card reconciliations

Generate financial reports (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)

Track and categorize all transactions

Ensure QuickBooks data integrity and accuracy



Project Financial Tracking:

Track project budgets and expenses for design projects

Monitor project profitability and cost overruns

Provide financial updates to project managers

Maintain detailed project cost records

Support project billing and invoicing



Banking & Cash Flow:

Monitor bank account balances and cash flow

Process ACH transfers, wire payments, and checks

Manage multiple business bank accounts

Track deposits and withdrawals

Coordinate with payment processors (Stripe, PayPal, Venmo, etc.)



CPA Liaison:

Act as liaison with our US-based CPA

Prepare and organize financial data for CPA review

Provide documentation and information as requested by CPA

Ensure books are accurate and ready for financial statement preparation



General Accounting:

Month-end and year-end closing procedures

Maintain general ledger accuracy

Process journal entries as needed

Support audit preparation if required

Respond to financial inquiries from management



Required Qualifications:

3+ years of accounting/bookkeeping experience (US-based companies preferred)

Proficient in QuickBooks Online (must have hands-on experience)

Strong AR/AP experience (invoicing, collections, vendor payments)

Knowledge of US accounting practices and tax systems

Experience with US payment systems (ACH, wire transfers, checks, PayPal, Stripe)

Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (pivot tables, formulas, financial modeling)

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

Strong organizational skills - can manage multiple deadlines

Excellent written English communication (C2 Level)

Available to work Eastern Time business hours



Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

CPA or bookkeeping certification

Experience with design/creative industry accounting

Experience with property management or real estate accounting

Familiarity with project-based accounting and job costing

Experience with multiple QuickBooks company files

Knowledge of Avalara (sales tax automation)

Experience with bill payment platforms (
, Melio, etc.)

Familiarity with expense management tools





Work Schedule & Expectations:

Schedule: Monday - Friday, Eastern Time business hours

8:00 AM - 5:00 PM EST

Must be available during US business hours for timely client invoicing and vendor payments

Some flexibility within Eastern Time zone hours

Time Commitment: Full-time (40 hours/week)



Work Environment:

Fully remote position

Must have reliable high-speed internet

Dedicated, quiet workspace required

Professional communication setup (computer, headset for calls if needed)



Compensation & Benefits

Salary Range: $800 - $1,500 USD/month

Additional Benefits:

Paid time off (vacation and sick leave)

Holiday pay

Performance-based bonuses

Opportunity for salary increases based on performance

Long-term growth potential as company scales



About Working With Us



Company Culture:

Small, collaborative team environment

Direct access to company leadership

Your work directly impacts business decisions

We value accuracy, integrity, and proactive communication

We invest in the right tools and systems to help you succeed



Growth Opportunity:

As we grow our design business and scale from ~30 properties to 50+ our c-hosting business, this role will expand

Potential to manage a team as we grow

Opportunity to shape our financial systems and processes

Long-term career growth for the right person



Why Join Us:

Work with US-based business and gain valuable experience

Exposure to both design and property management industries

Modern tools and systems (we don't cut corners on software)

Supportive team that values your expertise

Stable, growing company with long-term vision



Application Process

To apply, please submit:

1. Updated resume/CV highlighting:



2. Cover letter (brief) addressing:

- Why you're interested in this role

- Your experience with US accounting and tax systems

- Your availability to work Eastern Time hours

- Your expected salary within the $800-$1,500 range



3. Skills assessment responses(Recorded via Loom; max 5 minutes):

- Question 1: Describe your QuickBooks Online experience. What specific tasks have you performed?

- Question 2: How do you handle AR collections? Describe your process for following up on overdue invoices.



4. Work sample (optional but preferred):

If you have a sample financial report (P&L, Balance Sheet) you've created, please include it (remove any confidential client information)



How to Apply

Submit your application through OnlineJobs.ph attaching all requirements.

Questions?
: 



What Happens Next

Application Review: We'll review your resume and responses (1-3 days)

Initial Interview: 15-20 minute video call to discuss your experience and availability

Final Interview: 30-45 minute discussion about the role, compensation, and fit

Offer: Job offer extended to selected candidate



We're looking for someone who can grow with us long-term. If you're detail-oriented, experienced with US accounting, and ready to take ownership of our financial operations, we want to hear from you!



Apply now and help us build a solid financial foundation as we scale.

, paid ads, and content platforms

title: Remote React Native & iOS Developer (Long-term Partnership Potential)
description:
Hey there!



I’m Roland. We are looking for a Remote Frontend-focused Developer to join our team of 5.

For me personally, it is especially important to build a long-term trusting work relationship. You should play a decisive role in ensuring that our products grow and our users love them.



You can work from wherever you want, if you have a good internet connection. In this role, you'll be responsible for building high-quality mobile apps with React Native, and potentially a React web frontends.



Formal Education and certificates:

We don’t care about certificates and formal education if the personality fits and the code is good.



Your personality:

You are self-motivated and proactive. We don't believe in micromanagement, so you need to take the initiative to identify things for acting and finishing. Get things done.



Strong communication skills are essential (fluent written and spoken English). It implies finding out if you need more information for a task in the first place, and ensuring your code and documentation are clear.



You must be comfortable with change and able to adapt to new technologies. Crucially, you must embrace AI. You use tools like Claude, Cursor, or Codex to speed up development. We don't see this as cheating; we see it as efficiency. You should be an action-oriented individual who thrives on implementing and achieving tangible results, in time.



Your responsibilities:



First phase:

Dive into our current project: A React Native app for iOS and Android. You will work heavily with React Native and Expo.

The core challenge here is the iOS Native Audio Stack, so solid expertise in Swift is essential. You will replicate existing UI/UX patterns and ensure the product feels premium.

Collaborate with the team but organize your own time efficiently.



Second phase – over time:

Become my trusted technical "wingman."

Take ownership of the frontend architecture. Use your keen eye for design aesthetics to improve the UX without needing constant direction.

Ideally, you bring experience with LegendApp/legend-state, NativeWind, and Storybook to the table to streamline our workflow even further.



Third phase – my hope:

I hope for a phase 3 where we can work more as a Partnership if you have this ambition and we feel the trust. Even with a share in profit.

We envision this role growing alongside our projects. As we expand, there will be opportunities for you to take on more responsibilities, possibly progressing to a lead developer role.



My business for what I hire:

We are a remote team of 5 building high-quality mobile apps and web projects. We are currently focused on:



- Mobile App Development (iOS/Android) with React Native

- Web Projects with React

- Building products people love



We offer:

To be part of interesting projects in a dynamic environment.

Totally freedom of the work schedule, if the tasks and projects are completed on time and the communication flows.

We value results over hours. If you use AI and your expertise to produce the results very efficiently, I'm also happy with 4h work instead of 8h.

The opportunity to work remotely, and live where you want.



I would love if we develop to work more as a Partnership (share from the profit), after we have established a strong trusting work relationship.

My key point is a long long long term trusting work relationship.



If you think you'd be a good fit for this role, we'd love to hear from you. Please send us your portfolio/GitHub/App Store Links and a brief note explaining why you're interested.



What do you prefer, a performance-related pay, a fixed salary, or a combination?



We're excited to hear from you!

title: Website & E-Commerce Specialist
description:
We’re looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Website & E-Commerce Specialist to work closely with our team on building, managing, and improving our website from scratch— and specifically with e-commerce capabilities. 



This role is ideal for someone who is technically capable, organized, and comfortable wearing multiple hats: website creation, online store setup, basic backend operations, and light collaboration with a medical-focused business. 



You don’t need to be a medical expert—but you should be comfortable working around medical terminology, services, and compliance-adjacent content.

title: Part Time Virtual Assistant
description:
Summary

I’m looking for a long-term Virtual Assistant who is highly skilled, reliable, and ready to become a core part of my team.

This role is a mix of personal assistant + business assistant, so I need someone who is organized, proactive, and truly cares about representing the brand with excellence.



Position Overview



You will support daily operations in my business, help manage content, and assist with personal admin tasks. This is a long-term role with consistent hours and growth opportunities. I need someone who takes initiative, communicates clearly, and can think ahead—NOT someone who needs to be micromanaged.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

Device Requirements

    •    Must own an iPhone

    •    Must have fast & stable internet (minimum 40 Mbps)

    •    Must have a quiet work environment



Skills & Technical Requirements

    •    English: 10/10 (written and spoken)

    •    Highly skilled in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

    •    Highly skilled in Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Calendar)

    •    Experience with saving, organizing, managing files inside Google Drive

    •    Strong project management & task tracking ability

    •    Ability to follow SOPs, checklists, and detailed instructions

    •    Fast learner with a high attention to detail



Social Media Skills

    •    Basic social media management experience (Instagram, TikTok,
, YouTube)

    •    Ability to:

    •    Organize content

    •    Upload content

    •    Write simple descriptions (no cheesy captions needed)

    •    Schedule posts

    •    Track engagement



Personality Traits



This role is NOT for everyone. You must be:

    •    Extremely organized

    •    Caring and emotionally intelligent

    •    Able to understand and protect the brand voice

    •    Loyal, honest, and trustworthy

    •    Not afraid to ask questions when needed

    •    Able to work without constant supervision

    •    Willing to grow with the company long-term







Responsibilities



Your daily tasks may include:

    •    Managing Google Drive, creating folders, organizing documents

    •    Updating spreadsheets, tracking tasks, and taking notes during meetings

    •    Helping manage daily scheduling and reminders

    •    Social media content organization and uploads

    •    Communicating with other tea
mbers

    •    Light customer support when needed

    •    Keeping the team aligned and on track

    •    Assisting with personal errands (online-based)

    •    Helping with business projects and following detailed SOPs

    •    Research tasks, data entry, and administrative duties as needed







Pay & Hours

    •    Competitive hourly rate based on experience

    •    Long-term position

    •    20–40 hours per week depending on performance

    •    Bonuses for consistency, loyalty, and strong work ethic







To Apply (MUST Answer All Questions)



Please answer ALL of the following to be considered:

    1.    What iPhone model do you currently use?

    2.    What is your current internet speed? (Please attach a screenshot from speedtest.net)

    3.    Rate your English speaking & writing skills from 1–10.

    4.    How strong are you with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint? (Rate each 1–10)

    5.    How strong are you with Google Docs, Sheets, and Drive? (Rate each 1–10)

    6.    Do you have experience with social media management? If yes, explain what tasks you handled.

    7.    Why do you believe you’re a great fit for a long-term personal assistant role?

    8.    Are you available for long-term work (12+ months)?

    9.    What is your expected hourly rate?

   10.   In a short paragraph, describe your previous experiences that can be relevant to the position you are applying for.

title: Sales & Applications Engineer (DIRECT CLIENT)
description:
(Electrical Engineering background preferred)



We are seeking a technically competent Engineer — preferably with an Electrical Engineering background — to work closely with Voltech (
) in a combined Sales and Applications Support capacity.



This is not an administrative sales role. The position requires a technically capable individual who can confidently engage with engineers and manufacturers, understand their test setups, and provide practical application guidance both before and after the sale.



The successful candidate will act as a technical bridge between customers, the sales team, and Voltech’s engineering and service departments.



Role Overview

The Sales & Applications Engineer is responsible for supporting both prospective and existing customers through pre-sales consultation and post-sales technical assistance.



This includes:

Understanding the customer’s test environment, setup, and application requirements

Advising on appropriate Voltech product configurations

Assisting Sales Administration with technical inquiries

Providing first-line troubleshooting and application guidance

Escalating verified issues to engineering when required

The role requires analytical thinking, electrical test knowledge, and the ability to interpret schematics, wiring configurations, and test parameters.



Key Responsibilities

Pre-Sales / Sales Engineering Support

Respond to pre-sales technical inquiries and guide customers on product capabilities and suitability

Engage with customers to understand their setup, test objectives, wiring configuration, and measurement requirements

Assist Sales Admin when customers raise technical questions beyond basic commercial details

Prepare and issue quotations for custom test fixtures based on customer requirements and technical specifications

Coordinate or conduct pre-sales testing of customer samples when required

Work directly with Voltech to clarify technical feasibility and configuration details



Applications & Post-Sales Support

Provide technical support via
, phone, Microsoft Teams, or TeamViewer

Assist customers with product setup, configuration, and troubleshooting

Replicate customer issues where possible using similar setups or customer samples

Offer application guidance for transformer testing and wound component measurements

Escalate confirmed bugs or product issues to the development/engineering team

Provide updates to customers regarding bug fixes or technical resolutions

Collaborate with Service Administration for warranty claims and RMA coordination



Ideal Candidate Profile

Degree in Electrical Engineering or related technical field

Strong understanding of electrical test principles, measurement systems, or transformer/wound component testing (preferred)

Comfortable communicating with engineers and technical manufacturers

Able to interpret schematics and technical specifications

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills

Professional communication skills for customer-facing interactions



Kindly send your CV LINK. NO CV LINK - skipped.

title: E-Commerce Recruiter
description:
About the Role

We’re looking for an experienced E-commerce Recruiter with a strong track record of hiring for digital commerce businesses in the U.S.

In this role, you’ll lead the full recruitment lifecycle for e-commerce and digital roles — from sourcing and screening to interview coordination and offer close. You’ll work directly with founders, operators, and leadership teams to understand their hiring needs and deliver candidates who are both technically strong and commercially aligned.

This role is ideal for someone who understands the e-commerce ecosystem, thrives in a fast-moving environment, and knows how to identify and engage high-quality talent across commercial, marketing, operational, and technical functions.



Core Responsibilities

• Source, screen, and recruit e-commerce professionals for U.S.-based companies.

• Own the full-cycle recruitment process, including job intake, sourcing strategy, candidate outreach, interview coordination, and offer negotiation.

• Build and maintain strong talent pipelines using LinkedIn Recruiter, Workable, and other sourcing platforms.

• Develop tailored sourcing strategies for various e-commerce roles (e.g., Digital Marketing, Performance, Operations, Product, Tech, Customer Experience).

• Conduct structured interviews to evaluate technical capability, business acumen, and culture alignment.

• Partner with the People & Compliance team to ensure smooth onboarding and documentation processes.

• Track recruitment metrics and provide consistent updates on pipeline health and hiring progress.

• Stay informed on e-commerce hiring trends, compensation benchmarks, and evolving market demands.



Requirements/Must-Haves

• 3–5 years of experience recruiting e-commerce or digital business roles for U.S.-based companies.

• Strong understanding of e-commerce-related roles such as E-commerce Manager, Digital Marketing Manager, Performance • Marketer, CRM Specialist, Marketplace Manager, UX/UI, Product, and Operations positions.

• Proven ability to manage multiple roles and stakeholders simultaneously.

• Hands-on experience with ATS platforms (Workable preferred) and sourcing tools like LinkedIn Recruiter.

• Strong communication and relationship-building skills with both candidates and hiring stakeholders.

• Fluency in English (bilingual English/Spanish is a plus).

• Full-time availability aligned with U.S. business hours (PST overlap required).



Nice-to-Haves

• Experience recruiting remote e-commerce talent in LATAM or the Philippines.

• Familiarity with independent contractor hiring models and compliance considerations.

• Experience working with DTC brands, marketplaces (Amazon, Shopify, Walmart), or omnichannel businesses.

• Background in high-growth companies, startups, or performance-driven environments.

title: Franchise Sales Representative
description:
We are 1-Tom-Plumber, one of the fastest-growing plumbing franchise brands in the United States, and we are hiring highly motivated Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) to help us expand nationwide. 



This is a full-time, work-from-home outbound sales role where you will reach out to business owners, entrepreneurs, plumbers, restoration companies, electrical companies, HVAC companies, and construction companies to introduce them to the 1-Tom-Plumber franchise opportunity and book qualified appointments for our U.S.-based franchise development team. 



Your daily responsibilities include high-volume cold calling, LinkedIn outreach,
 campaigns, SMS follow-ups, lead qualification, and maintaining an organized pipeline inside our CRM. 



We are looking for A-players with strong English communication skills, confidence on the phone, a great work ethic, and experience in appointment setting, outbound prospecting, or B2B sales. This role offers a base salary plus bonuses for every qualified appointment and additional bonuses for closed franchise deals, giving you the opportunity to earn significantly more based on performance. 



We provide scripts, training, tools, and a long-term career path with room for promotions into Senior SDR and Team Lead positions. If you are hungry, coachable, disciplined, and ready to join a fast-paced U.S. brand with major growth potential, this is your chance to build a high-income sales career with 1-Tom-Plumber.

title: Ads Manager
description:

We’re looking for a junior Meta Ads Manager who is coachable, hungry, and ready to level up fast.

???? What You’ll Be Responsible For

Weekly performance analysis



Monthly reporting

Clients staying long-term because performance is strong

???? Who This Is For



You have experience running Meta ads (not just boosting posts)



You understand pixels, custom conversions, and attribution



You’ve worked inside Ads Manager before



You’re highly coachable

Leadership growth



Long-term role expansion

Base pay (competitive for junior level)



Performance-based bonuses for hitting KPIs



Growth-based compensation increases



Top performers will earn more.

Remote position.

Must be responsive and available during standard business hours.

To be considered, you must submit:



Your resume



A 1-minute Loom video answering:

If you’re hungry, coachable, and ready to level up your skill set fast — apply.



If you’re average, this won’t be for you.

title: Product Manager - SaaS
description:
gigCMO is a dynamic growth consultancy providing strategic marketing leadership and expertise to start-ups, scale-ups, and SMEs, propelling them toward profitable revenue growth. Nestled in the heart of the City of London, United Kingdom, we specialise in supporting B2B clients in expanding their reach domestically and internationally. Our dedicated team, operating under the banner of Magnacca International, is strategically based in the Philippines. We chose this location for its pool of talent, strong social skills, enthusiasm, and unwavering loyalty.



We are seeking a dedicated and dynamic Product Manager to lead and enhance our Digital Church Platform®. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing the product development lifecycle, managing development resources effectively, and ensuring rigorous final testing processes before releasing software updates. You will also play a critical role in translating the strategic vision held by the founder into actionable roadmaps and product deliverables.



Key Responsibilities:



- Manage the Product Development (PD) pipeline, ensuring alignment with organisational goals.

- Prioritise and allocate development resources efficiently to align with strategic priorities.

- Conduct comprehensive final testing and quality assurance to guarantee smooth, error-free software updates before public release.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to deliver product enhancements that meet user needs and drive platform adoption.

- Communicate clearly and proactively with stakeholders regarding project timelines, milestones, and release schedules.

- Translate strategic vision and high-level ideas from leadership into actionable product roadmaps, user stories, and specifications. 

- Facilitate clear and consistent communication between non-technical stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring all parties are aligned.

- Set up and manage internal systems (e.g. Basecamp and HubSpot) to track backlog, sprints, and milestones.

- Gather feedback from churches and users to shape future features and improvements. 

- Monitor product performance or user feedback loops to inform decisions and prioritisation. 

- Monitor incoming requests via helpdesk and chat channels, triage issues, and ensure timely resolution either directly or by coordinating with the development team.



Qualifications:



- Proven experience in Product Management, ideally within digital platforms or SaaS environments.

- Strong organisational skills with an ability to manage multiple development priorities simultaneously.

- Exceptional attention to detail, particularly in software testing and quality assurance.

- Demonstrable capability in managing software product lifecycles effectively.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, able to engage stakeholders at various levels.

- Previous experience in digital community platforms or faith-based digital services is advantageous but not essential.

- Experience writing product requirements, specs, and user stories to support development.

- Understanding of user needs in faith-based or nonprofit contexts, particularly around compliance, admin, or community tools, is highly desirable. 

- A mindset geared toward scalability, continuous improvement, and hands-on problem solving in an early-stage SaaS environment.



Application Requirements:



- This role demands a full-time commitment and is not compatible with another full-time job. To be considered, kindly fill out the form using this link: 

- Incomplete submissions will not be considered.



Compensation: Php 30,000 - 40,000 (depending on whether the applicant meets 100% of the requirements)

title: LinkedIn Engagement and Community Specialist
description:
Role Overview:



We are seeking a 
munity Manager with a proven track record to lead and enhance our social media presence on LinkedIn. This role is pivotal in driving brand visibility, fostering meaningful engagement, and contributing to business growth. You will work closely with our content and copywriting teams to transform content into engaging LinkedIn posts, strategically incorporating tags, hashtags, and other platform-specific features. If you are looking for a traditional "lead generation" role, this position is not for you.



Key Responsibilities:

Strategic Content Management: Collaborate with our content and copywriting teams to adapt and optimise content for LinkedIn, ensuring posts are engaging and aligned with our strategic goals. This includes selecting appropriate tags, hashtags, and other LinkedIn features to maximise reach and impact.

Engagement and Community Building: Actively engage with new and existing audiences by initiating conversations, tagging relevant individuals and organisations, and fostering meaningful interactions that drive brand awareness and community growth.

Trend Monitoring and Adaptation: Stay ahead of industry trends and LinkedIn platform updates, using insights to recommend new strategies and content formats that keep our brand relevant and engaging.

Performance Analysis: Regularly track and analyse LinkedIn metrics, providing actionable insights and reports to refine our content strategy and optimise engagement.

Collaborative Integration: Work seamlessly with internal teams to ensure LinkedIn initiatives align with broader marketing strategies, contributing to the overall success of our campaigns.

Key Skills and Competencies:

Content Optimisation: Ability to work with content and copywriting teams to turn content into engaging LinkedIn posts, utilising tags, hashtags, and other features to enhance visibility.

Analytical Mindset: Proficient in using LinkedIn metrics and analytics to drive performance improvements and inform content strategies.

Collaborative Spirit: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, integrating LinkedIn efforts with broader marketing and business goals.

Proactive and Trend-Focused: A keen eye for spotting emerging trends on LinkedIn and the initiative to implement them in our strategies.

Strong Communication: Excellent written communication skills, with an emphasis on clarity, creativity, and attention to detail.

Organisational Skills: Capable of managing multiple tasks and projects simultaneously while maintaining a high level of quality and consistency.



Qualifications and Experience:



Professional Experience: Minimum of 2 years managing LinkedIn accounts for businesses or clients.

Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.

Platform Proficiency: In-depth knowledge of LinkedIn’s platform features, tools, and best practices.

Content Optimisation: Experience in adapting and optimising content for LinkedIn to enhance engagement.

Analytical Skills: Demonstrable experience with LinkedIn metrics and analytics for performance tracking and improvement.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
We’re looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer to help build and maintain an AI-native product used by real customers in complex, high-stakes environments. This role is product-focused and execution-heavy, ideal for an engineer who enjoys shipping features, fixing real-world issues, and improving systems that people depend on daily.



You will work on a mix of new feature development and ongoing product maintenance, supporting an AI-powered platform that turns scattered organizational knowledge into usable, structured answers. You will not be operating in a vacuum. Designs, direction, and architectural guidance already exist. Your job is to help turn that into reliable, scalable product functionality.



If you enjoy full-stack work, moving quickly with clear direction, and contributing to a meaningful AI product without reinventing everything from scratch, this role is a strong fit.



Why You’ll Want to Join

- You will be paid in USD (bi-monthly: every 15th and 30th)

- Up to 14 days of Paid Time Off annually (starting Day 1)

- Observance of Holidays per company guidelines

- 100% remote setup so you can work wherever you’re most productive

- Work on a real AI product serving government and enterprise customers

- Clear scope, strong technical guidance, and product-driven priorities

- Opportunity to grow as a product engineer inside an AI-first company



What You’ll Work On



Full-Stack Product Development

- Build and ship full-stack features for an AI-native platform

- Implement product designs using React and TypeScript on the front end

- Develop and maintain backend services using Node.js

- Work within existing architecture while contributing clean, maintainable code

- Turn well-defined requirements into working product features efficiently



Maintenance and Product Hardening

- Fix bugs and address issues in existing production systems

- Improve configurability and self-service capabilities for customers

- Support updates and refinements required for ongoing customer use

- Help keep the platform stable, reliable, and easy to operate



Collaboration and Execution

- Work closely with US-based engineers on scoped feature work

- Follow established patterns and architectural guidance

- Communicate clearly about progress, blockers, and tradeoffs

- Contribute to documentation and handoffs when needed



Infrastructure Support (Secondary)

- Assist with infrastructure-related tasks as needed

- Help deploy tools or support foundational infrastructure work when scoped

- Collaborate with infra-focused contractors or engineers as required



What You Bring

- 6+ years of experience as a software engineer working on production systems

- Strong experience building full-stack applications

- Proficiency with React, TypeScript, and Node.js

- Comfort working within an existing codebase and improving it incrementally

- Ability to debug issues, ship fixes, and move features forward independently

- Clear written and verbal communication skills

- Experience working in product-driven or startup environments



 Nice to Have

- Experience working on AI-powered or data-heavy products

- Familiarity with government, enterprise, or compliance-driven systems

- Exposure to infrastructure or deployment workflows

- Experience supporting long-lived products, not just greenfield builds



How to Apply



Please include:

1. Your updated resume

2. A short 1 to 2 minute Loom video introducing yourself and describing a full-stack product you’ve worked on, including what you owned and shipped



Only candidates who submit a Loom video will be considered.





If you enjoy building real product features, improving existing systems, and contributing to an AI platform that helps organizations actually use their knowledge, this role offers clear scope, strong support, and meaningful impact without chaos.

title: B2B Sales Newsletter Curator (20hrs/week) - $600/mo
description:
About the Role: I publish a daily B2B sales newsletter. I need someone with excellent curation skills who can find high-quality, tactical sales content from LinkedIn, YouTube, and podcasts.



This role is 90?out having an eye for GOOD content vs. BS content and working in a structured, consistent way. 



Your job: find the best B2B sales content on the internet and summarize it for my newsletter using AI and a fixed format.



MANDATORY APPLICATION TEST:



To assess your ability to curate great sales content, please send links to the following 16 pieces of content (8 for the first topic and 8 for the second):



Topic 1: LinkedIn Prospecting



1.) YouTube: Find one video (< 6 months old).



2.) Podcast: Find one episode on 
 (< 3 months old).



3.) LinkedIn: Find 6 posts from the last month. (4 posts can be shorter/video as they won't be summarized, 2 must be longer cornerstone posts with deeper information as they will be summarized).



Only use these creators: 





Search terms: LinkedIn prospecting, prospect, Sales Nav, LinkedIn outreach.



Topic 2: Discovery Calls



1.) YouTube: Find one video (< 6 months old).



2.) Podcast: Find one episode on Podchaser (< 3 months old).



3.) LinkedIn: Find 6 posts from the last 7 days. (4 posts can be shorter/video as they won't be summarized, 2 must be longer cornerstone posts with deeper information as they will be summarized).



Only use these creators: 





Search terms: Discovery, discovery calls, disco.



_________________

Content Guidelines:

- Freshness: LinkedIn (max 1 month), YouTube (max 6 months), Podcasts (max 3 months).



- B2B Only: Target audience is employed sales reps and managers. No insurance, real estate, B2C, e-comm, or agency-focused content.



- Tactical sales advice with specific steps, examples, etc. No generic rules or opinions.



What Makes Content BAD:



-. Agency self-promotion disguised as "tips."

- Generic motivational garbage/mindset.

- Outdated tactics or negative/cynical hot takes.



What Makes Content GOOD:



- Contains actual, specific, applicable sales advice.

- Tactical and actionable (not theory).

- Not overly promotional and not negative/clickbait.



Main Points:

- B2B sales experience (SDR, AE, BDR) strongly preferred.

- Long-term role starting immediately.

- Fully flexible hours. Work whenever you want as long as the draft is ready by 6 AM CET. You can batch 2-3 newsletters ahead if you need to take days off. Otherwise, I prefer you work daily for about 4 hours (Mon-Fri).



Reach out if you have any questions!

title: Long form and short form video editor and social media manager
description:
I’m looking for an experienced long-form and short-form video editor, as well as a social media manager, to help grow my travel YouTube channel.  The focus is always on experiences, real conversations, real environments, and strong narratives.



The workflow will be:

- One long-form YouTube video every other day (15–30 minutes)

- One short-form video every day

- Short-form content will be posted across YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, and
.



I will provide raw 4K footage along with some guidance. You’ll be responsible for identifying the strongest 
nts — conversations, visuals, narrative arcs — and shaping them into engaging content. It is also important to be able to do proper colour correction, audio clean-up, subtitles or on-screen text where useful (translations, currency conversions, context, etc.).



I will create the thumbnails and captions, but once we establish a style, consistency across uploads is important.



You will also be responsible for uploading the content after approval. This includes writing descriptions, adding hashtags, and making sure everything is optimised for each platform.



I’m looking for someone with:

- Proven experience editing both long-form and short-form content

- A strong understanding of what performs well across platforms

- Experience with social media management

- The ability to handle large 4K files and work with cloud-based workflows

- Strong written and spoken English

- Clear communication skills

-Reliability, someone ready for a full time, long term job



 I want someone I can communicate with openly and consistently. Daily communication (multiple check-ins) is part of this. You should be comfortable receiving feedback and making efficient revisions.



This is a long-term, full-time role (48 hours per week). Work hours will be tracked. The expected output is one long-form video every other day and one short-form video daily. 



Since this is a full time role, other jobs done alongside this job is not appropriate for this role.



It’s important to me that we work well together and build something long term. 



Please send:

- Your portfolio

- Your availability

- Wifi speed



Please do not use AI to respond. I understand the value of AI tools, but I’m looking for a genuine human response.



Thank you.

title: Youtube editor for short and long form
description:
I am looking for an experienced editor and PA to help run my travel YouTube channel.



The channel focuses on cultural exploration, real-world experiences, and honest, story-driven content rather than over-edited or gimmicky videos.



The goal is to publish one long-form YouTube video every day, along with two short-form videos taken from the same (or additional) footage and posted across YouTube Shorts, Instagram, TikTok, and
.



The role involves taking raw travel footage and turning it into engaging, well-paced stories. You’ll be responsible for choosing the strongest 
nts, conversations, and visuals, editing one long YouTube video per day (roughly 15–50 minutes), and creating two short clips per day. The editing style should stay clean and natural, with light colour correction, audio clean-up, and subtitles or on-screen text added where helpful (for example, translations, currency conversions, or extra context). You’ll also create thumbnails and captions, keep a consistent style across uploads, upload content once revisions are approved, and manage the YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok accounts. From time to time, I’ll also need help with content research or other small tasks.



I’m looking for someone with proven editing experience in both long and short-form content (a portfolio is required), who understands what works across different platforms without chasing trends for the sake of it. Strong storytelling judgement, cultural awareness, clear communication, and the ability to work to daily deadlines are all very important to me. Time zone awareness matters, as does being comfortable handling large files and cloud-based workflows. You must be fluent in written and spoken English and able to take feedback on board and make effective revisions.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to grow with the channel. You’d be working closely with me, so it’s important that we get on well and communicate openly.



Any questions, feel free to ask.



I realise the power of large language models, but please don't use ai for your response to me this time. I want real human responses, thank you.

title: Ad video editor
description:
Video Editor (Short-Form & Long-Form Content)



Offer Scalers



About Us



We are Offer Scalers, a rapidly growing company specialising in building and managing info product funnels for online coaches. We work with high-profile clients, such as Eddie Abbew, and are committed to delivering exceptional results. 



We’re looking for a sharp, dedicated Video Editor to join our team. This is a fast-paced environment for someone who takes massive pride in the quality and logic of their work.



Our Company Culture:



Client Success: We put results above everything else. We go the extra mile to ensure the highest quality.

Personal Growth: We expect every tea
mber to refine their craft and grow alongside us.

Speed of Execution: We act with urgency. We value efficiency without sacrificing our high standards. 



Procrastination has no place here.



Role Overview



We are looking for an experienced Video Editor to create short-form ads, YouTube content, and testimonial clips.



This is a thinking role. You aren't just a "cutter." 



You will be responsible for taking audio (generated via ElevenLabs) and building a high-converting video ad around it. You must use your brain to decipher the script and select the specific b-roll from our library that perfectly matches the context of what is being said.



**CRITICAL REQUIREMENT**: Your English must be of an extremely high standard. Our content is seen by millions; therefore, we have ZERO tolerance for spelling mistakes or grammatical errors in captions.



Key Responsibilities:



High-Context Ad Creation



Workflow: Take audio files (often generated via ElevenLabs) and turn them into compelling ads.



Editorial Judgment: Use our b-roll folders and find your own b-roll and select footage that matches the script. The visuals must make sense with the audio.



Variations: Create multiple versions of ads (e.g., testing 5 different hooks) and keep files strictly organised.



Editing Client Testimonials & Social Clips



Edit and caption clips from Zoom calls (e.g., Eddie Abbew’s community calls) to create engaging testimonial videos.



Use Canva to clean up screenshots of testimonials for professional marketing use.



YouTube Management:



Edit long-form YouTube videos (simple cuts and captions).

Upload directly to YouTube



Quality Control & Branding



Flawless Spelling: If you are unsure of a word, you must look at the script or research it. No excuses for typos.



Formatting: Ensure captions are positioned so they aren't covered by TikTok/Instagram UI buttons.



Consistency: Maintain professional colours, fonts, and proportions at all times.







Requirements & Tools



Experience: At least 1 year in video editing and basic graphic design.

Language: Flawless written English.** You must be a perfectionist regarding grammar.

Creative Logic: The ability to understand a script and choose visuals that support the narrative.



Tools:

CapCut (Required)

ElevenLabs (Required)

Canva (Required)


 (Preferred)



Compensation



Commitment: Full-time, retainer-based role.

Bonuses: Available for exceptional reliability and consistently error-free work.



---



TEST TASK:



To assess your skills, please complete this specific task. We are looking for attention to detail.



Audio & B-Roll: 



Script: 



Your Instructions:



1. Audio Cleanup: Cut out all dead air and long pauses. The pacing must be snappy.

2. Visual Logic: Use the provided B-Roll. Select footage that accurately matches the script. Do not use random clips.



We have provided a library of over 190 assets in the B-roll folder. The best way to approach this is to skim through and "feed your brain" with all the footage we have first; that way, when you are editing the script, you know exactly which clips will fit the context. Do not use random clips. Select footage that accurately matches the narrative of the script.



3. Caption Styling: You must follow this brand kit:



* **Font:** Helvetica 75

* **Color:** Pure White

* **Style:** No stroke (no outline).

* **Effect:** A slight black glow/soft shadow for readability.





4. Accuracy Check: Ensure every word is spelt correctly. One typo = Disqualification.



Submission: Please upload your edit to Google Drive and send us the download link.
