title: Experienced Meta Ads Manager (Facebook & Instagram) – Data-Driven | Part-Time | Long-Term
description:
10–15 Hours Per Week | $5–$7/hr | Performance-Focused Role



We are a growing U.S.-based home services company seeking a highly skilled Meta Ads Manager with proven, data-driven experience running profitable campaigns.



This is not a “boost posts” role.

We are looking for someone who understands tracking, testing, and scaling.



If you make decisions based on numbers — not guesses — keep reading.



Role Overview



You will be responsible for managing and optimizing our
 and Instagram ad campaigns to generate qualified leads at a profitable cost.



We value structured testing, disciplined analysis, and clear reporting.



This is a long-term opportunity for the right person.



Responsibilities



Build, manage, and optimize Meta ad campaigns



Develop structured A/B testing plans



Monitor and improve cost per lead



Optimize targeting, creatives, and copy



Set up and verify tracking (Pixel, conversions, etc.)



Analyze data and make strategic adjustments



Provide clear weekly performance reports



Recommend scaling strategies based on performance



Required Experience



2+ years running Meta ads professionally



Proven track record of generating leads



Strong understanding of conversion tracking



Experience with data analysis and performance reporting



Ability to explain strategy clearly and concisely



Strong English communication skills



You must be comfortable discussing:



Cost per lead



ROAS



Conversion rates



Scaling strategies



Audience segmentation



To Be Considered



Include the following in your application:



A short video introduction (2–3 minutes)



Screenshots of past campaign results (blur sensitive data)



A brief explanation of:



Your testing strategy



How you lower cost per lead



A campaign you successfully scaled



Applications without proof of results will not be reviewed.



Position Details



10–15 hours per week



Flexible schedule



$5–$7 per hour (based on experience)



Must be aavailable 1-2 times per week during US business hours for zoom calls.

title: Operations Leader (Global, High-Accountability Role)
description:
DAP Brands is seeking a high-level Operations Leader to serve as the Engine Room of our company and turn strategic vision into daily reality.



While the CEO focuses on where we are going, you are responsible for how we get there.



You will oversee the entire operational ecosystem: synchronizing global teams, breaking down silos, and ensuring the business runs like a well-oiled machine. This role is for a leader who thrives behind the scenes, finding satisfaction in flawless execution, optimized workflows, and a scoreboard that consistently shows green.



To be considered for this role, you MUST put: I AM A MAVERICK before your name on our Careers website (
/careers). Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed. Attention to detail is non-negotiable for this role.



What You’ll Own:

- Full operational oversight across departments, teams, and time zones

- Translation of company strategy into clear processes, systems, and execution plans

- End-to-end workflow optimization to eliminate inefficiencies and bottlenecks

- Accountability frameworks, KRIs, dashboards, and scorecards

- Cross-functional alignment between leadership, managers, and frontline teams

- SOP creation, enforcement, and continuous improvement

- Operational cadence: weekly reviews, metrics tracking, execution follow-ups

- Proactive identification of risks, gaps, and execution failures before they escalate



What Success Looks Like:

- Teams execute consistently without micromanagement

- Deadlines are hit, priorities are clear, and handoffs are seamless

- Metrics are visible, tracked, and improving month over month

- The CEO spends less time fixing execution issues and more time scaling the business

- Operations run smoothly even in high-pressure, fast-growth periods



Who We’re Looking For:

- Proven operations leader with experience managing complex, multi-team environments

- Strong systems thinker who naturally spots inefficiencies and fixes them

- Highly organized, decisive, and execution-obsessed

- Comfortable holding people accountable: calm, fair, and firm

- Excellent communicator who can align teams without drama

- Experience working with global or remote teams is a strong plus



This Role Is NOT For You If:

- You prefer strategy discussions over execution

- You avoid difficult conversations or accountability

- You need constant direction instead of owning outcomes

- You’re uncomfortable with metrics, dashboards, and performance tracking



Why Join DAP Brands?

- Work directly with a visionary CEO and leadership team

- High-impact role with real authority and ownership

- Opportunity to build and scale world-class operational systems

- Performance-driven culture that values results over noise

title: Proofreader / Publisher & Executive Assistant
description:
We move fast. We ship a lot. Excellence is the bare minimum.



We’re hiring a detail-obsessed Proofreader / Publisher & Executive Assistant to be the final set of eyes before anything goes live. Nothing ships without you.



You are the quality gate.



You are also operational glue for leadership.



What You’ll Do



You will proof, correct, and publish across:



• Website pages (no broken links, no placeholder text, no formatting issues)

• Meta and Google ads (correct location, targeting, compliance, copy)

• Social media posts (accurate captions, tags, formatting)

• Landing pages and automations in GoHighLevel

•
 campaigns and newsletters



If something isn’t finished, you send it back. If something is wrong, you fix it or flag it.



You will also:



• Organize and maintain ClickUp boards

• Track deliverables and ensure nothing slips

• Assist the executive team with high-level administrative tasks

• Help build internal systems that support growth

• Support hiring, documentation, and operational organization



What This Role Requires



• Extreme attention to detail

• Strong written English

• Comfort in WordPress, GHL, Meta Ads Manager, and Google platforms

• Ability to follow and improve QA checklists

• High ownership and accountability

• Calm execution under pressure

• Administrative precision and organizational strength



This is not a creative-first role. It’s a precision and operations role.



Compensation & Benefits



• Quarterly profit-sharing bonuses

• Three weeks of paid vacation

• The week between Christmas and New Year’s off

• All major U.S. holidays off



At Whoosh, we offer autonomy, high standards, and meaningful upside. That only works if the work is airtight.



If you want to be the reason things go out clean, polished, correct, and organized — we want to talk.

title: Financial Analyst with Salesforce Exp
description:
Overview:



We are seeking a highly driven and strategic Financial Analyst to serve as a key partner to the executive leadership team. This role is ideal for a finance professional who combines strong technical expertise with business acumen and thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven environment. The successful candidate will transform complex financial data into meaningful insights, enabling informed decision-making that supports organizational growth, operational excellence, and long-term profitability.



Job Title: Financial Analyst

Location: Fully Remote

Job Type: Full-Time



Key Responsibilities



Executive Financial Partnership

Act as a trusted financial advisor to the CEO by delivering high-impact analysis, forecasts, and strategic recommendations.

Translate financial data into executive-ready insights that drive performance, scalability, and sustainable growth.

Develop financial models to support investment decisions, operational initiatives, and long-term planning.



Strategic Analysis & Business Intelligence



Identify emerging trends, risks, and opportunities through advanced financial and operational analysis.

Research market dynamics, competitor positioning, and industry benchmarks to strengthen strategic direction.

Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate business health and guide leadership decisions.



Syndication Leadership



Oversee syndication processes, ensuring seamless coordination between lenders, investors, and internal stakeholders.

Manage the preparation of documentation, payment processing, and distribution with precision and timeliness.

Safeguard compliance with syndication agreements and applicable regulatory standards.



Commission Oversight



Administer commission structures with accuracy and transparency.

Ensure timely calculations and disbursements while continuously improving process efficiency and controls.

Financial Accounting & Reporting Excellence

Lead Financial Accounting and Reporting activities, ensuring accuracy, integrity, and adherence to best practices.

Prepare executive-level financial reports, dashboards, and presentations that clearly communicate performance, forecasts, and strategic implications.

Strengthen reporting frameworks to enhance visibility and support data-driven leadership.



Operational Efficiency & Systems



Utilize advanced Excel capabilities to build dynamic financial models and automate reporting workflows.

Leverage QuickBooks expertise to maintain reliable financial data and support the full cycle of accounting.

Perform thorough bank reconciliations and implement controls that promote quality and financial accuracy.

Continuously identify opportunities to optimize financial processes and elevate reporting standards.



Required Skills & Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.

Minimum of 3+ years of progressive experience in financial analysis, accounting, or financial management.

Demonstrated expertise in the full cycle of accounting, including reconciliations, reporting, and close processes.

Strong foundation in Financial Accounting and Reporting within a growth-oriented organization.

QuickBooks Certification or advanced working knowledge required.

Proven commitment to quality, accuracy, and strong internal controls.

Exceptional communication skills with the ability to influence and engage executive stakeholders.

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including complex formulas, PivotTables, and financial modeling.

High level of analytical rigor with the ability to synthesize complex data into clear strategic insights.

Strong organizational skills with the capacity to manage multiple priorities independently.



Preferred Leadership Traits



Executive presence with a proactive, solutions-oriented mindset.

Strategic thinker capable of balancing big-picture vision with meticulous execution.

High degree of professionalism, discretion, and integrity when handling confidential financial information.

Adaptable, resilient, and comfortable operating in a dynamic, high-growth environment.

Collaborative partner who builds strong cross-functional relationships.

title: Remote Digital Marketing - Full Time and Long Term Contract
description:
Are you interested in becoming a highly effective marketing professional? Do you want to learn and grow personally, professionally, and financially? If so, then this Remote Digital Marketing Assistant contract is the right one for you!



We are a SaaS Startup, seeking a Remote Digital Marketing Assistant for high revenue growth for 2026 and the years beyond.



Are you?



· Inspired: You have a burning desire to do great things and to grow!

· Thoughtful: You have a healthy sense of self and how your life impacts the world around you.

· Skillful: You are dedicated to what you do. You love working on the edge of your comfort zone and embrace risk and failure head on.

· Chill: You approach work with a love for life, respect for peers, and a healthy dose of fun!



Do you also have these skills?



· Strong desire to become a great digital marketing professional; effectively convey the value of our service to potential clients, generating leads!

· Excited to work in an entrepreneur environment with weekly leads goals and aspired to beat the goals week by week.

· Excellent writing skills.

· Technology savvy!

· Attention to detail and follows tasks and projects through to completion.

· Excited to learn digital marketing, a very new and changing marketing discipline.

· Eager to learn and improve. Highly trainable.

· Having a 4-year Bachelor's Degree.



Contract Responsibilities, after 3-month Training, May Include:



· Generating more leads via search marketing.

· Build and maintain sales funnels to maximize conversion rate.

· Generating more leads via Content Marketing.

· Advocate clients to write online reviews for our great service.

· Create highly desirable content via pillar blogs to generate leads.

· Produce regular reports and statistics on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis.

· Support sales operations

· At least 40 hours per week!



What You'll Own After Training:



We'll equip you to master:

· Lead generation through strategic search marketing: SEO and AEO (AI Engine Optimization)

· Multi-channel prospect engagement 
, DM, phone)

· Content creation that converts 

· Marketing funnel optimization for maximum ROI

· Cold outreach strategies that actually work

· Data-driven reporting (daily, weekly, monthly analytics)

· Full-time commitment: 40 hours weekly for long-term growth



Your Growth Path & Compensation:



This position has great GROWTH potential:

· Trainee: Foundation Level - $7/hour minimum

· Level 1: Entry Professional - $8/hour minimum

· Level 2: Intermediate Specialist - $9/hour minimum

· Level 3: Advanced Specialist - $11/hour minimum

· Level 4: Master Marketer - $13/hour minimum

· Level 5: Authority Expert - $15/hour minimum



Extraordinary Benefits:



· Embracing AI technology in everything we do.. 

· The company is managed by trusted and ethical professional Managers.  

· Great training and development program.

· Growth: higher level contract, more responsibilities, better pay.

· Strong support from the team: from all tea
mbers, including Recruiting and Training Manager Role, and the company President.

· 6 paid US National Holidays off - we offer this to our contractors!.

· 5 paid personal days off accrued during Year 1.  10 paid personal days off accrued during Year 2 and after.



Our Culture & Values:



This is where you'll thrive in an environment built on:

· Genuine work-life harmony

· Transparent, empathetic communication

· Continuous professional development

· Cutting-edge remote work technology

· True team connection (no isolation here!)

· Uncompromising integrity

· Data drive, instead of ego driven.



A Thorough Recruiting Process as this Role is Critical:



We are not hiring a contractor.  We are hiring a LONG TERM PARTNER who will help us to define our new startup. Hence, we have a through recruiting process:

· A survey.

· A work sample

· Video Interview

· 1st Interview via Zoom

· 2nd Interview via Zoom

· A Simulation Conversation



This process shows how important this contract is!



This is a positive, healthy, trust based environment.



We are looking for a smart, forward-thinking problem - solver to join our small crazy team! Or a crazy small team. Works both ways actually!



Okay, we've said enough. Your turn :- )

title: Shopify & CheckoutChamp Developer
description:
We're looking for a developer who lives and breathes CheckoutChamp and Shopify.



---



What You'll Own



- Build and maintain all web pages, funnels, and checkout flows - in CheckoutChamp & Shopify

- Set up and configure CheckoutChamp's CRM platform: product settings, campaign settings, and integrations

- Code custom checkout experiences optimized for conversion and speed

- Ensure every page is responsive, fast-loading, and bug-free across all devices

- Code all Shopify pages/sections in JSON for ease of access inside the Shopify CMS

- Work alongside our design and strategy team to bring briefs to life—and push back when something doesn't make sense from a development perspective

- Maintain clean version control and documentation so nothing depends on tribal knowledge



---



Requirements



- 2+ years of hands-on experience with CheckoutChamp—setting up the platform, building funnels, and coding custom checkouts

- 2+ years working with Shopify stores

- Fluent in Liquid, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS

- Ability to code easily customizable sections in Shopify (using JSON)

- Experience coding checkout flows and CRM configurations in CheckoutChamp specifically

- Comfortable working asynchronously with a remote team across multiple timezones



---



This Is NOT For You If:



- You don't have real, hands-on experience with CheckoutChamp

- You can't create customizable sections in Shopify

- You're not responsive—we need someone who replies within hours, not days

- You're unorganized or regularly miss deadlines

- You see development as just "making things look good" rather than driving conversions

- You're not comfortable communicating with non-technical people



---



What We Offer



- Potential full-time remote position after trial period

- Work directly with a small, high-output team that’s growing fast

- One brand, one mission—no client juggling

- Opportunity to own and shape the entire technical infrastructure as the company scales



---



Hiring Process:



1. Submit your application

2. Initial screening call

3. Technical assessment task

4. Initial paid trial period



We move fast. If you're the right fit, you'll know within a week.



---



How to Apply:



If this sounds like you, please fill out the form below and you will hear back from us soon!

title: Amazon FBA and FBT Inventory  and Logistics Manager
description:
Inventory Forecast & Tracking Manager



Remote | Full-Time | Mon–Fri, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST (10:00 PM – 6:00 AM Manila Time)



We are looking for a highly detail-oriented Inventory Forecast & Tracking Manager to oversee inventory planning, forecasting, and logistics across Amazon FBA, TikTok Shop (FBT), Shopify, Walmart, and other sales channels.



This role is critical to maintaining in-stock levels, preventing stockouts, and ensuring smooth coordination between purchasing, warehouse, and marketplace operations.



Key Responsibilities



Monitor daily inventory levels across all marketplaces and warehouses



Forecast demand and create accurate purchase orders (POs) based on sales velocity and lead times



Track and schedule stock replenishment to Amazon FBA and TikTok FBT



Manage shipment timelines, receiving, and reconciliation



Handle Amazon FBA logistics, reimbursements, and discrepancy tracking



Coordinate closely with warehouse, production, and operations teams for product availability and issues



Ensure inventory quantities are accurate and updated across Shopify, Walmart, and other platforms



Maintain organized tracking systems and reporting in Google Sheets and Google Docs



Provide regular inventory health reports, risk alerts, and reorder recommendations



Requirements



Proven experience in inventory planning, logistics, or supply chain (eCommerce preferred)



Strong knowledge of:



Amazon Seller Central (FBA logistics & reimbursements)



TikTok Shop Seller Center & FBT fulfillment



Multi-channel inventory management (Shopify, Walmart, etc.)



Advanced proficiency in Google Sheets (formulas, tracking dashboards, forecasting)



Excellent attention to detail, organization, and communication



Ability to work night shift Manila time consistently



Experience with Hubstaff or similar time-tracking tools preferred



Success Metrics



Maintain healthy in-stock rates across all SKUs



Prevent stockouts and overstock situations



Accurate forecasting and timely PO creation



Clean reconciliation of FBA/FBT discrepancies and reimbursements



Clear, consistent inventory reporting to leadership

title: B2B Copywriter for Sales Messages
description:
•APPLICANTS WHO APPLY THROUGH THE LINK BELOW WILL BE SCREENED•



About us:

gigCMO Ltd. is a HubSpot Gold Partner. We are a dynamic growth consultancy providing strategic marketing leadership and expertise to start-ups, scale-ups, and SMEs, propelling them toward profitable revenue growth. Nestled in the heart of the City of London, United Kingdom, we specialise in supporting B2B clients in expanding their reach domestically and internationally. Our dedicated team, operating under the banner of Magnacca International, is strategically based in the Philippines. We chose this location for its pool of talent, strong social skills, enthusiasm, and unwavering loyalty.



Key Responsibilities:

**Develop Persuasive Copy: Write clear, compelling, and persuasive sales copy for a variety of outbound channels, including
 campaigns, cold outreach, direct mail, and social media.



**Understand Target Audience: Conduct research to understand the pain points, needs, and desires of our target audience and tailor copy accordingly.



**Collaborate with Lead Gen and HubSpot Teams: Work closely with the Lead Gen and HubSpot teams to align copy with overall strategies and goals.



**Create Engaging Content: Develop attention-grabbing subject lines, headlines, and calls to action that encourage engagement and conversion.



**Optimise for Performance: Continuously test and optimise copy to improve open rates, click-through rates, and conversion rates.



**Stay Up-to-Date: Keep up with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in copywriting and outbound sales strategies.



Qualifications:

**Strong Writing Skills: Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills, with a keen eye for detail.



**Sales Experience: Proven understanding of sales principles and a track record of crafting copy that drives action.



**Minimum Experience: At least 5 years of relevant experience in copywriting or related fields.

title: HubSpot Specialist

title: HR Adminstrator
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The HR Administrator is responsible for building, documenting, organizing, and facilitating the execution of People Advisory deliverables across multiple clients. This role supports the Director of People in the design and delivery of onboarding plans, job descriptions, Employee Maturity Models (EMM), organizational charts, compensation frameworks, and structured HR tools.



This individual ensures that client orders (tickets) are executed with precision, speed, and consistency within established KPIs. They operate as the systems backbone of the People Advisory function, transforming strategy into structured, documented, client-ready deliverables.



This is a highly independent role requiring strong organizational discipline, business acumen, and process thinking. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, manages ambiguity well, and can translate complex people strategy into structured, usable tools.



ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, disciplined, accountable, transparent, aligned, and results oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.







SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

- Client deliverables are built, formatted, and prepared on time within KPI expectations

- Onboarding plans, JDs, org charts, and EMMs are structured, standardized, and scalable

- People Advisory tickets move efficiently from intake ? build ? review ? client delivery

- Process templates are continually refined to reduce build time and increase quality

- The Director of People operates at a higher strategic level due to execution leverage

- No deliverables stall due to administrative breakdowns or workflow confusion

- Quality control standards are maintained across all outgoing materials



OBJECTIVES

- Facilitate the build and preparation of all People Advisory client deliverables within designated turnaround KPIs.

- Draft structured onboarding plans aligned to role, industry, and client maturity.

- Build and format job descriptions using standardized People Advisory templates.

- Develop Employee Maturity Models (EMM) customized to client organizational stages.

- Create and maintain organizational charts reflecting client growth and reporting structures.

- Manage intake workflow of People Advisory tickets from multiple departments.

- Ensure deliverables are properly formatted, quality checked, and client-ready prior to Director review.

- Maintain documentation systems for templates, revisions, and client version control.

- Track project timelines and follow up on internal dependencies to avoid delays.

- Identify inefficiencies in current People Advisory build processes and recommend improvements.

- Maintain organized storage of all client documentation across platforms (Drive, Asana, LMS, etc.).

- Reduce Director of People, Core Client Operations review and edit time by increasing first-draft accuracy and completeness.



COMPETENCIES

- Strong business acumen and understanding of organizational structure

- Process design and workflow thinking

- Advanced written communication and formatting skills

- High attention to detail and quality control discipline

- Proficiency in project management software (Asana or similar)

- Proficiency in Google Workspace (Docs, Slides, Sheets)

- Ability to translate strategic direction into structured documentation

- Time management in a fast-paced, multi-client environment

- Analytical thinking and structured problem-solving

- Comfort working independently with minimal supervision

- Template development and document standardization capability

- Professional judgment when handling sensitive HR-related materials



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

- Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Human Resources, Organizational Development, or related field preferred

- 2–5 years experience in HR Operations, People Operations, Business Operations, or Process Administration

- Experience building job descriptions, onboarding programs, or organizational documentation preferred

- Experience supporting consulting, advisory, or multi-client environments is a strong plus

- Experience working within KPI-driven environments preferred



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

- Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer



COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY



As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.



If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, please complete the online application form:


/

title: OpenClaw Security & Deployment Specialist
description:
OpenClaw Security & Deployment Specialist

Contract | Remote (Worldwide) | Part-Time to Full-Time



About ClawNomad



ClawNomad is a remote-first, white-glove deployment service for OpenClaw — the open-source AI agent that has exploded to 145,000+ GitHub stars and millions of installations. We professionally deploy, harden, and maintain OpenClaw instances for global executives, founders, and small teams (4–50 employees) who want the power of a personal AI agent without the security nightmare of doing it themselves.



Think of us as the SetupClaw model ($1,560–$3,120 per implementation + $2,450–$9,750/mo managed care) but purpose-built for remote/international clients and digital-first executives who don't have a Mac mini sitting in their SF office. Our founder brings 20+ years of Fortune 500 operations and project management experience from Amazon.



Why This Role Exists



OpenClaw is incredibly powerful — and incredibly dangerous in the wrong hands. Here's what the security landscape looks like as of February 2026:



- 512 vulnerabilities found in a January 2026 security audit, 8 classified as critical

- CVE
(CVSS 8.8): 1-click remote code execution via malicious webpage — could steal API keys, tokens, and execute arbitrary commands

- 30,000+ exposed instances found publicly accessible with zero authentication (Bitsight, Jan–Feb 2026)

- 800+ malicious skills on ClawHub, including compromised GitHub accounts auto-deploying malware every few minutes (Bitdefender)

- Cisco flagged OpenClaw as "Exhibit A in How Not To Do AI Security" — citing data exfiltration, prompt injection, and malicious skill execution

- Palo Alto Networks called it "the potential biggest insider threat of 2026"

- Commodity infostealers (RedLine, Lumma, Vidar) are actively targeting OpenClaw installations

- No bug bounty program or dedicated security team exists within the OpenClaw project itself

- OpenClaw's own maintainer, Shadow, warned on 
: "If you can't understand how to run a command line, this is far too dangerous of a project for you to use safely."



This is exactly why our clients will pay premium prices for professional deployment. We need someone who can make OpenClaw safe, not just functional.



What You'll Do



Security Hardening (Primary Responsibility)



- Follow and extend the official OpenClaw hardening guide for every client deployment: loopback-only binding, no public endpoints, sandboxing, credential isolation

- Vet all skills/plugins before installation — no unaudited third-party code touches client machines

- Configure network security: firewall rules, port management (18789/18793), WebSocket origin validation

- Manage credential lifecycle: API keys in env vars (never in prompts), credential rotation post-deployment, log redaction

- Implement prompt injection defenses and monitor for data exfiltration attempts

- Track CVEs and security advisories — apply patches within 24–48 hours of disclosure

- Run security audits before every client handoff and document findings



Client Deployment & Maintenance



- Deploy OpenClaw on client hardware or VPS (Mac mini, DigitalOcean, or equivalent) via remote sessions

- Configure integrations: Gmail, Google Calendar, Outlook, Slack, WhatsApp,
, Notion, HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.

- Build mission-critical workflows per client needs (inbox triage, calendar management, draft replies, CRM updates)

- Provide 14-day hypercare post-deployment and ongoing managed care support

- Create deployment documentation and security checklists for each client



Process & Playbook Development



- Help build our repeatable deployment playbook so we can scale to licensed operators in other markets

- Create a security compliance framework that helps clients pass InfoSec/CISO review

- Stay current with the OpenClaw open-source community, GitHub releases, and emerging attack vectors



Required Skills & Experience



- Hands-on OpenClaw experience — you've personally deployed, hardened, and maintained at least one instance

- Linux/macOS system administration — comfortable with Node.js services, port management, firewall rules, SSH, and process isolation

- Security fundamentals — understanding of WebSocket security, CORS, prompt injection, credential management, and supply chain attacks

- VPS deployment experience — DigitalOcean, AWS, Hetzner, or similar (our clients are remote-first, not in-person)

- API/integration knowledge — experience with OAuth, API keys, messaging platform APIs (Slack,
, WhatsApp)

- Strong written communication — you'll write security documentation and interface with executive-level clients

- Reliable remote work habits — we operate across time zones; async communication via Slack is essential



Nice to Have



- Active contributor to the OpenClaw GitHub repository or community

- Experience with AI agent security (prompt injection research, LLM safety, agentic system risks)

- Familiarity with the Cisco, Bitdefender, Kaspersky, or Trend Micro security assessments of OpenClaw

- Experience building SOPs or deployment playbooks for technical services

- Background in managed IT services or MSP operations



Compensation & Structure



- Engagement: Contract (1099 / international contractor)

- Rate: $50–$100/hr depending on experience (open to project-based pricing per deployment)

- Hours: 10–20 hrs/week initially, scaling with client volume

- Location: Fully remote — anywhere in the world

- Growth: Revenue share or equity discussion for the right long-term partner



How to Apply



Send a short message (no cover letter needed) with:



1. Your OpenClaw experience — what have you deployed, how did you harden it, what went wrong?

2. One security risk most OpenClaw users don't know about (show us you actually understand the threat landscape)

3. Your hourly rate and timezone

4. Link to any relevant work — GitHub, blog posts, security write-ups, OpenClaw community contributions



Why security is non-negotiable for us:



Our clients are CEOs, CFOs, and Heads of Sales connecting their most sensitive accounts —
, calendar, CRM, messaging — to an AI agent with full system access. A single misconfiguration could leak API keys, expose client communications, or enable remote code execution. We charge premium prices because we guarantee this doesn't happen. If security isn't your first instinct, this isn't the right fit.



ClawNomad — Secure AI Agents, Deployed Anywhere

title: Systems Operator – Faceless YouTube Network
description:
The Mission

We are an industrial-scale YouTube portfolio. We don’t "make videos"; we manufacture high-performance digital assets. We are looking for a Systems Operator to manage the pipeline from AI generation to final publication. This is a role for a disciplined executor who thrives on SOPs, checklists, and zero-error tolerances.



The Role (Responsibilities)

Production: Operating AI generation suites based on Founder-provided Titles/Angles.



Compliance: Managing dedicated Chrome profiles and proxies with 100% isolation (No cross-contamination).



Publishing: Executing bulk uploads, applying metadata templates, and optimizing monetization (Mid-rolls).



Reporting: Maintaining the "Control Tower" (Tracking Sheet) in real-time.



Mandatory Technical Requirements:



Proxy Discipline: Experience using proxies and anti-detect browsers



Tooling: Familiarity with Gemini, Canva, Slack, Asana/Notion/Clickup/Trello



Connectivity: High-speed internet with 99% uptime.



???? DISQUALIFICATION CRITERIA (Do Not Apply If:)

You want to be "Creative": This is a factory. We have already engineered the "winning" angles. If you try to change my titles or "improve" the scripts without permission, you will be terminated immediately.



You are "Multitasking": If you plan on managing 5 other clients while running my pipeline, you will fail. We track upload timestamps and proxy logs.



You Lack Attention to Detail: If you cannot distinguish between "Channel_A" and "Channel_B" file structures, you are a liability to the network.



You Don't Know Proxies: If you have ever logged into two different YouTube channels on the same standard browser window, you are not qualified for this role.



How to Apply (The "Dumb Requirement" Test)

To prove you can follow an SOP to the letter, your application must include:



The subject line: "Systems Operator – [Your Name] – Zero Error Goal"



A screenshot of your current internet speed test.



A 2-sentence explanation of why Channel Isolation is critical for a YouTube network.



Type the word "ACTUATOR" at the very bottom of your message so I know you read the entire post.



Applications that fail to follow these 4 steps will be deleted without review.

title: Video Editor for AI Documentary Channel
description:
We're building a YouTube channel that produces documentary-style videos using AI-generated images and video clips. We need a video editor who can take a script + voiceover audio and turn it into a polished, visually compelling documentary — using AI tools to generate the visuals.



This is *not* a slideshow job. We're looking for someone who understands pacing, visual storytelling, and how to make AI-generated scenes feel cinematic and cohesive.



## What You'll Be Doing



- Receive a **script + voiceover audio** for each video

- Generate **AI video clips** (95%+ of the video) and occasional AI images that match the narration, using tools like Freepik, Higgsfield, or similar (we will provide the access)

- The vast majority of the video must be **animated clips, not static images**. Still images are acceptable only briefly and sparingly

- Edit everything together into a finished documentary-style video (20–45 minutes)

- Add captions, transitions, and ensure tight audio-visual sync

- Deliver one video per day (average)



## What We're Looking For



- **Strong video editing skills** — CapCut, DaVinci Resolve, Premiere Pro, or similar

- **Experience with AI image/video generation** — You've actually used tools like Freepik, Higgsfield, Midjourney, Runway, Kling, or similar. This is a must.

- **Understanding of documentary pacing** — You know how to let scenes breathe, build tension, and match visuals to narration

- **Visual storytelling sense** — The images and clips you choose/generate should reflect what's being said, not just be "cool looking"

- **Consistency** — Characters, settings, lighting, and style should feel cohesive across the full video

- **Autonomous and resourceful** — You'll have the script and audio. You should be able to figure out what visuals to create without waiting for detailed instructions on every scene

- **Responsive communicator** — You'll join our Slack. We expect timely responses, especially during the onboarding period

- **Strong English** — Written communication must be clear and fluent



## What We Provide

- Script + voiceover audio for each video

- Reference channels and style guidelines

- Over time: AI-generated prompts and visual directions to speed up your workflow (but you should NOT depend on these — they're a productivity tool, not a replacement for your judgment)



## Compensation

- **$20–$25 per video** depending on experience and quality

- **Volume:** ~1 video per day = consistent, daily work

- **Long-term:** We're building a team. If you're the right fit, this is ongoing work, not a one-off gig.



## Reference Channels

Watch these to understand the style and quality we're aiming for:

1. **Tim - Reborn History** — [The Industrial Revolution in the 1700s](
)

2. **Restored Timeline** — [What New York Looked Like in 1660](
)

3. **Worlds Before Us** — [What It Took to Survive Europe's Great Famine](
)



Pay attention to:

- How visuals sync with narration

- Pacing and transitions

- Visual consistency across scenes

- How AI-generated content is used to tell a story, not just fill screen time



## How to Apply — REQUIRED TEST

**Do not apply without completing this test.** We will not review applications without a sample video.



We've prepared a short test to see how you work:

1. **Download the test materials here:** 

Download the script: 

Download the audio: 

2. Read the SOP/Brief here: 

3. **Create a 1–2 minute sample video** using the script excerpt and audio we provide

4. Use **any AI tools available to you** (free or paid — we're not judging resolution)

5. **Submit your sample video** with your application



### What we're evaluating (NOT evaluating resolution or tool quality):

- ? Majority of scenes are clips/animations (like the referred channels)

- ? Does the visual content match what the narration is saying?

- ? Is the pacing natural and engaging — not too fast, not too slow?

- ? Are transitions smooth and intentional?

- ? Does it feel like a documentary, not a slideshow?

- ? Is there visual consistency (style, lighting, mood)?

- ? Did you follow the brief?



### What we're NOT evaluating:

- ? Resolution (720p or less from a free tool is fine)

- ? Which specific AI tool you used

- ? Hollywood-level production value

- ? How long took you to do it



**This test exists because we need to see YOUR work, not downloaded samples.**



## To Apply



1. Complete the test sample video

2. Send your application with:

   - Your sample video (link or file)

   - Brief description of which AI tools you used

   - Your relevant experience (keep it short)

   - Your availability

title: Finance VA
description:
Job Overview



We are a growing US-based moving company seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Finance Virtual Assistant to manage financial operations related to daily moves, crew payroll, client payments, insurance costs, and profit tracking. This role plays a key part in ensuring accurate financial records, smooth payroll processing, and clear visibility of company profitability.



Key Responsibilities

Process payroll per move for moving crews based on completed jobs

Track job costs, labor hours, and crew payouts

Collect and record client payments (deposits and balances)

Follow up on outstanding payments and reconcile job invoices

Pay and track insurance premiums and related expenses

Monitor and update Profit & Loss (P&L) reports

Reconcile daily sales, expenses, and job-related transactions

Maintain accurate financial records and spreadsheets

Coordinate with sales and operations teams to confirm job details and payouts

Prepare weekly and monthly financial summaries



Requirements

Experience as a Finance VA, Bookkeeping VA, or Accounting Assistant

Strong understanding of payroll, invoicing, and reconciliation

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

Proficient in Excel or Google Sheets

Comfortable working with job-based or service-based businesses

Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

title: Chief of Staff
description:
We are looking for a highly strategic, resourceful, and execution-driven Chief of Staff to serve as a trusted partner to executive leadership. This role is designed for someone who thrives at the intersection of strategy and operations — someone who can zoom out to see the big picture and zoom in to ensure flawless execution.



As Chief of Staff, you will act as an extension of leadership, driving cross-functional alignment, managing key initiatives, and ensuring priorities translate into measurable outcomes. You will help turn vision into action.



What You’ll Do

Serve as a strategic advisor and thought partner to the CEO / Executive Leadership

Lead and manage high-priority cross-functional projects from conception to execution

Drive accountability across teams to ensure strategic goals are met

Prepare leadership for key meetings, board sessions, and strategic reviews

Identify operational inefficiencies and implement scalable solutions

Manage executive communications and ensure alignment across departments

Act as a bridge between leadership and teams, ensuring clarity and 
ntum

Support organizational planning, goal setting, and performance tracking

Handle sensitive and confidential matters with discretion and sound judgment



What Makes You a Great Fit

You are proactive, highly organized, and deeply strategic. You are comfortable operating in ambiguity and can bring structure where none exists. You anticipate needs before they arise and take ownership without waiting for direction. You are calm under pressure, emotionally intelligent, and capable of influencing at all levels of the organization.



Qualifications

Minimum 3+ years of experience as a Chief of Staff or Executive Assistant (required)

Proven experience supporting C-level executives

Demonstrated ability to lead complex projects across multiple teams

Strong business acumen and strategic thinking capabilities

Exceptional communication and presentation skills

High level of discretion and professionalism

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment



How to Apply

Send a message with the subject line: Your Name – Chief of Staff

In your message, briefly answer: Why are you interested in this role?

Only applications with the correct subject line will be considered.

title: Clay Specialist
description:
We’re looking for a Clay Specialist who can build, optimize, and scale outbound and enrichment systems inside Clay. This is not a “tool awareness” role. You must have hands-on experience building real tables, implementing waterfall enrichments, writing Claygent prompts, and integrating data into CRMs.



You will operate at the intersection of sales, marketing, and RevOps. Your work will directly impact lead quality, personalization depth, and outbound performance. This role is ideal for someone who understands how Clay replaces manual prospect research and wants to build scalable systems instead of spreadsheets and guesswork.



If you think in workflows, optimize for credits, and know how to turn messy data into structured outbound assets, this role is a strong fit.





Why You’ll Want to Join

- You will be paid in USD (bi-monthly: every 15th and 30th)

- Up to 14 days of Paid Time Off annually (starting Day 1)

- Observance of Holidays per company guidelines

- 100% remote setup so you can work wherever you’re most productive

- High ownership over outbound data infrastructure

- Work at the center of revenue generation, not on the sidelines

- Opportunity to build scalable systems using AI and automation

- Fast-moving, experimentation-driven environment



What You’ll Work On



Clay Table Architecture and Workflow Building

- Build and manage advanced Clay tables from scratch

- Design structured outbound workflows using multiple enrichment steps

- Create scalable data models that support sales and marketing campaigns

- Ensure tables are clean, efficient, and built for long-term reuse



Waterfall Enrichment Optimization

- Implement and optimize waterfall enrichment logic across multiple providers

- Improve data coverage while minimizing unnecessary credit usage

- Diagnose provider gaps and optimize enrichment sequencing

- Monitor enrichment accuracy and refine workflows continuously



Claygent and AI Research Automation

- Write and optimize Claygent prompts for structured research tasks

- Use AI agents to extract insights from websites and external sources

- Transform unstructured web data into usable outbound signals

- Balance model selection and credit spend for maximum efficiency



CRM Integration and Activation

- Integrate Clay with Salesforce or HubSpot

- Sync enriched data cleanly into CRM pipelines

- Build automation triggers for outbound activation

- Ensure data hygiene and structured field mapping



Outbound Infrastructure Support

- Support lead generation campaigns at scale

- Optimize workflows for campaigns exceeding 5K leads per month

- Improve personalization depth while maintaining automation efficiency

- Collaborate with sales and RevOps to improve conversion performance



What You Bring

- Clay Certification is required (Credly badge verification)

- Proven hands-on experience building and managing advanced workflows inside 

- Strong understanding of Waterfall Enrichment logic and optimization

- Experience writing and refining Claygent prompts for structured AI research

- Direct experience integrating Clay with Salesforce or HubSpot

- Ability to optimize credit usage while maintaining data quality and coverage

- Comfort working with APIs, webhooks, and automation workflows

- Experience supporting outbound or RevOps teams with scalable data systems

- Strong ownership mindset with the ability to operate independently



Nice to Have

- Listed as a Clay Expert or Solutions Partner

- Experience with Smartlead, Instantly, Apollo, Make, n8n, or LinkedIn Sales Navigator

- Experience optimizing credit usage at scale

- SQL or Python basics

- Experience running outbound campaigns at 5K+ leads per month



How to Apply



Please include:

1. Your updated resume

2. A short 1–2 minute Loom video walking through:

    - A Clay table you built

    - How you structured waterfall enrichment

    - How you optimized credit usage

    - How you integrated the data into a CRM



Only candidates who submit a Loom video will be considered.



If you are fluent in Clay, understand how AI-driven enrichment replaces manual prospecting, and can build outbound infrastructure that scales, this role offers strong ownership and direct impact on revenue performance.

title: Virtual Assistant / Recruiter
description:
Job Offer: Virtual Assistant (Hiring, CRM & Operations)





Company: Busy Mom Cleaning



Position: Virtual Assistant (Remote)



Schedule: Part-time to Full-time (set schedule required)



Location: Remote







About Busy Mom Cleaning





Busy Mom Cleaning is a fast-growing, women-owned cleaning company serving Southwest Florida. We are seeking a reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support our daily operations, manage our hiring pipeline, and help keep our systems organized as we scale.

???? Core Responsibilities

Conduct phone screenings for cleaner applicants



Host and coordinate Zoom interviews for applicants



Source, follow up with, and move applicants through our CRM



Perform accurate data entry with zero errors



Communicate professionally with clients and cleaners via phone, text, and



Complete daily follow-ups and administrative tasks on time



Support overall company growth by keeping hiring and communication consistent and organized



? Required Qualifications

Comfortable speaking on the phone and leading Zoom calls



Reliable with consistent availability



Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Organized, professional, and solution-oriented



Prior VA, admin, recruiting, or customer service experience preferred



???? Performance KPIs (Required to Earn Bonus)





KPI #1: Hiring Pipeline Accuracy

All phone screens and Zoom interviews completed as scheduled



Applicant data entered 100?curately in the CRM



Qualified applicants moved to the correct stage within 24 hours



No missed follow-ups with applicants



KPI #2: Communication & Responsiveness

Respond to assigned messages within 15–30 minutes during working hours



Professional communication at all times (clear English, correct tone)

Base Pay: $4.00 per hour



Performance Bonus: Additional $5.50 per hour



Bonus is earned only when all KPIs are met consistently with no major errors during the pay period



Failure to meet KPIs may result in loss of bonus for that period



???? Main Goal of This Role





Your primary goal is to help Busy Mom Cleaning grow by:



Hiring and onboarding quality cleaners



Keeping our CRM accurate and active



Ensuring no leads, applicants, or messages fall through the cracks







This role is critical to keeping the business staffed, responsive, and organized.

title: LinkedIn Growth Operator (Traffic-Focused | Performance-Based)
description:
About the Role



We operate a premium career infrastructure asset called the ABF Repository — a curated remote job and premium career product.



Current 30-day performance:

• 1,700+ views

• 22% CTR

• No active growth engine



We are installing a structured LinkedIn growth system.



Your mission:

Increase qualified traffic to the ABF Repository and strengthen authority positioning.



This role is performance-focused. We care about measurable traffic growth, not vanity engagement.



Responsibilities



• Write and publish 3–5 high-signal LinkedIn posts per week

• Create strong hooks for career-driven professionals

• Drive intentional clicks to the repository

• Execute targeted LinkedIn engagement strategy

• Monitor analytics and adjust strategy

• Provide a short monthly performance summary



KPIs (How You Win)



• Increase repository clicks month-over-month

• Grow total traffic

• Improve returning visitor rate

• Maintain or improve CTR



We measure outcomes, not activity.



Who This Is For



You:



• Understand LinkedIn growth mechanics

• Can write authority-driven content (not generic AI posts)

• Have grown a page, founder account, or brand before

• Think in systems and measurable strategy

• Are performance-oriented



If your focus is just “posting content,” this is not the role.



Compensation



Part-time (8–10 hours per week)



Base: $200–$250 (USD) per month



Performance bonuses tied to traffic milestones



Example bonus structure:



• + $100 at 2,500 monthly clicks

• + $200 at 4,000 clicks

• + $400 at 6,000+ clicks



Initial contract: 60 days

Extension and pay increases based on measurable growth.



This role is designed for operators who want upside.



To Apply



Please include:



A short (5–8 sentence) strategy explaining how you would 2–3x traffic in 90 days



2 examples of LinkedIn posts you’ve written



Any analytics screenshot showing measurable growth



Your expected monthly rate



Applications without measurable proof of results will not be considered.

title: Operations Associate
description:
We help Americans unlock wealth and free themselves from the corporate day-to-day grind through acquisitions. We're a rapidly growing firm, and we're looking for sharp, adaptable, and highly organized individuals to join our lean, remote team.

If you're someone who thrives on clear communication, thrives in fast-paced environments, and wants to grow with a company that moves fast and values ownership, you’ll love working with us.



What You’ll Be Doing:

—SOP Auditing & Compliance: Ensure all departments (Sales, Deal, Deal Execution, and Operations) adhere to established 

—SOPs. You’ll verify daily and weekly compliance items, monitor calendars, check documentation standards, flag red indicators, and escalate issues promptly to the Operations Manager.

—Partner Onboarding Management: Assist with the entire onboarding process for new Partners.

—Information Logging & Tracking: Monitor and update internal CRM and departmental dashboards. Ensure all data is accurate, up to date, and aligned within the required 24-48 hour windows.

—Employee Support: Help coordinate workshops for team development.

—Operational Optimization: Identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and gaps across processes. Collaborate with the Operations —Manager to refine SOPs, suggest workflow improvements, and drive smoother execution across teams.

—Reporting & Communication: Prepare timely KPI updates, summaries, and escalations for the Operations Manager. Communicate cross-departmentally to bridge gaps, follow up on outstanding items, and ensure accountability.



Who You Are:

—Highly Organized - You manage multiple trackers, audits, dashboards, and deadlines without missing details.

—Detail-Obsessed - SOP adherence, naming conventions, follow-up windows, and accuracy are second nature to you.

—Proactive Communicator - You escalate issues early, close information loops, and ensure stakeholders are always informed.

—Adaptable Self-Starter - You thrive in fast-moving environments, solve operational problems independently, and comfortably take on evolving responsibilities.





Requirements:

—1+ year of experience in operations, administrative support, project coordination, or a related role (M&A, finance, or consulting experience is a plus).

—Proficiency with document management tools (Google Workspace, Notion), communication tools (Slack), and platforms such as BunnyDoc, GHL, and Google Admin.

—Strong organizational skills with a focus on speed, accuracy, and remote work discipline.

—Ability to manage competing priorities and meet tight deadlines in a dynamic environment.



What We Offer:

—Competitive salary with career growth potential in a rapidly scaling firm.

—100% remote – Work from anywhere!

—Opportunity to gain deep M&A execution experience and grow within our team.

—A fast-moving, supportive team culture where your impact is immediately visible.



Ready to join a high-growth M&A team and play a critical role in executing deals? Apply now!

title: Supply Chain Coordinator
description:
We’re looking for a Supply Chain Coordinator who wants to be the real-time bridge between US leadership and Asian manufacturing partners.



This role is for someone who speaks both Mandarin and English fluently and understands how vendors actually operate. You will sit at the center of production communication, vendor follow-ups, and timeline management. This is not a passive reporting role. It is about keeping production moving.



Our client is a fast-growing US-based outdoor lifestyle apparel brand founded in 2023 and headquartered in Denver. The company develops premium apparel programs for major destination resorts and national parks across the United States. In under three years, they have grown to multi-million dollar annual revenue and continue scaling quickly.



They need someone in Asia who can operate in real time, communicate clearly, and help eliminate slow
 chains.



Why You’ll Want to Join

- Full-time direct-hire role with long-term stability

- 100% remote setup so you can work wherever you’re most productive

- Direct exposure to US leadership and decision making

- Opportunity to grow with a brand that is scaling quickly

- Room for compensation growth based on performance and value



 Working Schedule

- 8 hour shift

- 2 to 3 hours of required daily overlap between 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM Mountain Time

- Must be based in East or Southeast Asia to align with vendor time zones



What You’ll Work On

Vendor Communication and Relationship Management

- Act as the primary point of contact for manufacturing partners across Asia

- Communicate production updates, changes, and requirements clearly

- Follow up consistently to ensure timelines are respected

- Build working relationships with factories, mills, and suppliers



Production Coordination and Tracking

- Monitor production schedules and request Work In Progress updates

- Flag delays or risks early

- Coordinate across multiple vendors to keep launches on track

- Help ensure instructions are understood and executed correctly



Translation and Cross Border Alignment

- Translate written and verbal communication between English and Mandarin

- Join calls with vendors and represent the US team clearly

- Bridge cultural and operational gaps between both sides



General Supply Chain Support

- Support purchase order tracking and documentation

- Maintain organized records of production updates

- Use Excel to manage simple tracking sheets and reporting

- Incorporate AI tools into workflows where helpful



What You Bring

- Minimum 2 years of experience in Supply Chain, Procurement, or Vendor Management

- Experience working for a US-headquartered company managing Asian vendors

- Proven track record of managing vendor relationships and coordinating production timelines

- Fluent in Mandarin with the ability to conduct business conversations confidently

- Fluent in English at C1 or C2 level with strong written and verbal communication

- Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel

- Demonstrated experience using AI tools to increase efficiency and streamline workflows



Value-Add Experience

- 5–8 years of experience in supply chain or procurement roles

- Experience in apparel or consumer goods production

- Familiarity with textile mills or garment manufacturing

- Located in East or Southeast Asia



How to Apply



Please send:

1. Your updated resume

2. A short 1 to 2 minute Loom video introducing yourself and explaining:

    - Your vendor or supply chain experience

    - Your experience communicating in Mandarin in a business setting



Shortlisted candidates will be asked to complete a brief live Mandarin conversation assessment.





If you are operationally sharp, fluent in Mandarin and English, and confident managing vendor relationships across borders, this role offers ownership, visibility, and the opportunity to grow alongside a scaling consumer brand.

title: Google Ads Specialist — Audit, Strategy & Management for Local Lead Gen
description:
Google Ads Specialist — Audit, Strategy & Ongoing Management for Mobile Diesel Repair Lead Generation



Contract | Remote | Part-Time (5–15 hrs/week)



About Us



AZ Mobile Diesel Repair / Mobile Diesel USA is a lead generation business serving the Phoenix Metro area (21 cities). We connect truckers and fleet managers who are broken down on I-10, I-17, US-60, Loop 101/202/303 with mobile diesel mechanics for roadside repair.



Important: We are NOT a repair shop. We generate phone calls. Every dollar of ad spend needs to drive qualified calls from people with a broken-down truck RIGHT NOW. We need someone who understands high-intent local service advertising — not brand awareness, not e-commerce. Our revenue model is per qualified lead/job.



Website: 

Primary conversion: Phone calls to (602)
, plus form fills and click-to-call



What We Need



This engagement has three phases. We're looking for one person who can handle all three.



PHASE 1 — Account Audit & Strategy (Weeks 1–2)



- Full audit of our existing Google Ads account: structure, keywords, ad copy, bidding strategy, extensions, quality scores, and conversion tracking

- Competitor analysis for Phoenix mobile diesel repair paid search

- Keyword research targeting high-intent emergency diesel repair, roadside assistance, and service-specific searches across 21 Phoenix Metro cities

- Conversion tracking audit — phone calls are our primary CTA, plus form fills and click-to-call

- Budget recommendation with realistic daily/monthly spend and cost-per-lead projections

- Deliverable: Written strategy document with proposed campaign structure and projected KPIs



PHASE 2 — Campaign Build & Launch (Weeks 2–3)



- Rebuild campaigns with proper ad groups, tight keyword themes, and comprehensive negative keyword lists

- Compelling ad copy that emphasizes: 30–60 min response time, no towing needed, 21-city coverage, same-day service

- Full ad extensions setup: call, location, sitelinks to service pages, callouts

- Geo-targeting for Phoenix Metro with bid adjustments for high-value zones (I-10 corridor, Sky Harbor area, major truck stops)

- Landing page recommendations — we already have 21 city pages and corridor pages built

- Call-only ads and campaigns — phone calls are our #1 conversion goal



PHASE 3 — Ongoing Monthly Management



- Weekly optimization: bid adjustments, search term review, negative keyword updates, ad testing

- Monthly reporting in clear language: spend, leads, cost-per-lead, what's being optimized and why (no jargon)

- A/B testing of ad copy, headlines, extensions, and landing pages

- Budget scaling recommendations based on performance data

- Google Business Profile and Local Service Ads integration is a plus



Required Experience



- 3+ years managing Google Ads for local service businesses (home services, automotive, trucking, or similar)

- Proven results with call-based campaigns (not e-commerce)

- Geo-targeted campaign experience in a metro area

- Conversion tracking expertise: Google Tag Manager, call tracking platforms, GA4

- Google Ads certified (current certification required)

- Clear communicator — explain what you're doing and why in plain language, no agency-speak



Nice to Have



- Trucking, diesel, towing, or roadside assistance industry experience

- Google Local Service Ads (LSA) setup and management

- Landing page and conversion rate optimization advisory skills

- Experience with lead generation businesses specifically

- Call tracking platform experience (CallRail, WhatConverts, or similar)



Compensation



We're open to proposals. Here's the structure:



- Phase 1 (Audit + Strategy): Fixed project fee — propose your rate

- Phase 2 (Campaign Build + Launch): Fixed or hourly — propose your rate

- Phase 3 (Monthly Management): Monthly retainer — propose your rate



We value transparency and results. If you deliver qualified calls at a strong cost-per-lead, this becomes a long-term relationship.



How to Apply



Send a message that includes:



1. 2–3 examples of local service Google Ads campaigns you've managed, with real metrics (cost-per-lead, call volume, conversion rates)

2. One specific thing you'd change about our Google Ads approach after looking at 

3. Your proposed pricing for the audit (Phase 1) and monthly management (Phase 3)

4. Your current Google Ads certification status



Bottom line: This is a lead gen business where every ad dollar needs to produce a phone call from someone stranded on the side of the road with a diesel truck that won't start. If you know how to make Google Ads ring phones for local service businesses, we want to talk to you.

title: Paid Ads Specialist
description:
We’re looking for a Paid Ads Specialist to support and execute performance marketing campaigns for education and training businesses focused on student enrollment growth. This role is hands-on and execution-driven, ideal for someone early to mid-career who has agency experience and wants to deepen their skills across Google, Meta, and TikTok ads.



You will start by supporting senior advertisers and managing smaller ad accounts, with a clear path toward owning campaigns end to end. This role is well suited for someone who understands paid ads fundamentals, communicates clearly, and is eager to grow into more responsibility.



If you enjoy performance marketing, care about measurable outcomes, and want to learn how enrollment-focused funnels actually work, this role is a strong fit.



Why You’ll Want to Join

- You will be paid in USD bi-monthly every 15th and 30th

- Up to 14 days of Paid Time Off annually starting Day 1

- Observance of Holidays per company guidelines



What You’ll Work On

Paid Ads Execution and Support

- Support active ad accounts across Google Ads, Meta, and TikTok

- Help manage campaigns with monthly budgets ranging from **3K to 15K USD**

- Assist with campaign setup, ad creation, budget pacing, and optimizations

- Implement changes based on performance data and advertiser guidance



Account Management and Optimization

- Monitor daily performance metrics and flag issues or opportunities

- Assist with testing creatives, audiences, and campaign structures

- Help maintain clean account structure and accurate tracking

- Contribute to ongoing optimization of enrollment-focused funnels



Collaboration and Communication

- Work closely with senior advertisers and a US-based team

- Communicate clearly in written and spoken English during internal discussions

- Support reporting and performance summaries for internal review

- Learn how to translate client goals into practical ad execution

- 100% remote setup so you can work wherever you’re most productive

- Hands-on training and mentorship from experienced paid media strategists

- Clear growth path from support role to independent account ownership



What You Bring

- 2 to 3 years of hands-on experience running paid ads, ideally in an agency environment

- Experience working with Google Ads and Meta Ads required

- Exposure to TikTok Ads is a strong plus

- Strong written and verbal English communication skills

- Comfortable starting in a support role and growing into more ownership

- Detail-oriented with a performance mindset

- Curious, coachable, and motivated to improve as a paid media operator



Nice to Have

- Experience working with lead generation or education-focused campaigns

- Familiarity with tracking, conversion events, and basic funnel concepts

- Experience collaborating with US-based teams or clients

- Comfort using reporting dashboards or spreadsheets for performance analysis





How to Apply



Please include:

1. Your updated resume

2. A short 1 to 2 minute Loom video introducing yourself and explaining your paid ads experience and what accounts or platforms you’ve worked on



Only candidates who submit a Loom video will be considered.



If you’re early in your paid media career, have solid agency fundamentals, and want to grow into a performance marketer who understands real enrollment outcomes, this role offers structure, mentorship, and room to level up fast.

title: Data Warehousing Specialist with Microsoft Forms experience
description:
I am currently underway building a data warehouse.  My architect is building a data capture warehouse with storage and out put reporting.  All being built in Azure/SQL.  I need a highly qualified person to assist the completion of the build by integrating Front user forms in Microsoft Forms or Power platform.  I need someone with excellent English skills to work with the architect and then to monitor the data and forms on an ongoing basis.  



I am an excellent employer with experience hiring Filipno employees who I have a wonderful relationship with.  I would like to build on this with a well qualified person.



I pay on time, and through low costs platforms.  I treat my employees the way I would want to be treated.  I will work with you on scheduling your hours so that you do not need to work through the night.  If you are a team player, have excellent English written/verbal skills, with reliable internet, and Microsoft Experience in excel, SQL, Azure, Microsoft teams, Microsoft Forms and Power Platform.



I am ready to hire as soon as you are ready to work.
salary: $4 US and up based on experience.

title: Data Warehouse Architect & Forms
description:
I am ending my relationship with FileMaker pro and am looking for an expert in Azure/SQL data warehousing.  I need to replicate my existing  Data warehouse that functions as a data collection and as a billing system. I will need someone who can also help with Microsoft forms.  I have the workflow from start to finish sequenced out, but need someone to build and maintain the new system. Maintaining will include upgrades and trouble shooting.  The maintaining will not be full-time, but would be a consistent part time work month to month.  



I am an expert as an end user and know the complete workflow. I need you to build the data input (from excel and CSV files), storage, reports and output (csv) based on the requirements I share.  I have existing Filipino staff whom I trust and enjoy working with.  I am an excellent employer, I pay on time and will pay through the platform you prefer.



I need you to have excellent verbal and written English.  I need the new system to be built by August. I have retained a Microsoft expert as a consultant to make sure I properly explain what platform I need, and where I need it to be built.  



I am ready to hire you as soon as I find and verify your skills.  If you are an expert in Data Warehousing, you will find me to be a great employer!  I will work with you as a team and be available to answer questions during your daytime hours, not your night.  Future work, trouble shooting may require after hour availablity to help keep my system up if necessary.    



Please respond if you want to become a valuable member of my team.  I look forward to meeting you.

title: Virtual Assistant / Outreach Specialist
description:
We’re looking for a proactive, self-starting Customer Service / Outreach Specialist to support and help grow our businesses.



This is a role for someone who takes ownership, thinks ahead, and doesn’t need to be micromanaged. You’ll handle outreach and admin operations, and play an active role in improving systems, processes, and results across the company.



If you enjoy being trusted to run with tasks, spot inefficiencies, and contribute ideas to grow a business, this role is for you.



* Please apply with a short video introduction (15–60 seconds). Tell us about your most recent role and why you’re a good fit. (Loom or similar is perfect.)





KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:



- Managing LinkedIn and outbound outreach campaigns (using tools like Dripify, Apollo, Instantly, etc.)



- Booking and coordinating meetings



- Updating, organizing, and maintaining lead lists



- Creating LinkedIn content using Canva



- Handling prospect responses, follow-ups, and objections



- Outbound outreach via
 and cold calling



- Owning assigned projects from start to finish



- Identifying inefficiencies and proactively suggesting improvements to outreach, admin, and internal workflows



- Supporting business growth by contributing ideas, improvements, and better ways of working





YOU ARE:



- A self-starter who takes initiative and doesn’t wait to be told what to do



- Comfortable owning outcomes, not just completing tasks



- Highly organized, proactive, and efficient



- Confident working independently in a fully remote environment



- Clear and professional in written and spoken English



- Interested in a long-term role with room to grow



- Naturally proactive, you flag issues, ideas, or improvements before being asked





WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE IN THIS ROLE:



- Outreach campaigns run smoothly with minimal oversight



- Tasks are completed without reminders



- The tea
mber you manage is supported, productive, and accountable



- You consistently suggest improvements to systems, workflows, or results



- We can trust you to take ownership and make good decisions independently





EXPERIENCE & TOOLS:



Experience with the following is a strong plus: Canva, LinkedIn, Dripify, Apollo, Instantly, ChatGPT





** To Apply, Please Answer the Following:



- On a scale of 1–10, how would you rate your written English skills?



- On a scale of 1–10, how would you rate your spoken English skills?





If you’re someone who enjoys taking responsibility, improving systems, and growing alongside a fast-moving business, we’d love to hear from you.



Thanks!
