title: Short-Form Video Editor (Reels/TikTok/Shorts) — Travel & Culture (Retention-Obsessed)
description:
I’m Spencer Ocean — I make travel & culture videos built around real people and real experiences.



I’m hiring a retention-obsessed editor to turn my raw travel footage into scroll-stopping Reels/TikToks/Shorts.



What you’ll do (core)

* Edit 5–6 short-form videos per week (15–60s) optimized for retention

* Make the first 1 second instantly understandable (clear context + pattern disruption)

* Tight pacing, clean cuts, strong story, and solid sound design

* Add captions/subtitles in a clean style (simple, readable, not over-designed)

* Deliver 1–2 hook variations for the best videos (different first 3–5 seconds)

* Style: documentary/cinematic travel, but fast and modern (clean captions, minimal effects)



Requirements

* Strong short-form portfolio (send 3 relevant samples)

* CapCut workflow (Premiere experience is a plus; not required)

* Good English communication; fast iteration; calm with feedback

* Reliable internet + organized file handling



Working relationship

?I travel and film everything myself. I will send you organized footage folders + a short brief and references for each video. You’ll have access to me for questions and clarifications at any time. 



Your job is to take the footage and deliver ready-to-post short-form videos (Reels/TikTok/Shorts).



Delivery expectations:

* 24–48 hours per video depending on complexity

* We’ll work closely at first to lock the style, then you’ll run the edit pipeline with high ownership



Paid test edit (required)?I will pay you for a test edit. You will receive raw footage + 2 references and deliver:

* 1 finished short (30–45s)

* 2 different hook openings (first 3–5 seconds)



How to apply (follow exactly)?Reply with:

1. Your hourly rate (USD) + hours/week available

2. Your software experience (CapCut / Premiere / other)

3. 3 short-form samples (links) 

4. Confirm you can do a paid test edit

5. Confirm you can prioritize this role if we expand hours after the first 2 weeks.

6. Include the word “MAENAM” in your reply so I know you read this

If you’re excellent, this becomes a long-term role with increasing hours, responsibility, and pay.



Compensation

* $8–$9/hour based on skill + speed (with clear path to increases)

* Performance bonuses for videos that hit major view milestones and channel growth targets

* Potential promotion to Salary position.

title: Customer Service Manager
description:
Customer Service Manager Full-Time | Remote





We are seeking a highly driven Customer Service Manager with a strong sales background to build and lead our customer support department across multiple telemedicine and service-based brands. This role requires someone who can thrive in a fast-paced, high-demand environment and who excels at save-the-sale conversations, objection handling, and turning hesitant customers into loyal clients.



The ideal candidate is both a strategic leader and a hands-on sales-focused operator, capable of working long hours when required, especially during high-volume periods, product launches, or operational escalations.



Key Responsibilities

Build & Lead the Customer Support Department

Create the entire customer service framework — processes, SOPs, training materials, performance metrics, and QA standards.

Recruit, hire, train, and manage a high-performing customer support team.

Develop a scalable support model for multiple service and telemedicine brands.

Establish clear KPIs and coaching rhythms to drive performance and accountability.



Sales-Driven Customer Support

Serve as the primary expert in save-the-sale, ensuring the team maximizes opportunities to retain clients and recover cancellations.

Handle high-level or critical interactions across phone, chat, and
, demonstrating expert-level persuasion and empathy.

Train tea
mbers in sales psychology, customer retention tactics, objection handling, and revenue-focused support strategies.



Operational Excellence

Oversee daily operations of the customer support function across all brands.

Monitor, analyze, and report on performance metrics including conversion rate, recovery rate, CSAT, response times, and resolution effectiveness.

Collaborate with telemedicine providers, operations, marketing, and leadership to identify and resolve customer experience gaps.



Customer Experience Leadership

Manage escalations and ensure complex issues are handled promptly and professionally.

Identify recurring concerns or bottlenecks and propose improvements to enhance service quality.

Ensure consistent communication standards that match each brand’s unique policies and guidelines.



Work Ethic & Flexibility

Willingness to work extended hours or adjust schedules during peak periods.

Thrive in a dynamic, evolving environment where responsiveness is key.



Qualifications

3–5+ years in customer service leadership with a strong sales or retention background.

Proven success in save-the-sale, revenue recovery, or subscription retention.

Experience in telemedicine, services, health & wellness, or similar industries is a major plus.

Strong leadership and team-building capabilities.

Exceptional communication skills across phone, chat, and
.

Ability to manage multiple brands or service lines simultaneously.

Highly organized, data-driven, and proactive.



What We’re Looking For



A sales-focused leader who knows how to motivate teams to drive revenue, not just answer questions.

A builder ready to create systems, teams, and workflows from the ground up.

Someone with the stamina and commitment to work long hours when needed.

A problem-solver who leads with customer empathy but thinks like a strategist.

A high-achiever who thrives in fast-paced, dynamic environments.



Benefits

Competitive compensation

Remote work environment

Opportunity to build and shape your own CS department

Work across innovative telemedicine and service brands



How to Apply

Please submit your CV and a short audio/video introduction detailing your experience and why you’re a great fit for our team. Only applicants who submit the requirements will be reviewed.

title: Senior Service Desk Technician
description:
About ElasticIT 



At ElasticIT, we're building a world where healthcare workers never wait for technology. We're not just another IT support company, we're the team that rescues healthcare providers when technology threatens patient care, turning chaos into clarity and making ordinary teams extraordinary through the right technology. 



We specialize in healthcare IT, providing managed services, custom software development, and HIPAA-compliant solutions that ensure medical professionals can focus on what matters most: their patients, not their systems. Our North Star is audacious yet simple: by 2050, we will eliminate repetitive IT tasks for 1 million healthcare workers, proving that the right technology makes ordinary people extraordinary. 



Our Values: The DNA of How We Operate 



Our values aren't just words on a wall, they're the blueprint for every interaction, every solution, and every relationship we build: 



Our Core Values 



SIMPLIFY THE OVERWHELMING: Cut through confusion with clarity and convert half-hour tasks into one-click wins 



RESCUE WHEN OTHERS PANIC: Respond when others would panic and deliver the impossible under pressure 



BUILD LASTING CAPABILITY: Create tools that spread like wildfire and teams that work without micromanaging 



PERSIST THROUGH CHAOS: Adapt when goalposts keep moving and turn disasters into relationships 



ENABLE HUMAN PURPOSE: Remove barriers so the focus can be on patients, not systems 



 

The Role 



You'll be the person who sees what others miss, the patterns in the chaos, the root causes beneath the symptoms, the opportunities hidden in problems. When three different practices call with "emergencies" simultaneously, you'll instinctively know which is truly critical and which can wait. You'll spot the recurring issue that everyone else treats as isolated i
. 



More importantly, you'll be the person who makes everyone around you better. Not through commanding or controlling, but by asking the right questions that help technicians find their own answers. By providing just enough support to build confidence without creating dependence. By recognizing potential in tea
mbers before they see it in themselves. 



This isn't about theoretical leadership or rigid hierarchies, it's about having the insight to understand what your team truly needs to succeed, then providing exactly that. When a practice's systems crash during peak hours, you won't just solve the problem, you'll strengthen your team's ability to handle the next crisis independently. 



What You'll Actually Be Doing… 



See the full picture: Analyze i
 patterns others overlook, identify root causes that prevent future failures, and recognize which "urgent" issues are truly critical 



Elevate your team's potential: Ask the questions that help technicians discover solutions themselves, provide the exact support needed without creating dependence 



Clear the path to success: Remove obstacles before your team encounters them, anticipate roadblocks and eliminate them proactively 



Make the right calls: Evaluate multiple solution approaches quickly, choose the path that balances speed, quality, and learning opportunities 



Strengthen through adversity: Transform every crisis into a teaching 
nt, help your team grow stronger from each challenge 



Connect dots others don't see: Link seemingly unrelated issues to systemic problems, recognize improvement opportunities in daily operations 



Support without hovering: Know exactly when to step in and when to step back, provide scaffolding that can be removed as confidence grows 



Build independence, not dependence: Guide tea
mbers to solve increasingly complex problems on their own 



What We're Looking For 



Must Have Experience: 



3+ years leading/mentoring technical support teams 



Healthcare IT environments or regulated industries experience 



Enterprise-level support experience 



High-pressure technical escalations handling 



HIPAA compliance or similar regulatory frameworks 



Process improvement and team capability building track record 



Who you are: 



Someone who reads between the lines; you notice what's not being said in support tickets, spot patterns in seemingly random issues, and understand the real problem behind the stated problem 



A natural talent spotter who sees capabilities in people they don't yet recognize in themselves and knows exactly how to nurture that potential 



Instinctively analytical with the ability to quickly assess complex situations, weigh multiple factors simultaneously, and make sound decisions with incomplete information 



A catalyst for growth who gets genuine satisfaction from watching tea
mbers solve problems they couldn't handle last month 



Comfortable with ambiguity because you trust your judgment to find clarity in confusion and help others do the same 



Someone who asks powerful questions rather than giving immediate answers, knowing that discovery beats instruction every time 



Energized by helping others succeed; your best days are when a tea
mber has a breakthrough or handles a crisis without your help 



What We Offer 



Meaningful impact: Shape how healthcare technology supports patient care while developing the next generation of healthcare IT professionals 



Growth trajectory: Clear pathways to senior technical leadership, with ongoing training in emerging healthcare technologies and AI-powered solutions 



Innovation environment: Work with cutting-edge healthcare IT, from AI appointment systems to advanced EHR integrations 



Team excellence: Join passionate professionals who thrive under pressure and take pride in making the impossible routine 



Competitive package: Reflecting your expertise and the critical nature of healthcare IT support 



Purpose-driven culture: Where every ticket resolved means a healthcare worker can focus on patients, not technology 



Join Our Mission 



We need someone who understands that true leadership isn't about having all the answers, it's about knowing which questions to ask and when to ask them. Someone who finds fulfilment not in being the hero, but in creating an environment where heroes emerge naturally from your team. 



If you're ready to use your insight to transform how healthcare IT works, your judgment to navigate critical decisions, and your ability to elevate others to build something extraordinary, let's talk about how you can help us eliminate repetitive IT tasks for 1 million healthcare workers.

title: Customer Experience Virtual Assistant (Phone Based)
description:
Customer Experience Virtual Assistant (Phone-Based, Process-Driven)



Job Overview



Are you someone who takes pride in handling customer interactions the right way—calmly, professionally, and consistently? Do you do well with clear expectations, scripts, and processes, and enjoy improving quickly through feedback? If so, Maid In America Cleaning Services, based in Clarksville, TN, wants to hear from you.



We’re seeking a Customer Experience Virtual Assistant to serve as a frontline point of contact for our customers and a dependable executor of structured processes. Working closely with our sales and customer experience teams, you’ll be responsible for answering inbound calls, handling customer requests, following defined scripts, and routing issues accurately.



This role is process-driven and phone-heavy, especially during training. The work can be fast-paced at times, but it is highly structured. Your ability to stay calm, follow instructions precisely, and take coaching seriously will have a direct impact on customer satisfaction and team efficiency.



What You’ll Do



- Answer & Handle Inbound Customer Calls: Be the first point of contact for customers and new inquiries, answering calls promptly, professionally, and calmly while following provided phone scripts.

- Follow Scripts & Decision Trees: Handle common customer needs—such as scheduling questions, reschedules, basic service inquiries, and initial issue intake—by following clear scripts and escalation rules exactly.

- Route Requests Accurately: Determine when a request can be handled directly and when it should be escalated to the appropriate tea
mber, ensuring clean handoffs and no dropped balls.

- Create a Positive Customer Experience: Make customers feel heard, cared for, and confident that their request is being handled, even when issues or complaints arise.

- Document Interactions & Updates: Log accurate notes and updates in our systems so the internal team always has clear context and next steps.

- Support Structured Administrative Workflows: Execute defined backend processes (task tracking, updates, file movement, and follow-through) by following SOPs and checklists without skipping steps.

- Receive Coaching & Improve Quickly: Actively apply feedback on calls, scripts, and workflows, improving speed, accuracy, and confidence over time.



Who We’re Looking For



- Process-Driven & Detail-Oriented: You’re comfortable following scripts, checklists, and SOPs exactly, and you don’t skip steps or “freestyle” your work.

- Calm & Professional on the Phone: You communicate clearly and confidently, stay composed with customers, and can handle questions or mild frustration without getting flustered.

- Highly Coachable: You take feedback seriously, apply it quickly, and improve fast—especially when it comes to phone scripts and customer handling.

- Reliable & Consistent: You show up on time, follow through on tasks, and can be counted on to do things the right way every time.

- Comfortable with Structure: You prefer clear expectations, defined processes, and knowing exactly what “good” looks like in your role.

- Tech-Comfortable: You’re comfortable working inside tools like Slack, shared documents, and task systems—or you can learn them quickly with instructions.

- Strong Communicator: Whether by phone, chat, or written notes, you communicate clearly, professionally, and respectfully.



Our Core Values



- Walk by Faith

- Maximize Opportunity

- Give Freely

- Train Daily

- Do What You Say



If you share these values, we want you on our team to help drive our company forward.



Important Note: Screening Step



SERIOUS APPLICANTS ONLY:

Complete our personality test to see if there’s a mutual fit:


/p/fzxN5FC9302s 

Give honest answers; there are no right or wrong results.



Submit your application with the subject line beginning with the core value we’ve listed that you most resonate with.



IMPORTANT: When applying, please use AT LEAST 5 Apply Points



Skills & Requirements

- Fluent English: Strong spoken and written English is required. This is a phone-based role, and customers must be able to understand you clearly and comfortably.

- Customer Service Experience: Prior experience handling customer inquiries or support requests over the phone is required.

- Process & Administrative Competence: You’re comfortable following multi-step processes, documenting information accurately, and keeping systems up to date.

- Attention to Detail: You consistently capture the right information, follow instructions precisely, and avoid careless errors.

- Coachability: You’re open to feedback, willing to be corrected, and able to apply coaching quickly—especially when learning phone scripts and customer-handling expectations.

- Technical Readiness:

  - Reliable computer with backup power options

  - Quality headset and microphone

  - Quiet workspace suitable for phone calls

- Ability to Work Monday-Friday, 8AM-5PM CST.

- Reliable Internet & Backup Options: Stable internet connection with a backup plan to ensure consistent availability and responsiveness.



Why Join Maid In America Cleaning Services?



- Impactful Role: Your quick execution and initiative will directly affect customer satisfaction and operational efficiency.

- Growth-Oriented Culture: We embrace new ideas, reward proactive thinking, and train daily for continual improvement.

- Supportive Team: Collaborate with a group that values each other’s contributions and thrives on a feedback-rich environment.



If you’re passionate about productivity, eager to work in a fast-paced setting, and confident in your ability to deliver high-quality results quickly, apply now and become an integral part of the Maid In America family!



Apply Today: Submit your application per the instructions above. We look forward to learning more about you!

title: E-commerce Assistant Store Manager – High-End Camping & Overlanding Store Launch
description:
About Us

We operate 2 profitable e-commerce stores and are launching our 3rd in the high-end camping and overlanding niche. This is a high-margin category with strong demand from customers who value quality gear and expert service.



You'll work directly with the owner during launch phase, seeing how we source products, set pricing, build marketing campaigns, and scale stores from zero to profitable. Most VAs never get this level of exposure to 7-figure e-commerce operations.



What This Role Actually Is

You'll manage operations (not people) for a new store during its critical launch phase. This means owning three core areas: customer experience, order fulfillment accuracy, and operational reporting.



As we scale and hire support staff in 6-12 months, you'll transition into team leadership. The systems and SOPs you build now become the foundation you'll eventually delegate.



Your Core Responsibilities (80% of your time)

Customer Service Management

• Handle all customer interactions via
, chat, and phone

• Process inquiries, returns, exchanges, and disputes professionally

• Maintain inventory accuracy in Shopify

• Flag stock issues before they become customer problems

Daily Operations Reporting

• Submit end-of-shift report covering: tasks completed, blockers encountered, support needed

• Track key metrics: orders processed, support tickets closed, errors caught

• Identify patterns that need owner attention



Secondary Responsibilities (20% of your time)

• Maintain accurate product listings (pricing, descriptions, inventory levels)

• Coordinate with vendors and dealer partners on orders and promotions

• Track sales performance and identify conversion opportunities

• Document processes and update SOPs as workflows evolve

• Flag customer feedback patterns that should inform product or marketing decisions

• Support seasonal campaigns (BFCM, holiday promos)



What You Need to Succeed

Required Experience

• 2+ years in e-commerce operations (customer service + order management + platform administration)

• Proven Shopify experience: building listings, managing inventory, processing bulk updates

• Experience managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

Technical Requirements

• Proficiency with Shopify, ClickUp, Airtable, and Google Workspace (or ability to learn quickly)

• Reliable computer setup and 20+ Mbps internet connection

• Backup solutions for both power and internet outages



Work Style

• Self-directed: you identify and solve problems without waiting for instructions

• Detail-oriented: accuracy matters more than speed

• Customer-focused: you view complaints as opportunities to improve systems

• Process-minded: you naturally document and refine how things get done



Bonus

• Knowledge of outdoor, camping, or overlanding gear

• Previous experience in a store launch or fast-growth phase



Work Schedule

• Full-time: 40 hours per week

• U.S. business hours: 9 PM–6 AM PHT or 10 PM–7 AM PHT (depending on Daylight Saving Time)

• 1-hour daily break

• Five days per week



Why This Role Matters

• You're not just processing orders. You're building the operational foundation for a store in a high-margin niche. During the trial period and first 6 months:

• You'll learn how we source, price, and market products from experienced operators running multiple 7-figure stores

• Your input shapes the SOPs and systems we'll use to scale

• You get first consideration for team lead and category manager roles when we expand

• You'll have direct access to the owner for mentorship on e-commerce strategy

• This isn't a stepping-stone VA role. It's employee #1 for a store with serious growth potential.



You're NOT a Fit If:

• You need micromanagement or detailed daily task lists

• You can't work 9 PM–7 AM PHT consistently

• You experience frequent power/internet outages without backup solutions

• You view this as temporary income between other opportunities



Application Instructions

To be considered, follow these instructions exactly:

Subject Line:

[Your First Name] – I Am Your New E-Commerce Operations Manager

(Example: Kevin – I Am Your New E-commerce Assistant Store Manager)

Include:

Cover letter (focus on relevant e-commerce experience)

Resume



Answer These Questions (numbered format, complete sentences):

• Describe your most relevant e-commerce operations experience: platform used, team size, daily order volume, and specific responsibilities you owned.

• What specific Shopify tasks have you performed? (Be detailed: inventory management? Bulk uploads? App integrations? Product page optimization?)

• Provide an example of a difficult customer service situation you handled: what was the issue, what did you do, and what was the outcome?

• What are your current work commitments and availability?

• Provide your internet speed (attach speed test screenshot), computer specifications, and describe your backup solutions for power and internet outages.

• Why are you interested in this role specifically, rather than other VA positions?



Important: AI-generated or template responses will be immediately disqualified. We're looking for thoughtful, specific answers that demonstrate you read and understood this posting.

title: Virtual Executive Assistant
description:
I'm the founder of a digital growth marketing company that helps mission-driven founders scale their businesses with more ease & less overwhelm - and I'm looking for a small team of highly-skilled Executive Assistants to help take over the marketing and management tasks that make a huge difference in the lives of the people that hire us.



I'm looking for a max of 5 amazing executive assistants available for part-time (potential for full time) with a salary starting at $500 USD per month and with long term success and robust training, moving up to $700 USD per month as an emerging leader in the company.



If you have the following skill sets, I encourage you to apply:



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

- Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in Digital Marketing, Video Editing, Social Media Management, Content Creation, and Executive Assistant Work (Administrative Tasks, Calendar &
 Management, etc)

You’re trusted to manage marketing deliverables while providing high-level executive support, keeping priorities organized, systems moving, and leadership focused on growth instead of day-to-day execution. You've done it all from managing schedules to
 & calendar management. You have a meticulous eye for detail where Prioritization and Organization are your love language



-- 1+ years of experience in Sales Funnels and Shopify

You're a professional who is passionate about helping changemakers simplify their lives by setting up systems that will allow them to operate their businesses with more ease and less overwhelm. You have experience with sales funnel and CRM software



- 1+ years of experience advertising on platforms like Instagram,
, Tik Tok, within a Marketing team consisting of Paid Acquisition, Organic Marketing, Customer Retention, & Product Marketing

You're an emerging leader who has the potential to head a team in the future that will report directly to you. Having leadership experience is a MAJOR plus



- Creating SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures)

You’ll ensure each business function has detailed documentation for repeatable and scalable growth if it isn't already place. If you see gaps, you take the initiative to fill them and produce results without anyone knowing there was an issue (yea, all that and a bag of chips :-)



- Experience working at a digital/online product/platform: You’re familiar with online courses, digital products & platforms and popular tools in the business space ranging from landing page builders and
 service providers to CRMs, and course hosting platforms aren’t foreign to you (We teach tools like Shopify, Convertkit, Kajabi, Teachable, Learnworlds, Calendly, etc)



ABOUT YOU:

- “You down with SOP? Yeah you know me!”—You’re an advocate for SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) to make our systems repeatable & scalable.

- Your love language is processes & predictable, meteoric growth. We never question company progress towards the quarterly and yearly goals because you keep real-time metrics for all projects.

- You’re aware of new software and can look at current systems and identify how to automate tasks a company has been doing manually for months.

- You’re addicted to digital processes & automation in the world of social media because you love building connections in the digital space and you’ve seen how powerful it can be in business growth

- You’re driven by metrics & tracking. You know that you can’t improve something unless you measure it, so you develop ways to measure performance so your company is always predictably improving.

- Timeliness and deadlines are your jam. When we have a team call at 10:00am, you show up at 9:55am. When the deadline is Tuesday at 5:30pm, you have it done Monday.

- You overcommunicate clearly and confidently. If you agree/disagree with something, you communicate that without hesitation or overthinking. You’re no stranger to asking why we do things a certain way to ensure we’re intentional with our resources.

- You’re a leader and team player. Ego? What ego? If something needs to be done, you dive in to make sure all critical tasks are accounted and cared for.



If you’re nodding your head “Yes” to the above, proceed below to apply.



PERKS:

I'm committed to setting our staff up for success with access to trainings that will certify your skills in:

- Task & Calendar Management

- Launch/Sales Strategy Planning

- Sales Funnel Tech Setup (For E-Commerce or Service Based Businesses)

- Social Media Management

- Digital Media Marketing (Including
 and SMS Marketing)

- Lead Generation



After one week of training and assessment, you're officially certified under our internal training program, which means hitting the ground running with your new skills. Perks include:

- Part time work hours

- Work from anywhere in the world (as long as your internet signal is strong and computer is fast)

- Starting Salary at $500 USD a month ($6000 USD annual)

- Internal certification program to enhance your professional skills in your career (I have helped clients amass at least $10M from the same digital growth marketing strategies I will require you to learn)



Interested? Please reply to this post with the secret keyword "APPLES" so I know you can pay attention to detail - from there, I'll let you know next steps if you qualify.

title: Customer Support Specialist and Sales Support
description:
Overview

Product Management Accelerator (PMA) helps ambitious professionals pivot their careers into digital product management roles and grow as product leaders at leading tech companies such as FAANG companies and startup unicorns through Dr. Nancy Li’s PROFIT framework, as featured in Forbes. Our graduates accelerate their careers, make an impact, and negotiate a top salary.



We’re one of the fastest-growing companies in the product management space and are looking for a Customer Success Specialist to ensure customer satisfaction and build our alumni community to help us make the product management field accessible to all.



About the Role

As a Customer Support Representative and Sales Support, you will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service to our clients and supporting our sales team. You will be the first point of contact for our customers, ensuring that their needs are met and providing solutions to their concerns.



Key responsibilities include:

- Identify and connect with potential customers through customized messages using
, LinkedIn, Instagram, and other platforms.

- Respond to customer inquiries via phone,
, chat, or other communication channels.

- Make phone calls or Zoom calls with students or prospective students to understand their needs and study progress, and collect student feedback.

- Provide product and service information to customers and identify upselling opportunities.

- Resolve escalated or complex calls from customers with professionalism and patience.

- Conduct online community management, including facilitating engagements, creating community events, and answering questions

- Proactively monitor performance metrics 

- Create and manage online and offline events through Meetup, LinkedIn Events, Eventbrite

- Communicate with event attendees and manage event logistics



Other Activities

Collaboration with the team when necessary 

Attend tea
etings for updates

Other activities assigned by the company as needed



Requirements:

Very fluent in English

Able to speak on the phone with students or prospective students for about 3 hours per day.

Bachelor's degree preferred.

Minimum of 2 years of experience in Customer Support or a related field.

Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Ability to handle complex customer situations with empathy and understanding.

Proficient in using computer systems and customer relationship management 

Respond to customer inquiries in a timely manner, such as within 10 minutes or a reasonable time frame during normal business hours.

Respond to urgent customer requests during the weekends if urgent matters occur.

Proactive and able to work independently as well as part of a team.

Work hours: Monday to Friday 9am to 12:30pm EST and 8:30pm-12am EST, (7 hours/day) and 5 hours during the weekend, total of 40 hours/week, Or nightshift from 9:30am EST to 6pm EST (7.5 hours/day) with one hour break/rest in the middle and 2.5 hours during the weekend. Total 40 hours/week. Subject to change based on team needs



This is a full-time job. If you have other full-time or part-time jobs, please DON’T apply. 





Company Culture 

At PM Accelerator, we value a growth mindset, community service, and efficiency. We inspire and train each of our tea
mbers to quickly become masters and leaders of their discipline and accelerate their personal and professional growth. 



PM Accelerator donates a percentage of our earnings to educational nonprofits providing entrepreneurship and mentorship to children from underserved communities. We encourage each tea
mber to give back to their communities and make an impact. 



Watch the 2min Forbes interview to learn about the company culture:







Benefits:

Competitive pay and performance-based incentives, such as sales commission.

Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Access to community/company training programs





How To Apply

Submit your resume through the job board where we post this JD. DON’T
 us your application; it will get lost. We review all the applications within 24 business hours.

Why do you want to work for PMA and why are you the right fit for this role

All applicants will receive a take-home exam to assess your skills

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
description:
About the Role

We’re a fast-growing tech startup (~30 people) looking for a sharp, resourceful Executive Assistant to keep our leadership team running at peak performance. You’ll work directly with the CEO and two to three senior executives, serving as the operational backbone that allows them to focus on building and scaling the business.

This is a fully remote role working West Coast hours. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, anticipates needs before they arise, and takes ownership of every detail—big or small.



What You’ll Do



Calendar Management

• Own and manage complex, ever-changing calendars for the CEO and senior executives across multiple time zones.

• Proactively resolve scheduling conflicts, prioritize meeting requests, and ensure leadership’s time is protected and well-allocated.



 Management

• Monitor, triage, and draft responses for executive inboxes, flagging urgent items and ensuring nothing falls through the cracks.

• Maintain inbox organization systems and follow up on outstanding threads on behalf of leadership.



Client Entertainment & Events

• Plan and coordinate client outings, including restaurant reservations for intimate dinners (2–10 guests), team events, and other hospitality-driven experiences.

• Research venues, manage invitations, and handle all logistics to ensure a seamless experience for clients and executives alike.



Travel Coordination

• Book and manage extensive domestic and international travel, including flights, hotels, and detailed itineraries.

• Anticipate travel disruptions and proactively rebook or adjust plans as needed.



Expense Management & General Admin

• Process and reconcile expense reports in a timely manner.

• Handle ad hoc administrative tasks and special projects as they come up—no two days look the same.



What We’re Looking For

• 2+ years of experience as an Executive Assistant, ideally supporting C-suite or senior leadership.

• Proven ability to manage multiple executives’ schedules and priorities simultaneously.

• Proficiency in Google Workspace (Gmail, Calendar, Docs, Sheets) and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

• Exceptional organizational skills with a strong attention to detail.

• Proactive mindset—you see what needs to be done and do it without being asked.

• Reliable, discreet, and comfortable handling confidential information.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Experience booking complex travel itineraries and coordinating events or client dinners.

• Comfortable working independently in a fully remote environment.



Nice to Have

• Experience at a startup or fast-paced tech company.

• Familiarity with tools like Slack, Notion, Expensify, or similar platforms.

title: Creative Strategist / Senior Executor (E-commerce)
description:
Creative Strategist / Senior Executor (E-commerce)



Role: Creative Strategist / Senior Executor

Focus: Static Ads — Health & Beauty / Problem-Solution Products

Industry: Dropshipping / DTC E-commerce

Type: Remote — Long-term



About The Role

We are looking for a high-level Creative Strategist who operates at the intersection of strategy and execution inside a performance-driven e-commerce company.



This role sits between the Owner / Media Buying layer and the Creative Production Team.



You translate performance insights and product direction into structured creative outputs that can be executed at scale.



You are not only responsible for ideation — but also for operationalizing those ideas into production-ready deliverables.



Role Positioning



You operate as the bridge between:

Owner / Media Buyer ? Creative Strategist ? Editors / Designers



This means you:

Understand performance data and scaling signals

Translate data into creative direction

Structure concepts and angles

Write clear creative briefs

Guide editors and designers

Oversee execution quality

You ensure strategy turns into output — without bottlenecks.



Core Responsibility

You own the full creative development pipeline:

From product analysis to launch-ready creatives.

Your responsibility includes:

Creative strategy development

Concept structuring

Angle ideation

Copy direction

Brief writing for editors

Static ad execution

Iteration on winning creatives

You function as both strategic lead and senior executor.

Strategic Thinking Framework



Your creative thinking follows a structured order:

1. Product Analysis

You start with deep product understanding — functionality, mechanism, transformation, positioning.



2. Avatar Identification

You define exactly who the creative is targeting.



3. Desire Mapping

You identify emotional and psychological purchase drivers.



4. Concept Development

You develop overarching creative directions for testing.



5. Angle Development

Within concepts, you structure multiple framings and entry points.



Concepts and angles are never treated as the same.



Execution & Production

You translate strategy into production-ready creatives.



Execution includes:

Hook direction

Copy overlays

Visual direction

Offer framing

Static ad builds



You are capable of producing creatives yourself when needed.



You do not rely fully on editors.



Editor & Creative Team Collaboration



We work with in-house editors and designers.



A core part of your role is structuring creative output for them.



This includes:

Writing structured creative briefs

Defining hooks and messaging

Explaining visual direction

Providing reference examples

Structuring variations

Giving feedback on drafts

You ensure production quality and speed stay high.

You are responsible for turning ideas into executable creative pipelines.

AI & Copywriting Stack



You are highly capable in AI-supported execution.



Tools include:

Claude for copywriting and messaging

AI image generation tools

Design platforms

Creative automation workflows

You know how to prompt and refine outputs for performance-driven advertising.



Creative Focus

Primary focus is static ads:

Problem-solution creatives

Before/after statics

Split panels

Offer creatives

Infographic statics

Lifestyle visuals



You understand what converts in paid social environments.



Required Experience

Proven experience in dropshipping or DTC e-commerce

Direct response advertising background

Paid social creative experience (Meta preferred)

Experience in health & beauty is a strong plus

Experience working with editors or creative teams

You understand both strategy and production realities.

Performance Expectations



You are expected to:

Build structured creative testing pipelines

Produce high volumes of statics

Write clear editor briefs

Launch creatives consistently

Iterate based on performance data

Expand winning concepts and angles

You optimize for performance — not aesthetics alone.



Work Environment & Culture

We operate in a high-performance environment focused on:

Execution speed

Ownership

Accountability

Self-development

Strong work culture



We value individuals who want to grow within a scaling organization.



Success Indicators

Success in this role is measured by:

Winning creatives launched consistently

Strong creative briefing systems

High editor output efficiency

Scalable concepts identified

Improved acquisition performance

Faster iteration cycles



Your work directly impacts revenue growth.



Interest?



Are you a true Creative OG in this field?

title: Accounts Receivable Specialist
description:
We are hiring an Accounts Receivable Specialist to manage invoicing, collections, and payment processing across QuickBooks and Xero with precision and professionalism. During non-busy hours, this role also serves as a Virtual Assistant (VA) for general administrative tasks such as data entry and Quality Assurance (QA).



Key Responsibilities:

Invoicing & Categorization: create and post invoices in both QuickBooks and Xero with accurate General Ledger (GL) categorization

Billing Dispatch: send invoices to clients promptly via
 or portal

Collections: handle weekly collections cycle for overdue accounts using both phone calls and
s

Payment Processing: receive and record customer payments

Virtual Assistant Support: perform copy-and-paste data tasks, QA checks, and other simple administrative duties during non-peak hours

KPI Tracking: track and submit weekly Key Performance Indicators

Account Maintenance: update customer contact info and billing preferences

Process Documentation: Create and maintain SOPs in Wiki

Confidentiality: Protect confidentiality of all financial information

Collaboration: Cross-team collaboration and continuous process improvements

Qualifications:

Basic understanding of GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles)

1+ year of experience in an accounting or bookkeeping support role

Familiarity with QuickBooks and Xero

Strong attention to detail and data accuracy

Excellent organizational skills and ability to meet weekly deadlines

Comfortable working independently in a remote setting

Proactive communication and follow-through

Highly organized and reliable

Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision

Willingness to ask questions and confirm details before booking entries

A plus to have:

Certification QuickBooks certification

Familiarity with Wiki Experience creating and updating documents in any wiki platform

Advanced Excel Skills VLOOKUP or XLOOKUP, PivotTables, and data analysis tools

Project Management Tools Proficiency with Asana or related tools

GAAP Strong working knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles

Equipment and Workspace Requirements

To ensure optimal performance and reliability, candidates must meet the following technical and environmental specifications:



Computing Hardware: A reliable desktop or laptop running Windows 10 or newer, equipped with a minimum of an Intel i5 / AMD Ryzen 5 processor and 8GB of RAM.

Internet Connection: A dedicated Fibre optic connection is mandatory, providing a minimum speed of 20 Mbps synchronous (upload and download) and a latency below 250 milliseconds. Wi-Fi and LTE connections are strictly prohibited.

Workspace: A quiet, dedicated professional workspace is required.

Peripherals: Must possess a high-quality noise-cancelling USB headset and a second monitor for enhanced workflow efficiency.

Power Reliability: Must have a reliable backup power source to maintain

Working hours (Changed if needed)



Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM (Eastern Standard Time)

2 small 15-minute breaks per shift

1 Lunch break of 1 hour per shift

Compensation: Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.



To apply, and demonstrate your commitment to a sustained role with the company, please forward your CV/résumé to

title: Part-Time Bookkeeper (UK VAT & Xero Specialist)
description:
About the Business



We are a growing UK property company operating serviced accommodation and property investments. We are now VAT registered and require a competent, detail-driven Bookkeeper to manage our financial records accurately and in compliance with UK regulations.



This is not a general VA role, we are looking for a specialist with strong Xero and UK VAT experience who understands Making Tax Digital (MTD) requirements.



Role Overview



We are seeking a reliable and experienced Bookkeeper who:



Is highly proficient in Xero

Understands UK VAT regulations

Is confident with Making Tax Digital (MTD) compliance

Can reconcile bank accounts accurately

Can manage invoice organisation and financial records

Works independently and proactively

This role is critical to the business as we scale.



Key Responsibilities

Bookkeeping & Financial Management

Maintain accurate records in Xero

Reconcile bank accounts (multiple accounts)

Allocate income and expenses correctly

Post and reconcile sales invoices including booking fees and commissions

Organise and categorise invoices and receipts

Ensure VAT is applied correctly (standard-rated, zero-rated where applicable)

Prepare VAT return data in line with Making Tax Digital

Liaise with accountant where required



Compliance & Organisation



Ensure financial records are compliant with UK requirements

Maintain digital audit trail

Keep financial documents organised in cloud storage

Identify discrepancies and flag issues early

Essential Requirements

Proven experience using Xero (Advanced Level)

Strong understanding of UK VAT law

Experience with Making Tax Digital (MTD)

Ability to reconcile bank accounts accurately

High attention to detail

Strong written English

Reliable and consistent availability

Desirable (Not Essential)

Experience working with UK property businesses

Knowledge of serviced accommodation income structures

Experience managing multi-entity bookkeeping



Hours & Pay

4-6 hours per week to start

Remote



Rate: $5.50–$7.50 depending on experience

Paid monthly upon invoice

Independent contractor position



What We Are Looking For



We need someone who:



Takes ownership of their work

Understands the seriousness of VAT compliance

Is consistent and dependable

Is comfortable working independently

Can grow with the business



How to Apply



Please include:



Your experience with Xero and UK VAT

Your experience with Making Tax Digital

A brief explanation of how you reconcile a bank account in Xero

Your hourly rate

Availability per week

reply to this job description with the title 'Part-Time Bookkeeper (UK VAT & Xero Specialist)' in the subject header



Applications without the requested information will not be considered.

title: Social Media Trend Researcher (Trading Niche)
description:
Social Media Trend Researcher (Trading Niche)



About Us

Falcon Funded, based in Dubai, UAE, is a global leader in trading education. With over 10,000 satisfied clients worldwide, we offer cutting-edge training and resources to keep traders ahead in the dynamic Forex market.



Role type: Freelance / Part-time / Remote

Industry: Trading, Finance, Lifestyle Content



What you’ll do:

Your one job: find trends before they’re everywhere.

You’ll be responsible for spotting global viral trends on platforms like TikTok, Instagram

Reels, X 
), and YouTube Shorts and translating them into ideas we can use in the

trading & lifestyle niche.

This is not a posting or editing role - it’s purely trend discovery and ideation.



Responsibilities:

Daily/weekly research of viral and emerging trends

Spot trending

Sounds & audios

Video formats & hooks


 styles

Storytelling angles

Identify trends early (before they’re overused)

Explain how each trend can be adapted to trading content

Deliver trends in a simple format:

Link to the trend

Short explanation

Suggested hook or angle for trading

Keep an eye on global trends, not just one region



What we’re looking for:

You live on TikTok / Reels / X and naturally notice patterns

You understand what makes content go viral

You don’t need to be a trader but you must understand the trading audience

Strong instinct for timing (what’s about to pop vs what’s already dead)

Organized and clear in how you present ideas



Bonus points if you:

Have worked with viral pages before

Understand short-form storytelling

Can think in hooks, not just trends

Follow finance, trading, or “rich lifestyle” content



What success looks like

Consistent flow of fresh, usable trends

Content that feels current, relevant, and scroll-stopping

Helping our brand stay ahead instead of chasing trends late



Think you’re a good fit? Send your resume to

title: Design & Content Operations Assistant
description:
Role: Design & Content Operations Assistant

(Design-Led | Part-Time | 20 hours per week | 9am-1pm GMT)



**About Us

We are a UK-based storytelling consultancy. We help SMEs define their business story in just 16 words through fast-paced workshops and a proven STORY Framework. Our work sits at the intersection of strategy, storytelling, design, and practical execution.

This role exists to bring that thinking to life through high-quality creative assets, visual storytelling, and consistent content production.



**Role Overview

This is a hands-on execution role for a design-led content creator. You will work closely with the founder to turn strategic work (case studies, workshop outputs, frameworks, content ideas) into polished, on-brand assets for both us and our clients.



For the first phase, you will work exclusively on the founder’s internal materials to learn the visual style, structure and storytelling approach. Once aligned, you will gradually begin supporting client-facing projects.



This is not a strategy or decision-making role. It is ideal for someone who enjoys transforming ideas into finished creative work and maintaining consistent brand execution.





**Core Responsibility

Take one core input and multiply it into multiple high-quality outputs.

Example:

 One case study ?

 • 3 LinkedIn carousels

 • 5 single-image posts

 • 1 short reel or animated graphic

 • A branded PDF version

 • Supporting visuals for website or outreach



**Key Tasks & Responsibilities



1. Content Design & Production

• Design LinkedIn single-image posts and multi-slide carousels

 • Create graphics, templates, and branded assets in Canva

 • Produce simple social animations and lightweight video content

 • Design content layouts for storytelling packages (e.g., 50 short videos, 100+ photos, narrative-led visuals)

 • Resize, export, and format assets correctly for web and social channels



2. Brand Implementation & Style Consistency

• Apply brand guidelines accurately (fonts, colour systems, layout)

 • Refresh and modernise existing brand materials where needed

 • Maintain consistency across all digital touchpoints

 • Adapt the Halekorero style to different client brands once trained



3. Templates & Systems

• Build and maintain Canva templates for:

 – Social media posts

 – Carousels

 – Case studies

 – Client-ready PDFs

 • Update templates to be reusable, efficient and easy to modify

 • Ensure all content libraries and asset folders are clearly named and organised



4. Content Repurposing & Storytelling Execution

• Turn long-form inputs (case studies, workshops, notes) into short-form content

 • Transform rough inputs into clean, polished layouts

 • Format written case studies into branded PDFs

 • Create 1–2 page branded PDFs for sales, lead magnets or outreach

 • Support “story pack” creation:

 – Vertical short videos

 – Branded photo sets

 – Social-ready visual assets



5. Workshop & Toolkit Support

• Prepare slides, worksheets and supporting documents

 • Format workshop outputs into client-ready deliverables

 • Maintain and update templates, toolkit files and presentation materials



6. Collaboration & Growth

• Work closely with James to learn his preferred design style and narrative approach

 • Trial all design work internally before progressing to client work

 • Provide creative input while respecting established brand guidelines

 • Progress into a long-term creative support role as trust and alignment grow



**What This Role Does Not Include

• Strategy, messaging or brand positioning decisions

 • Tone of voice creation

 • Client workshops or meetings

 • Client relationship management

All creative direction and strategic inputs are provided.



**Skills & Experience



*Essential

• Strong Canva proficiency (templates, animations, organisation)

 • Excellent attention to detail and consistency

 • Ability to turn rough inputs into polished assets

 • Strong visual taste and storytelling instincts

 • Comfortable working from templates and brand guidelines

 • Reliable and able to work independently after training

 • Ability to work 20 hours per week (typically 9am–1pm GMT)



*Nice to Have

• Familiarity with LinkedIn content formats

 • Basic short-form video editing or animation

 • Experience supporting consultants, agencies or brand strategists

 • Understanding of modern brand identity systems

 • Confidence adapting styles for multiple industries



**Ideal Candidate Profile

• Creative, adaptive and a fast learner

 • Enjoys structured workflows and behind-the-scenes execution

 • Junior to mid-level designer with a clean, modern portfolio

 • Takes pride in producing consistent, aesthetically strong work

 • Comfortable receiving direction and iterating quickly

 • Reliable, trustworthy and organised



**Working Arrangement

• Part-time, remote (20 hours/week)

 • Paid monthly

 • Reporting directly to the founder

 • Initial focus on internal branding and content

 • Gradual progression into client projects once aligned

 • May involve test tasks for client work

 • Long-term embedded support role



**Success Indicators

• Strong stylistic alignment with the founder’s visual approach

 • High-quality creative output delivered consistently

 • Ability to turn strategic ideas into refined, usable assets

 • Reliable communication and speed of delivery

 • Clear improvement in the efficiency of content production

 • Successful internal phase followed by smooth transition to client work



**How to apply

Please fill out this form:  
 

Note: Sending only a message here without completing the form will NOT be considered.



Looking forward to meeting you!

description:

Type: Contract / Freelance

About the Role

title: Life Manager (Marketing Assistant) - Remote Full Time
description:
Hello, we are looking to hire a life manager to support our agency and founder with the agency’s day-to-day operations



This is not a personal assistant role and not a traditional executive assistant role



You will help design, manage, and run systems across both work and personal life so everything operates smoothly, predictably, and with minimal mental overhead



The goal is not just to complete tasks, but to reduce decision fatigue, improve organization, and create leverage through systems, structure, and proactive execution





What success looks like in this role?



• Fewer things falling through the cracks

• Clear priorities every day and week

• Tasks and projects move forward without constant reminders

• Life and business logistics feel “handled”

• Less chaos, more clarity



If that sounds exciting to you, this role fits!



Core responsibilities



Daily / Ongoing



• Managing tasks, reminders, and follow-ups

• Keeping systems organized and up to date

• Tracking priorities and deadlines

• Proactively flagging issues or bottlenecks

• Communicating clearly and concisely



Weekly



• Light project management and coordination

• Reviewing open loops and unfinished items

• Improving existing systems and workflows

• Preparing summaries and updates



Ongoing improvement



• Creating structure where there is chaos

• Documenting processes

• Suggesting better tools or workflows

• Learning fast and adapting to new responsibilities





What we care most about (non-negotiables)



• Full-time dedication only

This must be your only professional role. No side jobs, no freelance work, no agencies.



• High loyalty and long-term mindset

We’re looking for someone who wants stability and growth together, not short-term gigs.



• Extreme attention to detail

You notice small things others miss. You double-check. You follow instructions exactly.



• Ownership mentality

You don’t wait to be told what broke. You flag it, fix it, and improve the system



• Always hungry to learn

You enjoy getting better, learning tools, and expanding responsibility





Skills and experience (flexible but important)



• Some project management experience

• Comfortable working with tasks, deadlines, and priorities

• Familiar with tools like Notion, ClickUp, Asana, Trello, Google Docs, or similar

• Strong written English

• Calm under pressure

• Organized and structured by nature



Experience matters less than how you think



Who this role is NOT for (this saves time)



This role is not a fit if:

• You want to juggle multiple jobs

• You only want to execute tasks you’re told

• You dislike structure, systems, or documentation

• You need constant supervision

• You prefer short-term work



Questions:



Question 1:

Are you comfortable working US (EST) time zone?



Question 2:

Why are you specifically looking for a full-time, long-term role instead of multiple clients or freelance work?



Question 3:

Why are you interested in this role specifically?



Question 4:

What previous experience do you have (work or personal) that would make you a good fit for this role?



Question 5:

What tools or systems have you used to stay organized in past roles?





Important:

To apply, start your application message with the word “Structure” on the first line.



Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed



Breakdown Of the Initial Days:



First 30 days:



• Execute tasks accurately

• Learn systems and expectations

• Build trust through consistency



After 60–90 days:



• Proactively manage systems

• Improve workflows

• Take ownership of recurring areas

• Act as a second brain, not just support

title: Executive Assistant to CEO
description:
We are looking for a highly proactive, trustworthy, and service-minded Executive Assistant to support our CEO and help run both business and life with excellence.



This is not a typical assistant role. We are searching for someone who thinks ahead, protects time, handles details without reminders, and genuinely cares about doing things well. If you take pride in being dependable, organized, positive, and proactive — this role may be for you.



About the Role

As Executive Assistant to the CEO, you will act as a buffer, organizer, and strategic support partner. Your mission is to make sure nothing falls through the cracks and that the CEO’s time, energy, and focus are protected.

You should be someone who:

• Anticipates needs before being asked

• Handles tasks completely and independently

• Communicates clearly and attentively

• Takes ownership and follows through

• Brings a calm, positive, and service?oriented attitude



You should be so organized that reminders are rarely needed.

Responsibilities

• Executive calendar,
, and task management

• Acting as a buffer and gatekeeper for the CEO

• Tracking tasks, deadlines, and follow?ups without reminders

• Organizing documents, systems, and workflows

• Handling personal and business?related tasks with discretion

• Helping build and manage the CEO’s personal brand on social media

• Assisting with content coordination, scheduling, and posting

• Supporting automation workflows (Zapier or similar tools)

• Communicating with internal and external stakeholders professionally

• Identifying opportunities to improve efficiency and systems



Required Qualifications

• Proven experience working directly for a CEO or senior executive

• Extremely organized and detail?oriented

• Proactive — you see what needs to be done and do it

• High level of integrity, trustworthiness, and confidentiality

• Strong written and verbal English communication skills

• Tech?savvy and comfortable learning new tools

• Experience with Zapier or other automations (or strong willingness to learn)

• Familiarity with social media platforms (especially for personal and business branding)



Our Values

We are deeply committed to:

• Positivity

• Initiative

• Dependability

• Attentive communication

• Service?mindedness



We are looking for someone who aligns with these values and wants to grow long-term with us.



Benefits

• Salary: USD $1,000 – $1,250 per month (based on experience)

• After 90 days, you become eligible for:

• Paid HMO

• 15 days Paid Time Off (PTO)

• Paid U.S. holidays

• Monthly rice subsidy



How to Apply

Please provide::

1. A resume

2. A video recording describing your experience supporting a CEO or executive and examples of systems, automation, or organization improvements you’ve handled

title: Virtual Assistant for Fantasy Author (TikTok, Canva, Email)
description:
Virtual Assistant Responsibilities (Fantasy Author Support)



Reports to: N.M. McCarty, Fantasy (Romantasy, Dark Fantasy, High/Epic Fantasy) Author

Objective: Support author brand growth by managing social media content, reader engagement, and marketing tasks to increase visibility, followers, and book sales.

Position Type: Part-time – 20 hours per week / $500 per month



-------



Social Media Management

 • Plan and schedule consistent posts on TikTok, Instagram, and
.

 • Repurpose content (e.g., turn TikTok videos into Instagram Reels).

 • Write captions, hashtags, and CTAs that resonate with fantasy readers.

 • Engage with followers by replying to comments, DMs, and interacting in fantasy communities.

 • Track trends (BookTok challenges, aesthetics, tropes) and suggest relevant ideas.



-------



Content Creation

 • Design branded graphics in Canva (quotes, teaser art, book mockups).

 • Edit short video clips for TikTok/Reels (book aesthetics, author updates).

 • Create and manage Pinterest boards for book aesthetics and worldbuilding.

 • Assemble “snackable” content such as character teasers, lore snippets, and maps.



-------



ARC & Review Team Management

 • Set up ARC distribution (BookFunnel/StoryOrigin).

 • Track ARC readers and send reminders for reviews.

 • Collect and organize reviews/testimonials for marketing use.

 • Maintain a reviewer spreadsheet (Bookstagrammers, BookTokers, bloggers).



-------



Newsletter &
 Marketing

 • Design and schedule newsletters via MailerLite or ConvertKit.

 • Write engaging updates (cover reveals, release countdowns, lore extras).

 • Manage reader magnet delivery (short story, prequel, or sample).

 • Track subscriber growth and engagement.

 • To ensure attention to detail, include the word marmalade at the beginning of your application title.



-------



Marketing & Promotion

 • Research and join group promotions (BookFunnel/StoryOrigin cross-promos).

 • Schedule and manage giveaways (Goodreads, Instagram, newsletter swaps).

 • Coordinate with fantasy influencers for features or collaborations.

 • Research keywords and categories to boost book visibility.

 • Track promotions and provide simple performance reports.

 • Conduct outreach to local bookstores and libraries.

 • Assist with book tour planning.



-------



Publishing & Admin Support

 • Assist with uploading files and metadata to KDP, IngramSpark, and Draft2Digital.

 • Double-check ISBNs, BISAC codes, and keywords.

 • Maintain and update the launch timeline/calendar.

 • Organize contracts, invoices, and launch assets (covers, blurbs, ARCs).



-------



Website & Branding

 • Update author website with book details, release dates, and newsletter sign-up.

 • Maintain a press kit (bio, headshots, book covers, blurbs).

 • Ensure branding (colors, fonts, tone) is consistent across all platforms.



-------



Analytics & Reporting

 • Track social media growth (followers, reach, engagement).

 • Monitor newsletter performance (opens, clicks).

 • Provide monthly reports with insights and suggestions.

 • Track book sales across Amazon and other platforms if accessible.



-------



Optional Advanced Tasks (if skilled)

 • Running Amazon Ads or
/TikTok Ads.

 • Formatting ebooks or paperbacks in Vellum or Atticus.

 • Podcast guest outreach.

 • Managing Patreon or Kickstarter campaigns for special editions.

 • PR and influencer outreach for collaborations or features.



-------



Skills & Qualifications

 • Strong knowledge of social media trends, especially BookTok and Bookstagram.

 • Experience with content scheduling tools (Later, Buffer, Hootsuite, Metricool).

 • Familiarity with fantasy genre aesthetics and tropes to align with target readers.

 • Graphic design skills (Canva, Photoshop, or similar).

 • Video editing skills (CapCut, InShot, or TikTok’s native editor).

 • Strong copywriting skills for engaging posts, captions, and newsletters.

 • Knowledge of
 marketing platforms (MailerLite, ConvertKit, Mailchimp).

 • Familiarity with ARC distribution platforms (BookFunnel, StoryOrigin).

 • Organized, proactive, and able to follow a content calendar.



-------



Why Join Us



This is more than just a virtual assistant role — it’s a chance to be part of building a growing fantasy brand from the ground up. You’ll have creative freedom, the opportunity to help shape an author’s online world, and a front-row seat to the storytelling process behind every release.



We’re looking forward to meeting someone who’s as passionate about creativity, fantasy worlds, and marketing as we are. If that sounds like you, we can’t wait to read your application.

title: Spanish-Speaking Sales Caller – Jewelry Store (Part-Time, Remote)
description:
We're a family-owned jewelry store in downtown Los Angeles looking for a native Spanish speaker to make follow-up phone calls to warm leads who have already expressed interest in our products through Instagram.



This is NOT cold calling. Every person you call has already messaged us asking about jewelry — chains, pendants, rings, custom pieces. Your job is to call them, have a short friendly conversation, and encourage them to visit the store in person.



What you'll do every day:

- Log into our CRM (GoHighLevel) and check your assigned leads

- Call 10-20 warm leads per day (each call is 60-90 seconds)

- Follow a simple call script — greet them, reference what they were looking at, invite them to visit the store

- Try to get a specific day they plan to visit

- Log the outcome of each call in the CRM (we'll train you on this)

- Send a quick follow-up text if they don't answer



What we're looking for:

- Native Spanish speaker (this is required — all calls are in Spanish)

- Friendly, natural phone manner — you should sound like someone who works at the store, not a telemarketer

- Reliable and consistent — we need calls made every business day, no exceptions

- Comfortable using basic software (we'll provide full video training on our CRM)

- Previous experience in sales calling, appointment setting, or customer service is a plus but not required



What you DON'T need to worry about:

- You won't be closing sales on the phone

- You won't need to know jewelry pricing or technical details

- You won't be handling complaints or customer service issues



We'll provide:

- Complete video training on the CRM and call process

- A detailed SOP document with scripts and examples

- Ongoing support and feedback



Schedule: Monday–Saturday, 9:30 AM – 12:30 PM Pacific Time (3 hours/day). Can be flexible on exact hours as long as calls happen during our store hours (9:30 AM – 6:30 PM PT).



This is a long-term position for the right person. We want someone reliable who can grow with us.

title: Collections & Settlement Specialist
description:
We are looking for a high-energy Collections Specialist to join our law firm. We have 150+ active cases and we need someone who is determined to get results. In this role, your success is measured by your daily output—specifically, how many
s and follow-ups you send per day to keep cases moving toward a settlement.



The work involves reaching out to debtors who are avoiding payment. To get them to sign settlement agreements, you must be persistent, consistent, and fast. When a defendant finally responds, you must reply immediately to keep the 
ntum going. We aim to get settlement agreements signed every single day.



If you are a persistent person who isn't afraid of a challenge and enjoys hitting high daily targets, this is the job for you.



Requirements:

Hours: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM EST (graveyard shift)

Exclusivity: This is a full-time career. No side hustles or other jobs allowed.

Persistence: You must be comfortable with high-volume daily outreach.



To apply, please submit a 1-minute Loom video introducing yourself. If you do not send a NEW video with your application, I will skip your application. Thank you.

title: Healthcare Recruiter
description:
We are hiring a Healthcare VA Recruiter to support travel nurse and direct hire healthcare placements across the United States.



This is a structured, production-focused role. Success is measured by daily output, submission quality, and system accuracy.



Core Objective

Produce qualified candidate submissions that convert to placements.



What You’ll Do

• Source qualified healthcare candidates based on active job orders

• Conduct initial screening calls or meaningful two-way conversations

• Prepare submission-ready candidates

• Clean and format resumes

• Maintain accurate ATS and CRM records

• Follow up consistently until candidates are submission-ready

• Submit daily activity reports



Performance Expectations

This is a metrics-driven role with clear daily and weekly benchmarks.

You will be measured on:

• Sourcing volume

• Screening activity

• Submission quality

• Data accuracy and system compliance

This role includes a structured 90-day performance evaluation period. Continued employment is based on meeting performance standards.



Compensation

• $3 per hour during 90-day probation

• $5 per hour after successful completion of probation

Performance bonuses available based on submissions, placements, and retention milestones.

High performers earn significantly more through structured bonus incentives tied directly to results.



Required Skills

• Strong sourcing accuracy and role matching

• Basic Boolean search understanding

• Clear and professional English communication, written and verbal

• Strong attention to detail

• Ability to follow structured workflows

• Comfort working with daily metrics

Healthcare recruiting experience is required.



Work Setup Requirements

• Stable high-speed internet connection

• Backup internet solution required

• Quiet work environment

• Reliable computer setup



Application Requirements

 the following to 
 :

- Resume

- Screenshot of your internet speed test results

- A 2–3 minute audio or video answering: Your recruiting experience, Roles you have recruited for, and Why you want this role



Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



Acquire Medstaff is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
