title: ???? Senior Dropshipping Customer Support Specialist (NL/BE Market)
description:
Remote | Part-Time | $5/hour Starting Rate + Performance Bonuses + Fast Growth



We are a fast-scaling e-commerce brand operating in the Netherlands/Belgium market.



Within 7 days, we scaled from €0 to €10,000 per day in revenue.

Advertising is temporarily paused due to Chinese New Year.

From early March, we resume aggressive scaling with high projected volume.



We are not hiring a general VA.

We are hiring a strategic dropshipping operator who understands margin protection, refund control, and chargeback prevention at scale.



If you have real $100k+/month experience — this role will feel familiar.



???? Who This Role Is For



Apply only if you:



Have 5+ years of dropshipping customer support experience



Have worked in stores doing at least $100,000 per month



Are currently involved in one or more stores at that level



Have hands-on experience with China fulfillment and returns to Asia



Understand how refund rate and chargeback rate affect scaling



Can handle 40–80+ tickets per day during scaling periods



This is not entry-level.

We are hiring someone who already understands the business model deeply.



???? What You Must Master



You confidently handle:



7–12 business day shipping times



Delayed tracking activation



“Product not as expected” complaints



Quality issues



Refund pressure



Chargeback threats



Escalating customers



You understand that:



Returns to Asia are rarely profitable



Default strategy = 20?shback + customer keeps product



Maximum without approval = 30?shback



Above 30% requires manager approval



If cashback is refused, customer covers return shipping to Asia (at their own cost and risk)



The objective is always:

Customer keeps product + prevent chargeback + minimize refund rate



?? Chargeback ratio must stay below payment processor thresholds.



We operate strategically — not emotionally.



???? Strategic Contribution (Mandatory)



This role requires more than ticket handling.



You are expected to contribute proven strategies from other $100k+/month stores, including:



Refund reduction techniques



Chargeback prevention systems



Communication frameworks



Workflow optimizations



This is mandatory.



???? One-time bonuses are paid for strategies that measurably improve profitability.



We reward operators who think like owners.



???? Responsibilities



Handle incoming
s via Google Workspace



Respond to all
s within maximum 12 hours



Apply 20–30?shback strategy correctly



Reduce refund rate



Prevent chargebacks



Identify recurring issues and suggest improvements



Performance will be measured.



???? Compensation & Growth



Starting rate: $5/hour



7-day paid trial period



Hourly rate increase after proven performance



Ongoing performance bonuses based on:



Refund rate reduction



Chargeback reduction



Profit protection



Efficiency under volume



This role grows with results.



???? Experience Verification (Required)



Your application must include:



Stores you worked for (revenue range required)



Your exact responsibilities



Average tickets handled per day



Refund policy used in that store



Your personal KPIs



Your average refund rate



Your chargeback prevention strategy



You must be willing to verify experience via short video call or recorded explanation.



If you cannot prove real $100k+/month involvement, please do not apply.



? Mandatory Application Instruction



To confirm you have read this entire job post:



Start your application with the word:



SCALING



Applications without this word will not be reviewed.



We are building a serious scaling operation.

If you are an experienced dropshipping support operator who understands profit protection at scale, we look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Operations Analyst
description:
About Us



We are a fast-growing, forward-thinking company seeking a dependable and detail-oriented Operations Analyst to help optimize our systems and workflows. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on execution, enjoys solving problems, and is comfortable navigating multiple digital tools to ensure seamless operations.



We prioritize results, ownership, and reliability. If you’re someone who takes pride in delivering high-quality work and wants to grow with a dynamic team, we’d love to meet you.



Role Overview



As our Operations Analyst, you will play an essential role in maintaining the efficiency of our day-to-day operations. Working closely with an experienced Operations Analyst, you will support senior tea
mbers by executing key operational tasks and managing core systems.



This is a hands-on position that requires strong attention to detail, initiative, and the ability to confidently work across various tools and platforms. Your contributions will directly impact the team’s productivity and overall success.



If you enjoy improving processes, learning new systems, and making a meaningful impact behind the scenes, this role is a great fit for you.



Key Responsibilities



Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:



- Managing and maintaining operational systems across platforms such as WordPress, WooCommerce, and related tools

- Supporting sales operations through CRM management and
 automation setup

- Building and maintaining automated workflows using tools like Zapier, Calendly, and Typeform

- Creating, updating, and optimizing customer
 sequences

- Managing data, spreadsheets, dashboards, and internal reporting systems

- Assisting with customer support systems and workflow improvements when needed

- Identifying opportunities to streamline processes and reduce operational bottlenecks



Who We’re Looking For



We’re looking for someone who has:



- Strong technical and computer proficiency

- Experience working with online tools and platforms (WordPress, WooCommerce, Zapier, etc.)

- The ability to quickly learn and adapt to new software

- Strong written and verbal English communication skills

- Excellent attention to detail and the ability to complete tasks independently

- A dependable, professional work ethic with consistent output



Preferred (Bonus) Experience



- WooCommerce plugins such as FunnelKit and JetEngine

- Kit 
 marketing platform)

- CRM systems and automated
 sequencing

- Customer support tools like Zendesk and Circle.so



Compensation & Work Structure



- Full-time, salaried position

- Remote (work from home)

- No time tracking — we prioritize output and results over hours logged

- Competitive monthly compensation based on skills and experience

- Clear opportunities for growth as you take on more responsibility



Our Core Values



We value tea
mbers who demonstrate:



- Integrity and professionalism in all interactions

- Strong execution and follow-through

- Comfort working independently while knowing when to ask questions

- A proactive, solution-oriented mindset

- A desire to continuously learn and improve



How This Role Contributes



You will be a vital part of the operations team, ensuring systems run smoothly and efficiently. Working closely with the Operations Analyst, you’ll gain exposure to higher-level operational strategy and have the opportunity to grow into more complex, high-impact responsibilities over time.



We’re looking for someone who is ready to take initiative, manage multiple moving parts, and contribute to the long-term success of the company.



Hiring Process



1. Online application

2. Application review and screening

3. Interview

4. One-hour trial task

5. Final interview



If you’re excited about contributing to a growing team and making a measurable impact, we encourage you to apply. We’re looking for someone who can begin immediately.



How to Apply

title: Accountant with Australian experience / knowledge
description:
About the Role



We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Accountant to work for our team in Australia. The successful candidate will be responsible for preparing accurate financial reports, ensuring compliance with Australian taxation and statutory requirements, managing payroll, and overseeing debt collection processes.



This role requires strong technical knowledge of Australian accounting standards and tax regulations, along with excellent organisational and analytical skills.



Key Responsibilities



• Prepare accurate monthly, quarterly and annual financial reports in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards

• Prepare management reports, including profit & loss statements, balance sheets and cash flow statements

• Prepare and lodge Business Activity Statements (BAS) and Instalment Activity Statements (IAS)

• Manage and remit statutory obligations including:



o GST

o PAYG Withholding

o PAYG Instalments

o Superannuation Guarantee contributions

o Payroll Tax 

o Fringe Benefits Tax (FBT)

• Ensure compliance with ATO and other regulatory requirements

• Manage Single Touch Payroll (STP) reporting

• Process and manage end-to-end payroll, ensuring accuracy and compliance

• Oversee accounts receivable and lead debt collection activities, including following up overdue accounts

• Perform bank and general ledger reconciliations

• Assist with budgeting, forecasting and financial analysis

• Support external auditors and liaise with tax advisors when required



Skills & Experience



• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting

• CPA or CA qualification (or working towards) preferred but not mandatory

• Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar accounting role in Australia

• Strong knowledge of Australian taxation laws and compliance requirements

• Experience preparing and lodging BAS

• Proficiency in accounting software , preferably MYOB, although we plan to move to XERO in the future

• Advanced Microsoft Excel skills

• High level of accuracy and attention to detail

• Strong communication and problem-solving skills

• Ability to meet deadlines and manage competing priorities



What We Offer



• Competitive remuneration package including 13th month

• Supportive and collaborative work environment

• Opportunities for professional development and growth



You will be reporting to the CEO and will have external accounting advice and support from our external Tax accountant.

title: MORTGAGE LOAN OFFICER
description:
Overview

We are looking for a proactive, detail?driven Loan Officer to join our U.S.-based mortgage team. This long?term, remote role involves close coordination with borrowers, real estate agents, and internal processing teams to ensure a smooth loan experience from application through closing.



Must?Have Skills

1. Technical & Software Expertise



Loan Origination Systems (LOS): Hands-on experience with Encompass, Calyx Point, ARIVE, or LendingPad.

CRM Management: Skilled in platforms such as Salesforce, Jungo, or Pipedrive for tracking leads and client communication.

Automated Underwriting Systems (AUS): Ability to run and interpret findings from Desktop Underwriter (DU) and Loan Product Advisor (LPA).



2. Core Mortgage Knowledge



U.S. Lending Guidelines: Strong understanding of Conventional, FHA, VA, and USDA loan programs.

Regulatory Compliance: Familiar with TRID, RESPA, TILA, ECOA, and other U.S. mortgage regulations.

Income & Ratio Analysis: Competent in calculating DTI, LTV, and evaluating borrower income documentation.



3. Soft Skills & Remote Work Requirements



Advanced English (C1/C2): Excellent written and verbal communication for direct borrower interaction.

Night Shift Coverage: Must be able to work U.S. business hours 9am to 6 pm EST .

Reliable Tech Setup: High?performance computer, noise?canceling headset, and stable high?speed internet with backup.





Key Responsibilities



Lead Generation: Build and maintain referral networks with realtors, builders, and developers to attract potential borrowers.

Client Advising: Guide applicants through available loan products (FHA, VA, Conventional) and assess their eligibility.

Document Collection: Gather, organize, and validate borrower financial documents such as W?2s, tax returns, and pay stubs.

Pipeline Management: Oversee the loan process from application through closing, ensuring all deadlines and milestones are met.

Communication: Provide timely updates to borrowers and referral partners via phone,
, and CRM.

Loan Application Entry: Accurately complete and input the 1003 into the Loan Origination System.

Third?Party Coordination: Work with title companies, appraisers, and underwriters to clear conditions and move files to closing.

description:
We are looking for a highly experienced CRO Expert to optimize our general dropshipping stores on a weekly basis.



Your main responsibility will be ongoing conversion rate optimization. This is not a one-time project. We want someone who can continuously monitor, analyze, and improve our stores.



What you will do:



– Perform weekly analysis sessions inside Microsoft Clarity to identify UX issues, drop-offs, friction points, and theme-related mistakes

– Review user behavior (scroll depth, rage clicks, dead clicks, session recordings) and translate insights into actionable improvements

– Identify theme errors, layout inconsistencies, or structural weaknesses

– Optimize bestseller product pages (images, structure, copy, CTA positioning, trust elements, reviews, urgency elements, etc.)

– Improve product page flow and clarity

– Suggest and implement CRO improvements directly in Shopify

– Continuously test and refine for higher conversion rates



Requirements:



– Strong Shopify experience (mandatory)

– Proven CRO experience in e-commerce (mandatory)

– Experience with Microsoft Clarity or similar behavior tracking tools

– Deep understanding of product page psychology and buyer behavior

– Ability to independently identify improvement opportunities

– Structured and analytical mindset



Important:



– Freelancers only

– No agencies

– Portfolio is mandatory

– Proven case studies are mandatory

– Long-term collaboration preferred



We are looking for someone proactive who doesn’t just execute tasks, but actively looks for opportunities to increase revenue and conversion rate.



To apply, send:



– Your portfolio

– Case studies with measurable results

– Your hourly rate

– Your availability per week

– A short explanation of how you would approach weekly Clarity audits



If you cannot provide a portfolio and real results, please do not apply.

title: Sales Admin Assistant (Remote | Full-Time)
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Sales Admin Assistant to directly support our US-based Sales Team. This role is critical to keeping our sales operations running smoothly by managing scheduling, generating qualified leads, maintaining CRM accuracy, and handling key administrative tasks.



You will work closely with US sales representatives to ensure their calendars stay full, meetings run efficiently, and follow-ups never fall through the cracks. This is a fast-paced role that requires precision, strong communication skills, and the ability to manage multiple priorities.



Key Responsibilities



- Sales Call Scheduling

- Schedule and coordinate calls for US-based sales representatives

- Manage calendars across US time zones

- Send confirmations and reminders to prospects

- Handle rescheduling and resolve calendar conflicts quickly

- Ensure high attendance rates and minimal no-shows

- Lead Generation & CRM Management

- Research and identify qualified leads

- Build and maintain organized lead lists

- Input and update data accurately in the CRM

- Support outreach campaigns and follow-up tracking

- Ensure CRM records are clean and up to date

- Administrative Support

- Manage inbox communications related to scheduling

- Prepare reports and maintain tracking dashboards

- Organize documents and sales materials

- Assist with day-to-day administrative tasks to support the sales team



Requirements



- Proven experience as a Sales Admin Assistant, Executive Assistant, or Sales Support role

- Experience supporting US-based teams preferred

- Strong written and spoken English

- Experience scheduling across US time zones

- Familiarity with CRMs (HubSpot, Salesforce, GoHighLevel, or similar)

- Highly organized and detail-oriented

- Tech-savvy and able to learn new tools quickly

- Reliable internet connection (minimum 20 Mbps)

- Quiet and professional remote work setup

- Performance Expectations

- Sales calendars consistently filled

- Low meeting cancellation and no-show rates

- Accurate and organized CRM records

- Proactive communication and task follow-through

- Dependable daily execution without supervision



Position Details:

Full-Time Remote

Long-term opportunity

Competitive compensation based on experience

Growth opportunities for high performers



How to Apply

Please submit the following:



A short introduction about yourself

Your experience supporting sales teams

Tools and CRMs you have used

Include the word “Calendar Pro” at the top of your application

Applications without the keyword will not be reviewed.

title: Channel Manager – Faire.com
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a Channel Manager – 
 to fully manage and grow our wholesale marketplace on Faire. You will be responsible for day-to-day operations, sales growth, retailer communication, and campaign execution on the Faire platform.



This role requires someone who is hands-on, organized, and results-driven, with experience managing wholesale or B2B ecommerce channels.



Key Responsibilities

- Faire Account Management

- Manage daily operations of the 
 account

- Maintain and optimize product listings, pricing, bundles, and merchandising

- Ensure inventory accuracy, lead times, and product availability

- Follow Faire policies and best practices



Sales Growth & Performance

- Drive monthly revenue growth and retailer acquisition

- Set up and manage promotions, campaigns, and Faire-funded incentives

- Monitor performance metrics such as revenue, AOV, conversion rate, and reorders

- Identify opportunities to increase repeat orders and wholesale revenue

- Retailer Communication & Support

- Respond to retailer inquiries within 24 hours

- Build and maintain strong relationships with wholesale partners

- Assist with onboarding, reorders, and product questions

- Handle order issues, returns, and escalations professionally



Campaign Coordination

- Plan and execute Faire promotions and seasonal sales

- Coordinate with the internal marketing team for product launches

- Support new product launches on the Faire platform

- Reporting & Optimization

- Prepare weekly and monthly performance reports

- Track KPIs and suggest improvements based on data

- Continuously test and optimize listings, pricing, and promotions



Requirements

- At least 2 years experience managing 
 or wholesale marketplaces

- Strong understanding of wholesale and B2B ecommerce

- Experience working with US or North American brands

- Excellent written English communication skills

- Highly organized with strong attention to detail

- Comfortable working with numbers and performance metrics

- Able to work EST hours consistently



Nice to Have

- Experience with consumer goods, home, lifestyle, or beverage brands

- Experience with ecommerce platforms or marketplaces (Amazon, Shopify, etc.)

- Basic knowledge of inventory planning and forecasting



Performance Bonus (Up to $500/month)



Bonuses are based on:

- Monthly revenue growth

- Retailer acquisition and reorder rate

- Campaign execution and channel optimization

- Responsiveness and quality of work



Why Join Us

- Work from home with a stable, long-term opportunity

- Clear ownership of a key revenue channel

- Opportunity to grow with a fast-growing international brand



To Apply

Please include:

- A short summary of your Faire or wholesale marketplace experience

- Examples of Faire accounts or wholesale channels you’ve managed (if available)

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Work Setup: Onsite BGC (Philippines)

Work Schedule: Monday–Friday, 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM EST

Salary: PHP 65,000 basic salary + up to PHP 25,000 monthly performance bonus



We are seeking a disciplined, outbound-focused B2B Sales Development Representative (SDR) to support our wholesale and B2B growth initiatives. This role is responsible for reactivating dormant accounts, prospecting new wholesale customers, executing outbound outreach, and booking qualified meetings for the sales team.



This is a high-execution role that requires consistency, strong process discipline, and comfort with cold outreach. The ideal candidate follows SOPs closely, maintains accurate CRM records, and engages decision-makers with clear, professional messaging. You will work closely with the SDR Team Lead and sales leadership to ensure predictable and scalable outbound performance.



Key Responsibilities:



Execute daily outbound activity via phone,
, and assigned channels

Reactivate dormant wholesale accounts through structured follow-ups

Prospect and engage new B2B and wholesale accounts from assigned lists

Qualify prospects and book meetings that meet defined criteria

Follow established outreach cadences, scripts, and SOPs

Log all activities accurately in the CRM and maintain clean records

Handle objections professionally while representing the brand consistently

Participate in call reviews, coaching sessions, and performance reviews

Apply feedback to continuously improve outreach and conversion rates



Requirements



1–3+ years of experience in B2B sales, sales development, or outbound lead generation

Comfortable with cold calling and outbound
 outreach

Strong English communication skills (spoken and written)

Experience working with activity-based KPIs (daily calls,
s, follow-ups)

Strong CRM discipline (Salesforce or similar preferred)

Highly organized, reliable, and detail-oriented

Comfortable working US / North American time zones

Coachable, accountable, and able to execute with minimal supervision

title: Shopify Product Page Builder
description:
We are looking for someone experienced in quickly creating product pages using the Shopify Online Store theme for an eCommerce store.



How work will look like:

1. You will be given a product + links for inspiration.

2. You should be able to follow strong product page structures and apply relevant design inspiration to your work. 



From there, you will:

- Create the product page using the provided template

- Get images or generate them via AI (and remove backgrounds if needed)

- Generate copy with AI (benefits, sections, FAQs…)

- Create simple GIFs if needed

-Set up prices & offers inside Shopify apps 



In your application, mention “high CR” so I know you actually read this.



Answer these questions when you apply:

1) Do you have experience using Shopify to create product pages inside the Online Store theme?

2) Do you have a basic understanding of CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) for product pages?

3) Please run an internet speed test at https://www.speedtest.net/ and share your download & upload speed + screenshot.

4) Share links to product pages you’ve created.

title: AI Engineer
description:
About Us:

We are a fast-growing AI agency focused on building practical AI solutions for businesses. Our work includes AI automation, chatbots, workflow automation, integrations, and custom AI tools that help companies save time, reduce costs, and scale operations.

We work with startups, agencies, and event-based businesses, delivering real-world AI systems rather than experimental projects. We are looking for a skilled AI Engineer / AI Specialist who can help design, build, and deploy reliable AI solutions for clients.

This is a long-term role with strong growth opportunities as the agency expands.



Role Overview:

As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining AI-powered systems and automations for internal projects and client work. You will work closely with the founder and project team to turn business problems into working AI solutions.

You should be comfortable working independently, solving problems, and delivering production-ready systems.



Key Responsibilities:

- Develop AI chatbots and conversational workflows

- Design and implement AI automations and business workflows

- Integrate AI systems with APIs, CRMs, databases, and third-party tools

- Build internal AI tools to improve agency efficiency

- Optimise prompts, workflows, and AI outputs for reliability and performance

- Debug, improve, and maintain existing AI systems

- Document systems and workflows for team use

- Stay updated with new AI tools and suggest improvements



Required Skills & Experience:

- Strong experience working with AI APIs (OpenAI or similar)

- Experience with Python or JavaScript (Node.js preferred)

- Experience building AI automations or AI-powered applications     

-  API integration experience

- Experience with automation tools (Make, Zapier, n8n, or similar)

- Understanding of prompt engineering and AI workflow design

- Familiarity with databases (SQL or NoSQL)

- Strong problem-solving ability

- Good written English communication

title: Hr Representative
description:
Position Overview

We are seeking a tech-savvy Entry-Level HR Representative to support day-to-day HR operations and serve as backup support for payroll and employee administration. This role is ideal for someone early in their HR career who is highly organized, detail-oriented, and comfortable working with systems and spreadsheets. You will assist with employee records, onboarding/offboarding, HR documentation, and basic payroll support while following clear processes and maintaining confidentiality.

Key Qualifications

•

0–2 years of HR/admin experience (internship/entry-level acceptable)

•

Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business Administration, Psychology, Accounting/Finance, or related field (preferred)

•

Strong Excel skills (filters, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP basics, pivot tables preferred)

•

Comfortable learning HR/payroll systems (QuickBooks, UKG, or similar)

•

Strong attention to detail and ability to follow standardized processes

•

Professional written and verbal English communication

•

High discretion and ability to handle sensitive employee information

Essential Responsibilities

•

Support onboarding/offboarding tasks (checklists, document collection, account access coordination)

•

Maintain employee records and personnel file organization (digital filing, completeness checks)

•

Assist with benefits administration support (enrollment changes, tracking, employee follow-ups)

•

Support payroll preparation tasks (data gathering, timesheet checks, basic reconciliation support)

•

Help prepare HR reports and trackers (headcount, PTO tracking, compliance checklists)

•

Respond to routine employee questions and route complex issues to HR leadership

•

Support HR compliance documentation and audit readiness (organized records, timely updates)

•

Coordinate recruiting logistics as needed (scheduling, applicant tracking updates)

•

Identify process gaps and suggest improvements to templates, trackers, and workflows

Core Competencies Required for All Positions

We are seeking dedicated professionals who embody the following qualities:

•

Collaborative Professional: Collaborates effectively with colleagues, supports team goals, and contributes to a positive work environment while taking ownership of projects with respect and professionalism. Identifies opportunities for improvement, acts proactively without constant direction, and treats all stakeholders with dignity and courtesy

•

Strong Problem-Solving Skills: Analyzes complex situations, identifies root causes, and develops creative solutions

•

Resilient and Determined: Maintains composure and productivity during high-stress situations and tight deadlines; approaches challenges with optimism, flexibility, and unwavering determination. Does not give up easily and demonstrates the resilience needed to overcome obstacles and find effective solutions

•

Company-Focused: Demonstrates genuine commitment to organizational mission and takes pride in contributing to company success and growth

•

Fluency in English: Excellent written and verbal communication skills; able to articulate ideas clearly and professionally

Technical & Schedule Requirements

•

Reliable high-speed internet connection with consistent Wi-Fi stability

•

Laptop with sufficient memory and processing power to handle job-specific tasks and software

•

Availability to work night shift hours: 12:00 AM to 9:00 AM

Compensation:

Competitive contractor rate, based on experience and qualifications

Probationary Period & Performance Review:

3-Month Probationary Period: All contractors begin with a 3-month probationary period. At the end of this period, a comprehensive performance review will be conducted. Based on performance evaluation, salary adjustments and contract continuation will be determined.

title: Freelance Graphic Designer & Video Editor
description:
Project-based / Ongoing support

We’re looking for a freelance graphic designer & video editor to support us on a project basis with the creation of social media and promotional assets. The focus is on turning written social copy into clear, engaging, social-first visual content across multiple formats, aligned with brand guidelines.



The role

You’ll work with supplied social media copy, existing and/or raw footage and imagery, and light creative direction to create static and video assets that support our marketing and promotional activity.



Key platforms 

• LinkedIn is the primary platform.

• Instagram is the secondary channel.

• Potential video content for YouTube and the website.



Key outputs

• Static social media graphics, carousels and document posts 

• Animated graphics and motion elements

• Short-form videos both landscape and portrait (Reels, Stories, Short landscape videos)

• Long-form videos (YouTube)

• Promotional and campaign videos

• All design files need to be shared as packaged files as well as the final outputs 

________________________________________

What you’ll be doing

• Edit and enhance existing video footage, including interview content, brand and promotional videography

• Develop new video content where required, using supplied materials and creative direction

• Transform written social media copy into supportive creative assets (static and/or video)

• Create social-first visuals optimised for different platforms and formats

• Add captions, text overlays, motion elements, and basic sound design (royalty free) where needed

• Ensure assets align with brand guidelines and visual identity

• Deliver assets ready for publishing across platforms

________________________________________

Skills & experience we’re looking for



Video editing

• Strong experience editing short-form vertical video for social platforms

• Experience editing long-form video (YouTube, promos)

• Confident with pacing, hooks, captions, and on-screen text

• Comfortable working with interview-style footage

Tools: Adobe Premiere Pro or Canva Pro

________________________________________

Graphic design & motion

• Experience creating static social assets and animated graphics

• Strong eye for layout, typography, colour, and composition

• Ability to create simple motion graphics and animated text

• Comfortable working within existing brand guidelines

Tools: Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign or Canva Pro (depending on the type of work)  

________________________________________

Social media & content understanding

• Strong understanding of social media formats and best practices (LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)

• Experience designing mobile-first content

• Ability to visually highlight key messages and calls to action

• Understanding of what makes content engaging and clear on social

• Strong understanding of the different content types and tone of voice required across platforms, such as LinkedIn and Instagram

________________________________________

Working style

• Able to work independently with supplied copy and creative direction

• Comfortable extracting key messages from text and turning them into short call-to-actions and engaging visuals

• Open to feedback and iteration

• Reliable, organised, and deadline-driven

________________________________________

Engagement Type

• Freelance / project-based

• Ongoing collaboration possible depending on fit and workload

________________________________________

What to include in your application

If you are interested, please share:

• A portfolio of relevant video and design work

• A brief note on which platforms you’ve created content for and your preferred tools

• Your availability and hourly rate

________________________________________

title: Short Form Content Video Editor
description:
The Role

We are looking for a creative, high-energy Video Editor to transform our high-quality raw footage into viral-ready short-form content (TikTok, Reels, Shorts).



The good news: You don’t need to worry about the "what." We provide the 4K raw footage and the polished scripts. Your job is to focus entirely on the "how"—making the edit so engaging that viewers can’t look away.



Key Responsibilities

Narrative Pacing: Edit raw footage according to provided scripts while maintaining a fast, engaging flow.



Visual Hooks: Implement dynamic captions, B-roll, overlays, and transitions that stop the scroll within the first 3 seconds.



Sound Design: Use trending audio, SFX (whooshes, pops, hits), and level voiceovers for a cinematic feel.



Brand Alignment: Maintain a consistent visual style across all platforms.

title: Marketing Lead Generation Virtual Assistant
description:
HIRING: PART-TIME VIRTUAL ASSISTANT (Lead Generation & Admin Support)

Remote | Part-Time (with Opportunity for Full-Time)



We are currently looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support lead generation, outbound prospecting, and light administrative operations. This role focuses on identifying and engaging potential clients through Upwork and LinkedIn outreach while keeping internal systems, pipelines, and records organized. This is an ideal opportunity for someone with prior experience in lead generation, B2B prospecting, or sales support who is looking to grow into a long-term full-time role based on performance.



Key Responsibilities



Lead Generation & Prospecting (Primary Focus)

• Research and identify qualified prospects based on target industries and client profiles

• Send customized proposals on Upwork using templates and guidelines

• Conduct daily LinkedIn outreach (connections, follow-ups, DM conversations)

• Maintain and update prospect lists in spreadsheets or CRM

• Qualify inbound leads and flag strong opportunities

• Track outreach activity and response rates



Sales Support

• Assist with prospect communication and follow-ups

• Schedule intro calls and discovery meetings

• Keep sales pipeline organized and updated

• Document notes from conversations and handoffs



Administrative Support

• Send monthly client invoices

• Maintain basic bookkeeping records (expenses, payments, invoice tracking)

• Organize internal files, trackers, and documents

• Maintain Upwork profile activity and job application consistency



Required Skills & Qualifications (Highly Important)

• Prior experience in lead generation, outbound prospecting, or Virtual Assistant role at least 4+ years doing lead gen and admin works

• Hands-on experience with Upwork proposals and LinkedIn outreach workflows

• Strong written English communication skills

• Highly organized and detail-oriented

• Able to work independently and follow structured processes

• Reliable internet connection and consistent availability



Tools Proficiency Requirement

• Upwork

• LinkedIn (Sales Navigator is a plus)

• Google Sheets / Excel

• Basic CRM systems

• Google Workspace (Docs, Drive, Calendar)



Nice to Have

• Background in marketing or B2B service-based businesses

• Experience using prospecting tools or CRM systems

• Basic understanding of PPC or digital marketing terminology

• Experience with contact list building and data enrichment

• Basic proposal or case study formatting skills



How to Apply

Please submit your application including:

• A short summary of your lead generation experience

• Tools you’ve used for outreach and prospecting

• Your availability (hours per week)

• Examples of outreach messages or proposals you’ve written (if available)

• Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the next step.

title: Sales Assistant/Virtual Assistant
description:
Role Summary

Inova Solutions Consultancy is a UK based company, seeking a proactive and results-driven Lead Generation & Client Acquisition Specialist to help identify, qualify, and convert potential clients for our digital solutions business. You will be responsible for researching small to medium businesses, initiating outreach 
, LinkedIn, calls where appropriate), booking qualified discovery calls, and maintaining our lead pipeline.

This is a hands-on role ideal for someone who understands outreach, sales development, and how to communicate value clearly to prospective clients. The initial contract is subject to 3 months with the opportunity to a permanent role based on performance and revenue impact.



Key Responsibilities

Identify and research high-potential SMBs/startups that align with Inova’s service offerings (websites, SEO, automation, apps, AI solutions).

Build targeted prospect lists using the right tools.

Qualify leads based on needs, budget, timeline, and fit with Inova’s service offerings.

Book discovery calls for the Founder and maintains follow-up sequences.

Manage and update CRM systems, pipelines, and outreach trackers.

Look to continually improve conversion rates.

Provide weekly insights on outreach results, lead quality, and conversion performance.

Coordinate with the Founder to adjust ICP, messaging, and targeting based on results.







Essential Skills & Experience (Required)

Proven experience in lead generation or SDR (Sales Development Representative) roles.

Strong understanding of outbound sales methodologies 
 sequences, cold messaging, LinkedIn outreach).

Ability to research and identify relevant businesses that match defined ICP criteria.

Excellent written communication skills with the ability to craft compelling outreach messages.

Strong organisational and time-management skills.

Ability to analyse outreach metrics and suggest data-driven improvements.

Desirable Skills (Not Essential but Beneficial)

Experience in the digital services or SaaS industry (web development, automation, AI, or marketing).

Knowledge of SMB/startup markets and their common operational challenges.

Ability to run cold
 infrastructure (domains, warming, inbox management).

Experience with social selling and personal branding support for founders.

Understanding of ICP building, segmentation, and outbound marketing strategy.

Previous experience booking meetings for agencies or consulting businesses.



Working Arrangement

37 hours per week (5 full working days).

Remote working for UK TIME BASE (GMT)

Flexible framework as long as weekly KPIs and deliverables are met.

title: Product Research Manager – Amazon
description:
Work Schedule: 8:00 AM – 4PM UK TIME (4:00 PM – 12:00 AM PHT)

Salary: $500 - $800



We’re looking for an experienced Product Research Manager who is responsible for identifying profitable product opportunities for the Amazon marketplace. This role involves conducting market research, analyzing competitors, evaluating trends, and selecting products with strong sales and margin potential.



Responsibilities:

• Conduct product research using tools such as Helium 10, Jungle Scout, Keepa, etc.

• Identify high-demand, low-competition product opportunities.

• Analyze competitors’ listings, pricing, reviews, and sales performance.

• Evaluate product profitability including costs, fees, and margins.

• Track market trends and seasonal demand.

• Provide product recommendations backed by data and insights.

• Work closely with sourcing, branding, and marketing teams.

• Monitor product performance after launch and suggest improvements.



Requirements:

• 2+years of experience in Amazon product research or e-commerce.

• Strong understanding of Amazon FBA model.

• Experience with Amazon research tools (Helium 10, Jungle Scout, etc.).

• Strong analytical and data interpretation skills.

• Good knowledge of Amazon fees, pricing strategy, and profit calculation.

• Attention to detail and ability to identify winning products.

s, understands context, and drives our project management automatically.



We need a Technical Workflow Architect who can think in logic, not just click buttons. You will be responsible for connecting our "Brain" (AI) to our "Hands" (
 & Google Workspace) and our "Wallet" (QuickBooks Online).



Our Tech Stack (You Must Be Expert in These)

 (formerly Integromat) – Must know Iterators, Aggregators, JSON parsing, and Error Handling.

 – Must know Board structures, Webhooks, and column mapping.

.

title: AI UGC Video Editor (Meta Ads)
description:
Hope Rings is looking for a Senior AI UGC Video Editor who can build high-converting Meta ads using AI-generated avatars combined with real product b-roll.



This is not a basic editing role.



You will be responsible for:



- Creating ultra-realistic AI UGC creator videos

- Generating AI voiceovers

- Using tools like HeyGen, ElevenLabs, Google Gemini (or similar)

- Blending AI avatar footage with real product b-roll

- Editing Meta-native ads optimized for performance



We are looking for someone with:



- 3+ years of direct e-commerce paid ad editing experience

- Strong understanding of Meta ad creative structure

- Experience using AI tools in production workflows

- Ability to move fast while maintaining realism



This is a performance-driven role. We care about conversion, retention, and realism, not flashy effects.



Important Application Instruction



To show you can follow instructions, please write the word “AVATAR” at the beginning of your application message.



Applications without this word will be automatically declined.



Who Is a Good Fit?



1. Has 3+ years of paid ads editing experience for e-commerce brands

2. Has experience editing Meta 
/Instagram) ads specifically

3. Has used AI tools such as HeyGen, ElevenLabs, ArcAds, Midjourney, Gemini, or similar

4. Understands customer psychology and emotional storytelling

5. Can regenerate, refine, and polish AI output until it looks realistic

6. Works fast and delivers consistently

7. Can collaborate closely with a Creative Strategist



Your Core Responsibilities



1. AI UGC Avatar Production



- Generate realistic avatar photos (Gemini or similar)

- Create AI voiceovers (ElevenLabs or similar)

- Use HeyGen (Photo-to-Video, Product Placement, UGC Ad Video)

- Regenerate outputs until realism is high



2. Meta Ad Assembly



- Blend AI talking head with real b-roll

- Add product shots and lifestyle visuals

- Structure ads using proven Meta format:

- Hook (0–3 seconds)

- Story

- Product introduction

- Emotional payoff

- Offer + CTA



3. Creative Variations



- Produce multiple hook variations

- Maintain same structure while testing different openings

- Deliver 3–5 variations per concept



4. Speed + Volume



- Produce 2–5 ads per day once trained

- Work inside structured briefs

- Follow naming and tracking systems



Tools You Will Be Using



- HeyGen (Photo-to-Video, UGC Ad Video, Product Placement)

Compensation



This role can turn into a full-time position paying:



$1,200–$2,500 USD per month, based on skill level, speed, and output quality.



High performers will have room for raises and long-term growth.

 and cold/warm calling campaigns.

- Outreach Experience: Proven ability to manage professional cold and warm outreach via phone and
.

, CRM, LinkedIn).



How to Apply

title: Senior Graphic Designer – Clean, Premium, Brand-Driven Image Ads
description:
Job Description:



We’re looking for a graphic designer with strong visual judgment and taste, not an execution-only profile.

This role is for someone who thinks before designing, understands visual hierarchy, and has real experience creating ads for Meta Ads, with a clear focus on conversion, not just aesthetics.

You should know how to target the ideal customer, structure the visual message correctly, and create strong, conversion-driven headlines, aligned with a premium, veterinary-grade brand.

If you need step-by-step instructions for layout, spacing, or hierarchy, this role is not a good fit.



What you’ll design:



· Image ads / infographics for Meta Ads

· Product-focused visuals (premium, clean, professional)

· Clear hierarchy: headline ? key benefit ? product

· Ads aimed at pet owners, emotional but serious

· Headlines designed to capture attention and convert

· Creatives built for ad performance, not just to look nice



What we expect from you:



· Proven experience designing ads for Meta Ads

· Strong sense of visual hierarchy and layout

· Ability to think like an advertiser, not just a designer

· Good judgment for headlines and key messaging

· Clean, modern, professional design style

· Ability to make independent design decisions

· Strong attention to spacing, balance, and clarity

· Comfortable working without micro-instructions



Schedule:

· 2 hours per day, Monday to Friday

· Real possibility to increase hours in the future

· Goal: build a long-term, stable collaboration



IMPORTANT

This is NOT an execution-only role.

You are expected to:



· Think through the visual structure before designing

· Propose clean, professional solutions

· Apply design principles naturally

· Understand the commercial and conversion goal of each image ad



? We are not looking for simple Canva-style designs.

? Template-based portfolios will not be considered.



How to apply (very important)

Please include:

1. Your portfolio (ideally real Meta Ads examples)

2. A short answer to this question:

If you had to design an image ad for a premium veterinary product on Meta Ads, what would you prioritize visually and in terms of messaging to drive conversions, and why?



Applications without this answer will not be reviewed.

title: Part Time Digital Marketing Project Manager
description:
Remote | UK Hours | 5 to 10 hours per week



About The Role



We are a growing performance marketing agency managing paid social campaigns for lead generation and ecommerce clients.



We are looking for an experienced Project Manager to oversee client delivery, keep campaigns on track, and ensure deadlines are consistently met.



This is not an admin role. You must have prior agency experience managing marketing projects.



Responsibilities



• Manage timelines across multiple client accounts

• Coordinate between media buyers, creatives, and copywriters

• Track deliverables and ensure deadlines are hit

• Oversee onboarding of new clients

• Ensure weekly and monthly reports are delivered on time

• Maintain task boards in ClickUp, Asana, or similar

• Identify risks or bottlenecks early

• Keep founders updated with clear summaries



Hours



5 to 10 hours per week

Flexible schedule but must be available during UK working hours



Requirements



Must have:



• Experience working in a marketing or advertising agency

• Experience managing multiple client projects simultaneously

• Strong organisational and communication skills

• Ability to confidently follow up and chase tasks



Ideal:



• Understanding of
 Ads and paid social

• Familiar with metrics such as CPA, ROAS, CTR

• Experience with Slack and project management tools



What Success Looks Like



• Deadlines consistently met

• Clients feel organised and supported

• Clear visibility across all live accounts

• Founder not involved in day to day task chasing



Pay



Competitive hourly rate based on experience



How To Apply



Please send:



• A short introduction

• Examples of agency projects you have managed

• Tools you have used

• Your hourly rate

• Your availability



If you want, I can now build a short screening process to quickly filter serious candidates from time wasters.

title: Marketing Strategy Consultant (With Working SEO Knowledge)
description:

title: Online English/World History Teachers (Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: Senior Brand Designer (Product, Packaging, Retail & Digital)
description:
About: We are Spartan Bicycles (
). Please take a look at our website and our Instagram 
 before applying so you understand our visual style. We are looking for a Creative Lead who can handle both the creative side (making the brand look exciting) and the technical side (ensuring our packaging and presentations are flawless).



The Role: You will be our "Brand Guardian." You will ensure that a Spartan bike looks just as good on a muddy trail (A+ Content) as it does on a retailer's shelf (Packaging).



Key Responsibilities:



Retail & Packaging (Technical):



Designing packaging, manuals, hang-tags etc.



Creating Planograms (shelf mockups) to show major retailers how our products should be displayed.



Crucial: You must be the "last line of defense" for details. You will check warning labels, barcodes, and specs before files go to print.



Experience in working with Disney/Mattel style guides a plus.



Digital Marketing (Creative):



Designing premium Amazon A+ Content and Brand Store layouts.



Creating high-converting ad visuals for Social Media (Meta/Instagram).



Designing the bicycle/scooter/helmets/accessories colorways, decals, artworks.



Building the brand story through cohesive product design.



B2B Presentations (Business):



Building professional PowerPoint Pitch Decks for our sales team.



Creating different decks for different clients (e.g., a "Corporate Fleet" deck vs. a "Kids Bike" deck for a toy store).



General Duties:



Plus any other tasks assigned by the Company to support marketing, sales, or operations as business needs evolve.



Requirements:



Experience: 5+ years in Graphic Design (specifically with Physical Products/Retail).



Software: Expert in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, and PowerPoint.



Attention to Detail: You treat a typo on a package as a serious error.



English: Fluent written and spoken English is required.



Terms & Legal:

Intellectual Property: All creative work, source files, designs, and concepts produced during your employment will be the sole property of Spartan Bicycles. You will be required to sign a Work for Hire / IP Waiver agreement upon hiring.



How to Apply (Please follow these steps exactly):



Send an message with the subject line: "Spartan Designer Application - [Mention Your Favorite Font]"



Portfolio: Send a link to your portfolio. Explicitly point out 3 things:

- One example of Packaging/Print work.

- One example of Digital/Web layout (A+ content or Landing Page).

- One example of a Presentation Deck (or a multi-page layout).



In your message, please answer this briefly:

"When designing packaging for a retail product, what is the #1 technical mistake you see other designers make (e.g., regarding colors, text, or layout)?"

title: Senior Amazon PPC Specialist
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Amazon PPC Specialist to join our team and take ownership of the planning, execution, and optimization of advertising campaigns across our Amazon accounts. You will work closely with our e?commerce and product teams to drive profitable growth and ensure our brands dominate their target niches. 





Key Responsibilities



? Plan, build, and optimize Amazon PPC structures (Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, Sponsored Display) across multiple marketplaces.

? Conduct in?depth keyword research using Datadive and Helium10 and translate findings into actionable campaign structures.

? Use Xnurta and Scaleinsights for PPC management, performance monitoring, and optimization workflows.

? Perform ongoing data analysis of search terms, ASIN performance, and placement reports to identify growth and efficiency opportunities.

? Monitor and adjust bids, budgets, and targeting on a daily/weekly basis to hit ACoS/ROAS and profitability targets.

?Troubleshoot and resolve campaign issues (disapprovals, delivery problems, attribution anomalies, odd CPC spikes, etc.).

? Develop and test optimization hypotheses (bidding strategies, match types, negative keyword concepts, placement adjustments).

? Create clear performance reports and dashboards, and derive concrete action plans from the data.

? Collaborate with listing optimization, content, and operations to ensure ads, creatives, and product pages work together effectively.

? Stay up to date with Amazon Ads updates, beta features, and marketplace changes, and proactively apply them to our accounts.





What we expect from you



? You are dedicated to your tasks, dig deep into the numbers, and follow through until issues are fully resolved.

? You are comfortable making data?driven decisions, testing new approaches, and clearly explaining your reasoning.

? You value transparency, provide regular updates without being asked, and take accountability for both wins and losses.





What We Offer



? Hourly pay between 10–15 USD, depending on experience and skills.

? 20–40 working hours per week, with flexibility to increase or decrease within this range depending on workload.

? The opportunity to own and shape Amazon PPC strategies for growing brands.

? A collaborative, performance?driven environment with flat hierarchies and fast decision?making.

? Access to premium PPC/SEO and analytics tools.

? Flexible, remote work setup and a results?oriented culture.





If you are an experienced Amazon PPC expert who loves data, takes responsibility seriously, and wants to have a direct impact on business results, we’d love to hear from you!
salary: 10–15 USD, depending on experience and s

title: Project Coordinator with Architecture / Interior Design / Hospitality Procurement background
description:
Bluebird Lighting is growing! We are a market leader in custom lighting solutions for high-end hospitality, commercial, and retail projects. With headquarters in the United States and teams in China and the Philippines, we are building a globally connected organization focused on innovation, ownership, and continuous learning. We empower our tea
mbers to grow alongside the company, take on meaningful responsibility, and contribute to projects that make a visible impact.



Please complete this form to proceed with your application : 



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Project Coordinator to support the execution of domestic and import projects. Reporting to the Project Manager, this role is responsible for day-to-day coordination, documentation, and communication—serving as the main point of contact for China-based manufacturing teams to ensure smooth project execution.



This position is ideal for someone looking to build a strong foundation in project management while gaining hands-on experience working with overseas manufacturers, technical documentation, and global logistics.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Support the Project Manager with day-to-day coordination of assigned import projects



Serve as the primary point of contact for China manufacturing teams, coordinating production updates, documentation, timelines, and questions



Communicate manufacturing updates, risks, and delays clearly and escalate promptly to the Project Manager and internal teams



Maintain and update project trackers, schedules, documentation, and status reports



Assist in preparing quotations, invoices, and purchase orders based on client requests and manufacturer submittals



Coordinate communication between China-based manufacturers, sales teams, and internal stakeholders



Organize and track shop drawings, finish samples, and approvals, escalating discrepancies or concerns to the Project Manager



Track payments, approvals, and key milestones, following up as directed



Assist with quality control coordination, including documentation of product, packaging, and cargo reviews prior to shipment



Create and maintain accurate project records and milestones within internal filing systems and HubSpot CRM



Support shipping coordination with manufacturing teams, freight partners, and customers



Assist with project closeout and after-sales service tasks



Perform other related coordination and administrative tasks as assigned





MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS



1–2 years of experience in project coordination, project management, manufacturing, construction, or related fields



Bachelor’s degree required (Engineering, Interior Design, Architecture, Construction Management, or related fields preferred)



Ability to read and understand technical drawings (training provided as needed)



Strong organizational skills with high attention to detail



Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment



Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Google Suite, Adobe Acrobat, and CRM systems (CAD experience is a plus)



Strong written and verbal English communication skills



Comfortable working full time with occasional flexed hours to support China-based manufacturing timelines



Team-oriented, proactive, and eager to learn



Solutions-oriented mindset with the ability to flag issues early and clearly

Reporting to the Senior Project Manager, this role is responsible for day-to-day project ownership, cross-functional coordination, and customer communication, while escalating risks and complex issues as needed. The ideal candidate has solid project management experience, strong organizational skills, and the ability to balance customer expectations with manufacturing, logistics, and operational realities.

Work directly with manufacturing teams—primarily China-based partners—to ensure pricing, materials, and production methods align with approved budgets and specifications



Maintain and update project trackers, schedules, documentation, and regular status reports to ensure project visibility and alignment



Review shop drawings and finish samples against specifications, documenting discrepancies and coordinating revisions and approvals



Coordinate with customers and sales teams to secure timely approvals and payments for samples, materials, and shop drawings



Conduct or coordinate quality control reviews of products, packaging, and cargo prior to shipment



Maintain accurate project records, milestones, and documentation within internal filing systems and HubSpot CRM



Coordinate shipping logistics with manufacturing teams, freight partners, and customers



Manage project closeout, punch lists, and after-sales service for assigned projects



Support process improvements and best practices within the Project Management team



Perform other related duties as assigned



MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

3+ years of experience in project management, construction, manufacturing, or product development



Bachelor’s degree required (Engineering, Architecture, Construction Management, or related field preferred)



Strong ability to read and interpret technical drawings and specifications



Proven experience managing customer-facing projects



Ability to work full time with occasional flexed hours to support global manufacturing timelines



Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite, Google Suite, Adobe Acrobat, and CRM systems (CAD experience is a plus)



Excellent written and verbal English communication skills



Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines



Comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment



Team-oriented, reliable, and proactive



Solutions-oriented mindset with strong problem-solving skills

With headquarters in the United States and teams in China and the Philippines, we are building a globally connected organization focused on innovation, ownership, and continuous learning. Job title : Senior Project Manager

Location: Remote

Department: Project Management

Reports To: Director for Global Operations

Salary Range : To be discussed - Based on relevant experience



Please complete this form to proceed with your application : 



ABOUT THE ROLE 

We are seeking an experienced Senior Project Manager to lead the execution of complex import projects while managing and mentoring a team of Project Managers / Coordinators. You will be given ownership for the management of key accounts and high-profile clients in large-scale hospitality and commercial projects. This role requires a highly organized, solutions-oriented professional who excels in customer advocacy, cross-functional coordination, and global manufacturing environments.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES : 



Provide end-to-end oversight of multiple high-complexity projects, managing multiple concurrent timelines, stakeholders, and deliverables from pre-award through closeout and after-sales support



Identify risks and develop mitigation strategies, conducting regular risk assessments with the Director for Global Operations



Serve as a senior customer advocate, proactively coordinating and clearly communicating with customers, manufacturers, sales teams, and internal stakeholders to ensure alignment and timely execution



Act as an escalation point for complex project, vendor, or customer issues, providing solutions-oriented approach and expectation management



Guide and support a team of Project Managers / Coordinators by overseeing the maintenance of project trackers, deliverables, project documentation, schedules, regular status reports, and client communications to ensure accuracy, consistency, and best practices



Partner closely with China-based manufacturing teams to ensure pricing, materials, and production methods align with client budgets, specifications, and quality standards



Build and review quotations, invoices, and purchase orders based on client requests, specifications, and manufacturer submittals



Contribute to continuous improvement of project management processes, templates, and workflows



Lead thorough reviews and approvals of shop drawings, finish samples, and mockups against specifications, documenting discrepancies and driving resolution



Conduct or oversee quality control reviews of products, packaging, and cargo prior to shipment, ensuring compliance with specifications and company standards



Oversee the creation and maintenance of company records, project milestones, and documentation within internal filing systems and HubSpot CRM



Coordinate shipping logistics with manufacturing teams, freight partners, and customers, proactively identifying and mitigating risks or delays



Manage project closeout, punch lists, and after-sales service, ensuring customer satisfaction and long-term relationship building



Perform other relevant duties as assigned by the company





MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS



5+ years of experience in project management, construction, manufacturing, or procurement, with increasing responsibility



PMP certification a plus



Demonstrated experience leading or mentoring Project Managers or junior tea
mbers



Bachelor’s degree required (Master’s degree in Business, Engineering, or Architecture is a plus)



Strong experience reading and interpreting technical drawings and specifications



Proven customer-facing experience with strong client advocacy and relationship management skills



Ability to work full time with occasional flexed hours to support global manufacturing timelines



High level of computer literacy, including Microsoft Office Suite, Google Suite, Adobe Acrobat, and CRM systems (CAD experience is a plus)



Excellent written and verbal English communication skills, including professional client correspondence



Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and consistently meet deadlines



Comfortable working in a high-growth, fast-changing environment with minimal supervision



Team-oriented leader and effective cross-functional collaborator



Solutions-oriented mindset with the ability to communicate issues, risks, and proposed resolutions clearly and in real time to leadership, internal teams, and external partners

title: Sourcing Specialist/Recruiter - US Healthcare (Remote/night shift)
description:
Job description

VitaWerks is looking for a seasoned Healthcare Recruiter with experience in hiring for Clinical roles like RN and Allied Healthcare professionals like ST, OT, PT to join our team. In this role, your responsibilities will include (but not limited to):



RESPONSIBILITIES:

Proactively source candidates via databases, LinkedIn, cold outreach, and professional networks.

Create and post ads on industry job boards, social media, and agency platforms.

Evaluate client requirements and match them with suitable candidates, ensuring a strong alignment between the candidate's skills and the client's needs

Creating and submitting HCP profiles on various platforms 

Conduct market research to stay informed about industry trends, salary benchmarks, and competitor activities, providing valuable insights for client engagements

Providing recruitment reports to team managers

Establishing relationships with other businesses/sources that can provide a good pipeline of HCP.



ABOUT YOU:

We require professionals who meet the following requirements:

Experience is sourcing healthcare professionals

Ability to work independently without policing

Detail-oriented and proficient with Microsoft office

Good communication skills, excellent telephone presence, and creative thinking

Experience working with vendor management platforms like Careerstaff, Vector etc.



ABOUT US:

Vitawerks, Inc is a technology and services company helping solve the staffing issues plaguing the healthcare industry. We use technology to help healthcare providers find the best opportunity. We help Healthcare Facilities easily fill available shifts with higher productivity and no administrative burden.

PAY:

Negotiable

title: Outbound Sourcer (remote 100%)
description:
Compensation



$600–$700 USD per month (base salary, depending on experience)



Performance-based bonus (based on overall contribution and hiring success)



Terms



100% remote – Philippines-based



Monday–Friday: 12:00 PM – 9:00 PM Polish time (CET)



Weekends off



13th Month Salary (after one year)



Paid holidays: Christmas, New Year, Easter



+ 5 days Paid Time Off (PTO)



Are you passionate about sourcing and connecting with people?



Do you enjoy research, outreach, and starting conversations with candidates — especially those who aren’t actively looking for a job?



We’re looking for a Philippines-based Outbound Sourcer to join our team fully remote. You’ll support our recruitment efforts by finding and engaging great candidates across the USA, India, the Philippines, and Poland.



We care more about finding the right people than hitting numbers. Your work will be evaluated by the quality of candidates and the strength of the pipeline — not volume.



There’s room to grow here — from sourcing into full-cycle recruitment, with mentoring and support from our team.



What You’ll Be Doing



Sourcing candidates for international roles in the USA, India, the Philippines, and Poland.



Using LinkedIn and other sourcing tools to identify suitable candidates.



Sending personalized outreach messages and building genuine connections.



Maintaining organized candidate lists and talent pipelines.



Working closely with Recruiters to support current and future hiring needs.



Who We’re Looking For



This role is a great fit if you:



Have 1–3 years of experience in sourcing, recruitment support, or talent research.



Are comfortable using LinkedIn for candidate sourcing.



Have strong written English communication skills.



Are detail-oriented, reliable, and well-organized.



Can work independently and manage your time effectively in a remote setup.



Nice to have:



Experience supporting international hiring.



Background in recruitment, HR support, or virtual assistance.



E-commerce or corporate environment experience.



Most importantly:

You enjoy helping people, doing thoughtful work, and being part of a supportive team.



Why You’ll Love Working With Us



Stable, long-term role in a company with 35+ years of history.



Supportive, people-first team culture.



Clear expectations and a healthy work-life balance.



Real opportunity to grow into a Recruiter role over time.



A company that values loyalty, quality work, and long-term relationships.



About Us




 is a leading online jeweler based in Boynton Beach, Florida.

For over 35 years, we’ve helped customers around the world choose beautiful diamonds and fine jewelry — earning 3,000+ 5-star reviews.



We believe in quality, care deeply about people, and build long-term relationships with both our customers and our team.



Important



This role is open to candidates currently based in the Philippines and is 100% remote.

title: Project-Based Website & PDF Cleanup (B2B / GoDaddy Website)
description:

• Create or improve 1 service page

• Add clear calls-to-action (request pricing, contact us)

• Verify contact form routing

• Install and configure Google Analytics 4

Future Work:

Successful completion may lead to additional paid projects or part-time work.

title: Excel - Power BI - Copilot Data Manager
description:
Hello and good day - 



I am an experienced and favorable employer for Philippine workers!  I have several wonderful Philippine employees for the last 3 years and I need one more!



I am a straight talker, and easy to work with.  I need your help managing data that I receive via excel.  I need the data to be quality reviewed, sorted and only qualified data to be accepted and dropped into a power BI app.  I need you to take some of the reports from power BI and run it through co-pilot and enter it into a different data base. 



I will teach you what to look for, what to identify and what needs consideration to make decisions.  I will make sure you receive all the training you need to be successful.  In return, I need you to have excellent English reading/writing and good verbal English. You must have experience with excel and other data bases, this is a must.   I need you to think about what the task is and why you are performing it so that you understand the process.  It will take a little time to learn but I am very patient for good honest people who work hard.  You need a very good computer and access to wifi.  I will provide the Microsoft account.  



I pay on time, and understand the value of rewarding people for quality work.  This is not an entry level position, it is a senior data position and you will work directly with the President of operations. 



To apply, attach a resume with detail work experience directly with excel and data bases.  Faster consideration will be applied with demonstration of knowledge and abilities via a short video.

title: E-Commerce Shopify Store
description:
We're building a clean, user-friendly Shopify store selling physical video games and accessories (Nintendo Switch, PS5, Xbox, etc.). The focus is on great design and smooth experience – easy browsing/search on mobile (Amazon-like vertical list) and desktop (grid layout). Customers shop normally: add to cart, checkout with their freight forwarder address (we'll add a simple account feature to save it).

I have detailed React/JSX mockups (attached: desktop_store_mockup.jsx and mobile_store_mockup.jsx) that show exactly how the site should look and feel. These were prototyped in Claude AI use them as the primary reference for a pixel-perfect implementation.

This is a standard shopping store – no complex backend. Start with a premium theme (e.g., Impulse or similar, your recommendation) and customize to match the mockups. Prioritize fast loading, smooth interactions (e.g., quick "Added" feedback, sliding banner), and responsive design.

Key Features to Implement (Directly from Mockups):



Design & Layout:

Branding: "pushstartplay" logo styling.

Orange accents (#FF9900 for buttons/CTAs), platform colors (e.g., red for Switch).

Mobile: Vertical product list, bottom nav, pull-up cart (like Amazon).

Desktop: 4-column grid, sticky header, side-drawer cart.



Header:

Logo, search bar, forwarder shipping display (e.g., "Shipping to: Aeropost Box #12345"), Account, Cart summary (items, price, total weight in lbs).



Hero Banner:

Auto-sliding carousel with titles, subtitles, CTAs, dots/arrows.



Product Browsing:

Platform filter chips (All, Switch, PS5, etc.).

Product cards: Image/box art placeholder, title, rating/stars, price (with discounts), weight (lbs), "New" badge, platform tag, badges (Best Seller/Deal).

"Add to Cart" button (yellow ? green on add, with brief animation).

"Final Sale" note on cards.



Cart:

Drawer (desktop) or overlay (mobile).

Item list with qty adjust, remove, per-item weight.

Totals: Count, subtotal, total weight (highlighted).

"All Sales Final" note + Checkout button.



Simple Custom Touches:

Account section: Let customers save freight forwarder name/address/box # (use metafields or free app).

Display/edit forwarder in header/cart/checkout.

Product fields: Add weight (lbs) for cart calculation.



Standard Shopify Stuff:

Product pages, search, checkout (with forwarder address hint).

Footer policies (emphasize "All Sales Final").

Upload 10-20 sample products for testing.





Deliverables:



Fully functional store matching mockups (responsive, smooth).

Theme files uploaded/customized.

Basic testing (mobile/desktop browsers).

2-3 revision rounds.

Handover notes.



Timeline: 3-6 weeks.

Freelancer Requirements:



Shopify expert with custom theme experience.

Portfolio of clean, modern eCommerce sites (gaming/retail a plus).

Skilled in Liquid, JS, sections/metafields.

Great communication share progress screenshots often.



We plan on using plugins like Store Migration to use our eBay store for products, we are also looking for plugins to make the website account / password protected as this site will have two functionaloties... 1) 
 will be the password protected site for accounts only exporting internationally and 2) 
 which will be the US site for US customers only no account required.



Attach the two JSX files.

Looking forward to a smooth, great-looking store!

title: Project-Based Virtual Assistant – GoHighLevel, Automation & Google Business Profile Expert
