    Calendars / booking

    GoHighLevel Chat AI bots

    GoHighLevel Voice AI bots

    Missed call notifications

    Review activation & 5-star review automation

    Complete and optimise all GoHighLevel SEO fields for each page (meta titles, meta descriptions, URL slugs)



- Set up automations behind forms, calendars, chatbots, and client communications

- Optimise and manage Google Business Profiles (setup, verification, services, photos, posts, messaging)

- Some projects may require guiding clients through their GoHighLevel system, including websites, chatbots, Voice AI bots, calendars, forms, and the mobile app. This can include demonstrations and answering questions, but most projects are technical setup only.

- Test, troubleshoot, and verify all systems, automations, and SEO settings are working correctly before marking the project complete

- Potential future tasks: invoicing automation, advanced workflow automations



Requirements:

-Fluent in English (written and spoken)

-Experienced in GoHighLevel, automation workflows, Voice AI and Chat AI bots

-Experienced in Google Business Profile optimisation

-Fast, reliable, detail-oriented, and able to work independently

-Capable of learning new tools quickly and following SOPs

-Must have prior experience implementing GoHighLevel Voice AI and Chat AI bots, ideally for client-facing communication



How to Apply:

Please submit:

1. Your application

2. A short Loom video (2–3 minutes) explaining why you are a great fit and showcasing relevant experience, especially any GoHighLevel Voice AI or Chat AI bot projects

3. Your project rate in USD, noting that the rate will depend on the size and complexity of each project (some include Voice AI / Chat AI bots, others may not)



We value speed, reliability, technical competence, and high-quality delivery. Only apply if you can deliver professional work independently.

title: VA for eCommerce Selling Platforms
description:
E-commerce Virtual Assistant – Amazon / Etsy / Shopify (Jewelry Experience Preferred)



We are a growing jewelry brand looking for an experienced E-commerce Virtual Assistant to manage and maintain product listings across Amazon, Etsy, and Shopify.



This is a long-term position for someone who already understands product-based e-commerce and can work with minimal training.



--------------------------------------------------



Key Responsibilities



- Create and upload product listings on Amazon, Etsy, and Shopify

- Format titles, descriptions, tags, bullet points, and product variations

- Manage variations (materials, sizes, colors, etc.)

- Upload and organize product images

- Maintain SKU structure and product data accuracy

- Update Google Sheets (pricing, product status, tracking)

- Review existing listings and fix errors or missing information

- Follow brand guidelines and structured workflows



--------------------------------------------------



Required Experience



- Hands-on experience with Amazon Seller Central and/or Etsy

- Experience creating full product listings (not only editing)

- Understanding of product SEO (titles, keywords, tags)

- Experience working with product variations

- Strong written English

- High attention to detail

- Comfortable working with Google Sheets



--------------------------------------------------



Strong Advantage



- Experience with jewelry, fashion, or accessories

- Experience with Shopify

- Experience with handmade or customizable products

- Familiarity with AI tools such as ChatGPT



--------------------------------------------------



Work Style Expectations



- Able to work independently with minimal supervision

- Accuracy and consistency are critical

- Do not guess — ask when something is unclear

- Organized, reliable, and detail-oriented

- Looking for a long-term position



--------------------------------------------------



Position Details



- Part-time to start (10–20 hours per week)

- Hourly pay based on experience

- Long-term role with growth potential

- Training and structured workflows provided



--------------------------------------------------



How to Apply



Please include the following in your application:



1. Links or screenshots of product listings you personally created (Amazon or Etsy)

2. Which platforms have you worked with and for how long

3. Have you worked with jewelry or fashion products? (Yes/No – please explain)

4. Rate your experience with product listing work (1–10)



To confirm you read this post carefully, please begin your application with the word "Gemstone" and include one example of a product listing you personally created.



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.

title: Social Media & Content Marketing Specialist for SaaS (Stagera)
description: We are Stagera, a fast-growing SaaS platform for event production companies, and we are looking for a long-term Social Media & Content Marketing Specialist who can plan, create, and manage all our content across channels, including writing and scheduling daily social posts, creating blog articles, and helping script Loom tutorials that showcase how to use our software in clear, engaging English. You will turn questions, problems, FAQs, and objections about Stagera and event production operations into educational content; manage a consistent content calendar; repurpose content across platforms; and research competitors so we are the first to publish useful material on key industry problems. title: Construction Estimator (with Executive Assistant exp is preferred)
description:
We are seeking a proactive, detail-oriented Construction Estimator to provide full-time, dedicated support for a residential construction business. This high-impact role focuses on commercial bid management, construction project support, administrative excellence, and executive communication. You will act as a key tea
mber—ensuring all bids, takeoffs, and follow-ups are managed efficiently while supporting multiple growth initiatives.



This role is ideal for someone resourceful, detail-obsessed, and confident navigating construction software, online portals, and complex workflows.



Responsibilities:



Manage the commercial bidding process from start to finish, including takeoffs, bid submissions, and follow-ups

title: Sales Development Representative (Enrollment Marketing)
description:
We’re looking for a Sales Development Representative to join a fast-growing enrollment marketing agency focused on driving qualified student sign-ups for education and training businesses across the U.S. This role sits at the front of the revenue engine, working inbound leads, qualifying prospects, and booking high-quality appointments for the sales team.



If you are hungry, confident on calls, and motivated by performance, this role offers a clear path to growth within a system that already works.



Why You’ll Want to Join

- You will be paid in USD (bi-monthly: every 15th and 30th)

- Up to 14 days of Paid Time Off annually (starting Day 1)

- Observance of Holidays per company guidelines

- 100% remote setup so you can work wherever you’re most productive

- Proven inbound lead flow system

- Direct collaboration with experienced sales leadership

- Clear opportunity to grow into closing or senior sales roles

- Performance-driven culture focused on outcomes, not busywork

-Commission-based structure



What You’ll Work On

Inbound Lead Qualification

- Respond to qualified inbound leads generated through paid media funnels

- Conduct outreach via phone, SMS,
, and CRM workflows

- Qualify prospects based on predefined criteria

- Identify readiness, urgency, and alignment before booking calls



Appointment Setting and Calendar Management

- Book qualified prospects onto sales calls

- Confirm attendance and reduce no-shows

- Follow up consistently with warm prospects who need additional touchpoints

- Keep pipelines moving without letting leads stall



CRM and Process Discipline

- Maintain accurate records of conversations and outcomes

- Follow established scripts and workflows while adapting to real conversations

- Track activity metrics and performance benchmarks

- Collaborate with the Director of Sales to improve conversion rates



Performance and Accountability

- Hit appointment-setting and show-up targets

- Operate within a structured sales system

- Stay coachable and open to feedback

- Bring energy and urgency to daily outreach activity



What You Bring

- 2+ years of experience in sales, appointment setting, or SDR roles

- Experience working inbound or warm leads

- Strong verbal English communication with confidence on calls

- Comfortable speaking with founders, operators, or business owners

- Ability to follow a proven sales process

- Self-motivated and performance-driven mindset

- Comfortable working within a commission-based structure



Nice to Have

- Experience in marketing agencies, education businesses, or high-ticket services

- Familiarity with CRM tools and workflow automation platforms

- Experience booking calls for high-ticket offers

- Understanding of enrollment funnels or webinar-based sales processes



How to Apply

Please include:

1. Your updated resume

2. A short 1–2 minute Loom video introducing yourself and explaining your experience booking appointments or qualifying inbound leads



Only candidates who submit a Loom video will be considered.



If you are confident on the phone, motivated by performance, and ready to plug into a proven inbound system where your output directly impacts revenue, this role offers strong upside and clear growth opportunities.

title: Life Manager (Project Manager) - Remote Full Time
description:
Hello, we are looking to hire a life manager to support our agency and founder with the agency’s day-to-day operations



This is not a personal assistant role and not a traditional executive assistant role



You will help design, manage, and run systems across both work and personal life so everything operates smoothly, predictably, and with minimal mental overhead



The goal is not just to complete tasks, but to reduce decision fatigue, improve organization, and create leverage through systems, structure, and proactive execution





What success looks like in this role?



• Fewer things falling through the cracks

• Clear priorities every day and week

• Tasks and projects move forward without constant reminders

• Life and business logistics feel “handled”

• Less chaos, more clarity



If that sounds exciting to you, this role fits!



Core responsibilities



Daily / Ongoing



• Managing tasks, reminders, and follow-ups

• Keeping systems organized and up to date

• Tracking priorities and deadlines

• Proactively flagging issues or bottlenecks

• Communicating clearly and concisely



Weekly



• Light project management and coordination

• Reviewing open loops and unfinished items

• Improving existing systems and workflows

• Preparing summaries and updates



Ongoing improvement



• Creating structure where there is chaos

• Documenting processes

• Suggesting better tools or workflows

• Learning fast and adapting to new responsibilities





What we care most about (non-negotiables)



• Full-time dedication only

This must be your only professional role. No side jobs, no freelance work, no agencies.



• High loyalty and long-term mindset

We’re looking for someone who wants stability and growth together, not short-term gigs.



• Extreme attention to detail

You notice small things others miss. You double-check. You follow instructions exactly.



• Ownership mentality

You don’t wait to be told what broke. You flag it, fix it, and improve the system



• Always hungry to learn

You enjoy getting better, learning tools, and expanding responsibility





Skills and experience (flexible but important)



• Some project management experience

• Comfortable working with tasks, deadlines, and priorities

• Familiar with tools like Notion, ClickUp, Asana, Trello, Google Docs, or similar

• Strong written English

• Calm under pressure

• Organized and structured by nature



Experience matters less than how you think



Who this role is NOT for (this saves time)



This role is not a fit if:

• You want to juggle multiple jobs

• You only want to execute tasks you’re told

• You dislike structure, systems, or documentation

• You need constant supervision

• You prefer short-term work



Questions:



Question 1:

Are you comfortable working US (EST) time zone?



Question 2:

Why are you specifically looking for a full-time, long-term role instead of multiple clients or freelance work?



Question 3:

Why are you interested in this role specifically?



Question 4:

What previous experience do you have (work or personal) that would make you a good fit for this role?



Question 5:

What tools or systems have you used to stay organized in past roles?





Important:

To apply, start your application message with the word “Structure” on the first line.



Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed



Breakdown Of the Initial Days:



First 30 days:



• Execute tasks accurately

• Learn systems and expectations

• Build trust through consistency



After 60–90 days:



• Proactively manage systems

• Improve workflows

• Take ownership of recurring areas

• Act as a second brain, not just support

title: Account Management Virtual Assistant
description:
We’re Not Hiring an “Expert.” We’re Hiring Someone Reliable Who Follows Through.

(PLEASE DO NOT REPLY DIRECTLY TO THIS POST. IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO APPLY, FOLLOW THE STEPS AT THE END.)



Pay: Negotiable flat rate per 2-week period (USD), based on experience

Pay Timing: Paid once every 2 weeks. 80 hours per period, agreed upon at hire

Location: Remote (Philippines-based applicants only)

Role Type: Full-time | Long-term

Team Scope: Supports Account Managers across onboarding and client communications



Why This Role Exists

Great client experiences don’t happen because someone talks more.

They happen because someone makes sure nothing gets missed.



At Black Hat Strategy, onboarding sets the tone for the entire client relationship. When steps are skipped, delayed, or not followed up on, problems show up later as confusion or frustration.

We’re hiring an Account Management Virtual Assistant to support our Account Managers by ensuring:



Every onboarding step is completed

Every client request is acknowledged

Every Slack channel is monitored and followed up

Every detail is handled on time and to standard



You do not need prior account management experience.



You need:

The ability to learn processes

Strong follow-up habits

Clear written communication

Attention to detail



This role exists so:

Account Managers can focus on relationships and strategy

Clients feel supported and informed

Onboarding moves forward smoothly without bottlenecks



This is not a reactive support role.

This is a process ownership role.



What You’ll Actually Be Doing

You will not be improvising.

You will be working inside a clear system.

As an Account Management Virtual Assistant, you will:

Support Account Managers during client onboarding

Track onboarding tasks and deadlines inside ClickUp

Ensure all onboarding requirements are completed fully and on time

Monitor client Slack channels daily for messages, questions, or follow-ups

Make sure client requests are acknowledged and routed correctly

Follow up on open items until they are resolved or completed

Maintain high-quality documentation and task updates

Flag risks, delays, or missing information early



You are not expected to manage client strategy.

You are expected to keep the process tight.



This Role Is for Someone Who…

Is highly organized and detail-oriented

Enjoys checklists and structured workflows

Has experience as a Virtual Assistant, Admin Assistant, or Support role (helpful but not required)

Communicates clearly and professionally in writing

Follows processes without cutting corners

Takes pride in doing things right the first time



You don’t need to be an Account Manager.

You do need to be reliable, focused, and disciplined.



How You’ll Work With the Team

Account Managers own relationships… you ensure execution and follow-through

Project Manager enforces timelines… you keep onboarding tasks accurate and updated

Media Buyers and Specialists need clean handoffs… you help make that possible

Ops Head sets standards… you help uphold them daily



You are not operating alone.

You are part of a system.



Why You’ll Like Working Here

Clear responsibilities and expectations

Structured onboarding and workflows

No chaos, no guessing

Leadership that values organization and reliability

Long-term role with room to grow into Account Management



We don’t reward noise.

We reward follow-through.



Application Process

PLEASE DO NOT JUST REPLY TO THIS POST ON THE JOB BOARD.

To be considered, you must complete ALL STEPS BELOW.

The Google Form is your Online Interview.



Step 1: Take a short online IQ test



We respect intelligence and we think you probably do too.

Go to the Fast Learner Free IQ Test and complete it

Create a free account at the end

Save the results URL for Step 3

?? Applicants without a valid link will not be considered



Step 2: Record a 2–3 minute Loom video (camera ON)



Create a free account at Loom

Speak clearly in English

Tell us:

Your paid media experience

How you think about optimization and ROAS

How you’ve helped others improve performance

Save the Loom URL for Step 3



Step 3: Complete the Online Interview



NO AI ALLOWED. We want to hear you.

Open the Application Form

Enter your contact details

Paste:

IQ test results link

Loom video link

Answer all questions honestly and thoughtfully

Your answers matter more than perfect formatting.



Step 4: Live Video Interview (camera on)



This is where we get to know how you think.

I personally review every candidate who completes the steps above and will reach out directly to those who feel like the right fit.

If this role speaks to you, good.

That means you’re probably the kind of person we’re looking for.



Bring your best.

We’ll bring the system.



Link to Online Interview Form:

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 4a
description:
APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED: 





CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.



Note: All Remote Employees Must Be Available To Work During The Following Business Hours:

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Install various applications for product bundling when needed, and create product bundles. 

- Install tracking pixels on client’s websites

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

- Strong knowledge of HTML/CSS/Javascript/Shopify Liquid required. 

- Knowledge of Python and Ruby preferred but not required.

- 1+ years of web development (Shopify) experience required

- 1+ years of backend python (flask/django) development experience preferred but not required

- 1+ years of marketing agency experience preferred but not required

- Must be highly organized and possess strong attention to detail

- All applicants are encouraged to apply, regardless of experience or education



APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED:

title: Operations & Admin Assistant (Google Workspace + Social Media) — Part-Time to Full-Time
description:
Hello! Thank you for your interest.



---About NOPE Fitness---

We’re building a modern coaching company with a large fitness program pilot that we believe can scale significantly. We’re looking for a long-term operations/admin teammate who can grow with us as we expand.



---The Role---

This is a part-time role to start with a path to full-time as the business grows. You’ll help keep operations organized, work through data, build processes/SOPs, and support communication + social media workflows. Over time, you’ll “wear multiple hats” based on business needs.



---Schedule---

We primarily operate on US Eastern Time, but we can shift hours earlier to better fit Philippines time by a couple hours. 



---Responsibilities---

- Administrative support across day-to-day operations with high attention to detail

- Support our Google-based tech stack (Google Drive, Docs, Sheets; experience with tools like AppSheet / BigQuery / Squarespace / Webflow is a plus but not required)

- Document processes and build SOPs/checklists as we improve systems

- Assist with social media management (scheduling, light content support, coordination, editing, etc.)

- General operations support as priorities shift (you’ll be flexible and proactive)

- Ongoing management of client communications, primarily in written/text medium, but possibly also verbally



---Required Skills / Qualities---

- Strong admin skills and comfortable working with lots of data

- Familiar with Google Workspace; willing to learn new tools

- Excellent English communication (mostly written, but also spoken)

- Highly organized, responsible, and reliable

- Great at process-building and documentation

- Self-starter: you don’t need constant supervision

- AI/LLM proficiency (ChatGPT, etc.) for drafting, summarizing, and workflows



---Preferred---

-
 marketing experience

- Some graphic design skills 

- Website building/updates (Squarespace/Webflow or others)

- Interest and familiarity with personal fitness



---What success looks like---

- You quickly learn our workflows and keep tasks moving 

- Our data and admin systems become more organized and easier to operate

- We have clearer SOPs/checklists and smoother weekly operations

- Communication/support tasks are handled cleanly and consistently



---How to Apply: Please send:



- Your resume + a short message explaining why this role fits you

- Your weekly availability (include the hours you can overlap with US Eastern Time)

- A link to a 60–90 second Loom video introducing yourself in English

- Anything else you'd like to showcase, such as examples of SOPs/checklists you’ve created or any Sheets work



Thank you!

title: Talent Recruiter
description:
ProtusBrands is a growing portfolio of direct-to-consumer e-commerce brands. Our flagship brand, Ziella, is a personalized gifting leader in the US market — customized jewelry and gift sets that make thoughtful gifting effortless. We're expanding into new verticals, and building the team to scale multiple brands simultaneously. Remote-first, founder-led, currently 15 people heading to 25 + this year.



THE ROLE



We need a Recruitment Manager who owns hiring end-to-end. You'll find, screen, and close talent across creative and operations roles — video editors, creative strategists, CS agents, VAs, and project managers.



This is NOT an admin or coordinator role. You make hiring decisions. You design trial tasks. You manage agency relationships. When a hire doesn't work out, you figure out why and fix the process.



WHAT YOU'LL DO

  - Own full-cycle recruiting across all roles (5+ hires per quarter)

  - Build and manage talent pipelines — agencies + direct sourcing

  - Design trial tasks that actually predict on-the-job performance

  - Evaluate creative portfolios (video, design, writing) and make hire/no-hire calls

  - Partner with creative and ops leadership on hiring priorities

  - Track recruiting metrics and improve pass rates over time



  REQUIREMENTS — PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU MEET ALL OF THESE



  - 3+ years of recruiting experience, with at least 1 year in high-volume hiring (3+ hires/quarter)

  - Experience hiring for REMOTE, CONTRACTOR teams (not just local FTE roles)

  - Can evaluate creative work — you can watch a video edit or read a brief and articulate what's good/bad and why

  - Comfortable working asynchronously across CST and European timezones

  - Strong English communication (written and verbal)



BONUS POINTS



  - Previous recruiting at a creative agency, production company, or DTC/e-commerce brand

  - Experience hiring video editors or creative strategists specifically

  - Familiarity with performance marketing concepts (ROAS, CTR)

  - Active in creative talent communities



DO NOT APPLY IF:



  - Your recruiting experience is only corporate/local FTE hiring

  - You can't evaluate creative portfolios (this is a judgment role)

COMPENSATION

description:

Full-Time | Remote | Competitive Salary + PTO

The Amazon Whisperer is a fast-growing, full-service Amazon marketing agency that delivers profitable sales growth for consumer brands. We specialize in Amazon SEO, PPC, listing optimization, and catalog management, and we do it with systems, strategy, and speed. We’re looking for a PPC Specialist who wants to grow into a world-class media buyer by executing and managing high-performing Amazon ad campaigns.



The Role:



The PPC Specialist plays a hands-on role in the day-to-day execution of Amazon advertising campaigns. You’ll be responsible for uploading bulk files, adjusting bids and budgets, building campaigns, harvesting keywords, and ensuring PPC performance stays aligned with ACoS, TACoS, and budget targets. This is a perfect fit for someone who wants to master the technical side of Amazon ads and learn how to run efficient, scalable campaigns from the ground up.



You’ll work directly under the PPC Lead, taking direction on strategy while owning the implementation across multiple client accounts.



Responsibilities:

- Create new campaigns (SP, SB, SD) and restructure existing ones for efficiency

- Adjust bids, update budgets, and modify placement settings

- Harvest high-performing keywords and promote them into new campaigns

- Apply negative keyword targeting to eliminate wasted ad spend

- Track and maintain campaign health daily to ensure accounts remain within budget

- Monitor and flag issues with ACoS, TACoS, or unexpected spend spikes

- Harvest PPC data to support organic SEO initiatives

- Maintain clean data and reports in spreadsheets and tracking tools



Requirements:



- Minimum 2 years of Amazon PPC experience (SEO knowledge is a plus)

- Must be proficient in Google Sheets and Excel

- Clear communication skills for working with team leads and managers

- Reliable and organized, able to manage multiple campaigns without hand-holding

- Fast and reliable internet connection

- Fluent English (written and spoken)

- Ability to type 55+ words per minute



Company Culture:



At The Amazon Whisperer, we highly value transparency, communication, and trust. This is not just another job, it’s a place where your ideas are valued, hard work is rewarded, and growth opportunities are everywhere. We’re building a team that operates like a unit. - Competitive pay

- 13 days PTO (including public holidays)

- 100% remote work

- Opportunity to grow into roles like PPC Lead and beyond

- A collaborative and growth-minded team environment



Apply today and be part of a company that’s scaling fast and doing things differently in the Amazon space. We’re not looking for average. We’re looking for exceptional.

To make sure you actually read this:



Start your application with the word espresso



Applications without it will be ignored.



Please include:



- A direct link to your portfolio



### Trial Batch



Shortlisted candidates will be asked to complete **one test batch** to simulate our real workflow.



You’ll receive:



- Headlines

- Supporting copy

- Visual direction



You must create:



- 1 concept

- 3 different visual variations



AI tools are allowed for support (mockups, elements, etc.),



but fully AI-generated images will be automatically rejected for the trial.



We want real design thinking, not prompt outputs.



---



### One More Thing



We will prioritize applications that feel written by you.



Short, clear, human responses are better than long, generic essays that look like they were written by ChatGPT.



Keep it simple. Be real.



---



Looking forward to seeing your work.

title: Project Manager (Mobile Games)
description:
We’re looking for a **Project Manager** to drive execution and delivery for a remote, cross-functional team building a mobile game. This role sits at the intersection of product thinking and production discipline.



You will own sprint direction, Live Ops planning, backlog clarity, and release predictability while partnering closely with engineering, design, art, and QA. This is not a purely strategic roadmap role. You are responsible for translating product priorities into structured execution and ensuring updates ship on time with quality.



If you combine strong product instincts with operational rigor and thrive in fast-moving game environments, this role is a strong fit.



Why You’ll Want to Join

- You will be paid in USD (bi-monthly: every 15th and 30th)

- Up to 14 days of Paid Time Off annually (starting Day 1)

- Observance of Holidays per company guidelines

- 100% remote setup so you can work wherever you’re most productive

- High ownership role embedded directly with engineering and creative teams

- Work on a globally licensed football gaming platform



Timezone Requirement:

- Must be fully available in Central European Time

- Ability to maintain overlap with Pacific Time for cross-team collaboration



What You’ll Work On



Product Execution and Delivery

- Translate high-level product goals into clear sprint priorities

- Own backlog clarity, ticket structure, and acceptance criteria

- Ensure scope is realistic and aligned with release timelines

- Maintain delivery discipline across all disciplines



Live Ops Strategy and Cadence

- Own the Live Ops calendar and content release planning

- Balance feature work, events, and monetization updates

- Build structured processes to ensure repeatable execution

- Coordinate assets, QA gates, and approvals before launch



Cross-Functional Leadership

- Align engineering, design, art, and QA around clear outcomes

- Drive decision-making when tradeoffs arise

- Surface risks early and escalate blockers quickly

- Maintain 
ntum across time zones



Release Ownership

- Coordinate release readiness across builds and QA

- Ensure clear go or no-go decisions

- Oversee bug triage and prioritization

- Maintain release documentation and post-launch reviews



Data-Informed Iteration

- Monitor event performance and product KPIs

- Partner with analytics to validate feature outcomes

- Identify areas for tuning, optimization, and iteration



AI-Enhanced Workflow

- Use AI tools to accelerate documentation, specs, summaries, and process hygiene

- Improve internal workflows through lightweight automation



 What You Bring



- 2 to 5+ years of experience in product management or production within mobile casual or free-to-play games

- Direct exposure to Live Ops and scheduled content releases

- Strong understanding of F2P fundamentals including events, offers, retention, and monetization loops

- Experience working closely with engineering teams in sprint-based environments

- Comfort operating in ambiguity within startup settings

- Strong written communication and async collaboration skills

- Experience using Linear or similar product management tools



Nice to Have

- Experience working on licensed IP or sports-related games

- Familiarity with build and release pipelines

- Exposure to automated QA processes

- Experience reading dashboards and running basic performance analysis

- Experience balancing greenfield feature development with ongoing Live Ops



How to Apply



Please include:

1. Your updated resume

2. A short 1–2 minute Loom video explaining:

    - Your experience in mobile F2P product management

    - Your exposure to Live Ops cadence



Only candidates who submit a Loom video will be considered.





If you are product-minded but execution-obsessed, comfortable owning both backlog clarity and release discipline, and want to help scale a mobile football platform with global reach, this role offers meaningful ownership and real impact.

title: CUSTOMER SUPPORT MESSAGES
description:
We are a growing Whatnot-based e-commerce brand seeking a professional and reliable Virtual Assistant to manage text-based customer support and review management.



Job Title: Virtual Assistant – Text-Based Customer Support & Review Management (Whatnot)

Job Type: Remote | Part-Time / Full-Time

Platform: Whatnot



Job Overview



We are looking for a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to handle all customer communication via text messaging and marketplace chat systems on Whatnot. This role focuses on responding to customer inquiries, resolving order issues, requesting reviews, and improving overall seller ratings through professional reputation management.



The ideal candidate is calm under pressure, solution-oriented, and understands how to maintain a strong brand image through written communication.



Key Responsibilities



Text-Based Customer Support (Whatnot Platform)



Respond to all customer messages in a timely, professional manner



Handle inquiries related to orders, shipping, tracking, returns, refunds, and product questions



Resolve customer concerns efficiently while maintaining a positive tone



Escalate complex or sensitive issues when necessary



Maintain organized records of conversations and resolutions



Review & Reputation Management



Proactively follow up with customers via text to request honest reviews



Monitor reviews and seller ratings daily



Professionally respond to negative reviews and attempt resolution



Coordinate refunds, replacements, or solutions when appropriate



Identify recurring complaints and report trends to management



Brand Representation



Communicate in a consistent, professional, and brand-aligned tone



Ensure compliance with Whatnot platform policies



Protect and improve overall seller rating and customer satisfaction



Qualifications



Prior experience in e-commerce customer support (Whatnot experience preferred)



Strong written English communication skills



Comfortable handling all communication via text/chat (no phone support)



Ability to manage difficult customers professionally



Organized, detail-oriented, and self-motivated



Familiarity with review management best practices



Performance Expectations



Maintain response times within agreed SLA (e.g., under 12–24 hours)



Help improve overall review ratings



Maintain professional and policy-compliant communication



Track and report customer service metrics weekly



Preferred (Bonus)



Experience working with live-selling platforms



Familiarity with CRM or helpdesk tools



Experience improving seller ratings on marketplace platforms

description:
Hello there, thanks for taking the time to check our job post.



We are looking for a skilled and responsive full-time Video Editor with AI skills to create engaging AI-generated visuals (images and short videos) for our YouTube channels who can work full time (40-45 hours per week)



Channels for reference (similar to what we want to do):


 (World War niche)

MUST COMPLETE TO BE CONSIDERED:

- Create a 20-30 second sample video with the following requirements:

- Generate 4-5 AI images

- Add captions

- Show us how you validate the title/story promise (the first seconds are the hook, critical for engagement)

- Use any AI tools currently available to you, including free ones. Try your best to keep image/character consistency

- It's not about how good you can make an image transition, this is storytelling. Study the referenced channels!

/folder/SGRXGK4Y#X7GFXzDU4rTB9G-5j5-25Q, link with the audio file (story narration), text file with the story/script and the SOP (.pdf)

/file/LGgxCThQ#27BJPiLIqlchUI7fDhTAQF-DZxuIKtRbH-bw1A4rcGw

Hours: approx. 45 hours per week. We will be expecting 4-6 edited videos per day (of course exceptions may apply).

Good internet connection

AI Video Generation (Runway, Pika Labs, or similar)

Caption/Subtitle Creation

Strong attention to detail

This is not a job where you will only deliver videos and never hear from us. We will work together and improve together.

title: SIMPLE CAPTION WRITER
description:
READ THE BELOW OR YOUR APPLICATION WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED!



NOW HIRING: Caption Writer (Remote, Simple & Creative Task)



We are a growing online company and we’re currently looking for a reliable Caption Writer to join our remote team.



Your task will be simple: we provide you with the images and posting direction — you create engaging captions that match the content. The work is light, but we’re looking for someone with creativity and strong writing skills.



--- What the job includes:

• Writing engaging captions for social media posts

• Matching the tone and style we provide

• Delivering captions on time (according to our schedule)

• 100% remote work, done from your own device



--- Workload & Salary:



• Around 10 minutes per day (5–6 days per week)



• Monthly salary: 1,000 PHP



--- Requirements:

• You speak and write clear English

• You are creative and can think of engaging captions

• You are reliable and deliver on time

• You have a working laptop or PC and stable internet

• You can follow instructions and match a specific tone



--- No design or editing skills needed!

We provide the visuals — you focus only on writing the captions.



--- Who this is perfect for:

• Someone who enjoys writing

• People who want a simple remote side task

• Creative individuals who like social media

• Organized and reliable workers



TO APPLY:

Please answer the following questions:



- Are you available 5–6 days per week for short writing tasks?

- Do you have a reliable internet connection and working laptop/PC?

- How would you rate your English writing skills?



We’re excited to meet you and hopefully work together soon!

title: Sales Development Representative - Appointment Setter (Sales & Marketing)
description:
We are looking for a driven and goal-oriented Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing team. This role focuses on developing, nurturing, and managing your own pipeline. You will handle the full booking process—from prospecting and outreach to appointment setting, qualification, and confirmation.



As the first point of contact, you’ll set the tone for the sales experience and create strong opportunities for our Business Development Representatives (BDRs). If you’re proactive, organized, and confident in communicating with leads, we want to hear from you!



Key Responsibilities:

- Develop, build, and manage your own pipeline of prospects.

- Conduct outbound calls,
s, and message outreach to potential customers.

- Set, schedule, and confirm qualified appointments for the BDR team.

- Qualify prospects based on company criteria to ensure quality and readiness.

- Plan and organize daily work schedules to effectively target potential sales outlets.

- Maintain accurate records of interactions and appointments in CRM tools.

- Meet and exceed daily, weekly, and monthly performance metrics.

- Represent the company professionally and set the right tone for doing business.



Qualifications:

- 2+ years of experience in Sales, Appointment Setting, or Marketing (agency experience preferred)

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Strong organizational and time-management abilities.

- Comfortable with cold calling, objection handling, and high-volume outreach.

- Coachable, motivated, and results-driven mindset.

- Ability to work independently and manage your own workflow.

- Experienced using CRM software is a plus.



Bonus points if you have experience with:

- GoHighLevel

- Slack

- ClickUp



Tools We Use:

- Slack (for team communication)

- ClickUp (task management)

- GoHighLevel (CRM & funnel system)

- Google Sheets (for tracking & reporting)

- Apollo 
 outreach)



Compensation & Benefits:

$900 – $1,200 USD/month (based on experience and skill level)

Full-time (40 hours/week)

Paid Philippine holidays

13th-month pay

Performance bonuses

Long-term career growth

Fun, fast-paced, and supportive remote culture



About Grow Pro Agency



Grow Pro is a fast-growing digital marketing agency based in the U.S. (ranked on the Inc. 5000 list) that serves over 600 martial arts schools across North America.



We are specialists in paid ads (Google &
),
 automation, CRM systems, and lead generation campaigns that produce real results.



Founded by martial artist & school owner Cris Rodriguez, our agency understands our niche better than anyone — and our amazing team in the Philippines plays a huge part in that success.

title: SENIOR EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT TO FOUNDER
description:
30 APPLY POINTS REQUIRED FOR THIS JOB ROLE



ANYTHING UNDER 30 WILL NOT BE OPENED OR SENT TO MY MESSAGE INBOX



===============================================================================================



SENIOR EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT TO FOUNDER

Full-Time | Remote | $6 USD Per Hour

Company: Sindall Group

Schedule: Monday to Friday – 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM

Location: Remote

Pay: $6 USD per hour

Employment: Full-Time



Sindall Group is a fast-growing, performance-driven company building at a high level.



We are hiring a Senior Executive Assistant to work directly alongside the Founder as a true right-hand operator.



This is not a general admin role.

This is not a beginner VA position.



We are looking for someone sharp, highly organised, proactive, and commercially aware — someone who understands how to help run and support a serious business.



You will operate at the front of the company, ensuring execution, structure, and accountability across teams.



===================================================



YOUR ROLE



Act as the Founder’s right hand in daily operations

Manage schedules, priorities, and high-level tasks

Organise and prioritise
 communication

Follow up with tea
mbers to ensure deadlines are met

Track operational tasks and performance metrics

Improve systems and internal workflows

Identify problems early and implement solutions

Protect the Founder’s time and focus

REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

Experience in a structured, performance-focused company

Strong written and verbal English

Highly organised with strong attention to detail

Confident holding tea
mbers accountable

Professional maturity

Confidentiality

This is a career opportunity for someone serious about long-term stability and growth.
